description:
Haters gon' hate but Big Lantern is the bee's knees.

Who doesn't want greasy salty fried goodness at all hours of the night?! Hello garlic fried rice, send over general tso's chicken, save me some beef chow fun, don't hog the honey walnut shrimp, the green beans are my main source of fiber, and I'll eat anything eggplant. 

Q1: Is it authentic Chinese you ask? Is anything authentic Chinese after decades of exposure to Twinkies, bagel bites, Costco rotisserie chicken, and late night comedy specials on HBO?! Maybe I'm projecting a bit here but seems to me the real question is why is any restaurant named for something you'd buy in the outdoor garden section at Lowe's is being judged for its genealogy?

Q2: Is Big Lantern perfect? Is Brad Pitt even perfect?! Ok yes, Big Lantern has made me wait over 70 minutes for a 2 mile delivery, yes Big Lantern has hung up on me a couple times. But you know what? It was worth it and I relish the day when Brad returns my calls so I can compare. Please bring the dimsum combo when you come over Brad.
author: Cindy T.

description:
I was at a birthday party and they put out a small spread from Big Lantern. I arrived on Friday, October 12th around 8:15pm. I believe my girlfriend got all the food delivered.

*Combination Plate (For 2): Egg roll, fried prawns, crab puff and fried chicken wing
*Chicken Siu Mai
*Pork Siu Mai
*Steamed B.B.Q. Pork Bun
*Baked B.B.Q. Pork Bun
*Veg Dim Sum Combination (3 Each): Veg dumpling, meatless chicken siu mai and meatless BBQ pork bun

I looked up their menu online and I believe that's what was ordered. (There was another dumpling, but I wasn't sure what it was.) The pork shu mai was tasty. Especially with the hot sauce. The fried apps were standard. The egg roll crispy. Though I found the chicken wing a little dry.

Judging fron their online menu, they have a decent selection of dim sum. And even meatless options for those who are vegetarian. Not sure how authentic they are in house (I didn't see chicken feet or tripe), but an okay option for those not looking for the dim sum basics.
author: Elena N.

description:
Ate here after outside lands...

Pretty decent. Had a good dim sum combo for only $11 and some change.

Rating for the congee though. Soooo good! I recommend asking for fish sauce and mixing it in your porridge. Yum :)


I wish there was a Chinese spot that stays open late like this down by the peninsula. 

Great service too :)
author: Stephanie A.

description:
I just ordered today for delivery. The driver was super RUDE! Snatched the receipt out my hand and kept looking at me like he was mad at something. He didn't speak English , I couldn't understand him. I wish I didn't give him a tip when I started the order online. Super jerk! Not ordering from here anymore. 
The food isn't good anyways. I'll pass.
author: becca p.

description:
Delicious food with TONS of vegetarian options to choose from. There's literally a whole page on just meatless items plus more on rice, noodles, soups, salads and of course desserts.

I tried the meatless fish mandarin style with brown rice. It was delicious, just needed to acquire a taste to the fake fish taste.
There was eggplant and basil in the dish so it reminded me a little of Thai food without the MSG.
I'm allergic to that stuff so I don't do thai no mo'
author: JC M.

description:
One of the worst delivery I experienced. Not only did we wait more than 1 h but the food was cold and white frankly just bad.

Even though they made us wait 1h15 min they still wanted us to go down to pick up the food from them  (we were staying at a hotel) eventhough they charge a delivery fee and we pre-tipped.

Literally go to the grocery store and buy frozen dim sum and let it naturally thaw for 1.5h and it will taste better and be a lot cheaper.

I'm not a picky person too although the Chinese food in NYC is quite good. So maybe my standards are a bit high or SF standards are pretty low. Either way I don't recommend at all..

But overall the food was just gross honestly, cold and plastic like. Certainly not worth 30 bucks and waiting 1+h
author: Zei K.

description:
Stopped in here on the 4th of July, when few other restaurants on 16th St were open, and was pleasantly surprised!

We had a few items from the dim sum menu. The dim sum menu is pretty limited, but covers most of the "core" items you'd expect. Some items are better than others: the steamed pork buns were great, for example, as were the taro puffs (although my boyfriend took issue with the filling emphasizing vegetables over pork). The rice roll and chicken curry puffs, on the other hand, were a bit underwhelming and bland. Overall I enjoyed the food more than I expected to!

Prices were very reasonable and the servers were nice and attentive. Thank you, Big Lantern, for being there when I was hangry in a pinch!
author: Christine G.

description:
I always appreciate businesses that go the extra mile (check out the rating section).

Walked into this spot late last night (open until 11pm Sun-Wed/12am Th-Sat.) to meet my boo. They have long tables, which is great for ordering a large spread (which we definitely did). They have a *huge* menu- the server helped us determine what was vegan, and what proportions to order.

ORDERED sesame meatless chicken, turnip cake with meatless chicken, vegetarian wonton soup, veg. dim sum combination, and brown rice. 

FOOD is all-around tasty, but I have to say the sesame meatless chicken was some of the best Chinese food I've had. It was light but filling, and had a crisp/crunch that I miss out on with most Chinese vegan dishes. The (vegetarian) dim sum was fantastic and highly recommended.

RATING is a friendly five. Friendly because when I was momentarily sitting and waiting on my partner, our waiter came over and held down a solid conversation! It's rare for me to feel like I'm personally connecting with a business in the city, so I appreciated the effort. Add the delicious food, and I'm on board for another trip.
author: Nicholas G.

description:
I wanted to love this place (cute sign) but I only "liked" what I got. The steamed pork wontons in red chili sauce were pretty good (plenty of vinegar and chili), but the entree was not a home run. I was seduced by all the "meatless chicken" options and the raves about "meatless chicken" in the Yelp reviews I read. 

Take it from me, keep the meat in your chicken. This stuff is dry and yet lacks texture and flavor. Plus the dish is waaaaaaaaay too salty. That being said, the amount of dried chili in the dish is impressive and that plus the tea leaves gave excellent flavor to the asparagus. I guess I didn't say that I chose "tea flavored meatless chicken" as my main. 

Nonetheless I will take the leftovers home because -- hey! -- I'm paying for it! 

I just wish the meatless chicken had come with more sauce. 

I'll know better next time -- and this place is gonna get another chance, and not only because it's located where I change busses from the 22 to the 14 or the 49.
author: Tim P.

description: Have only been here for takeout, but I really enjoy the meatless chicken and vegan options here! It's so great to be able to order dim sum that's meat free! I sometimes get a little worried that the delivery is the meat version but I found out there is a trick with the red dot in the steamed buns that signifies it's vegan! Definitely a great options for vegans in the area. For anyone like me who is in a relationship with a non-vegan, this place is good because we can both get what we want!
author: Kayla W.

description:
I've ordered here via EAT24 a few times before - no issues, food was good, delivery would be early more often than not. This time around, the food didn't arrive so I chatted with EAT24. The restaurant claimed that they called/texted numerous times w/o an answer, and that the food was actually delivered. They said they had a record of the contact attempts, and therefore couldn't issue a refund. 

EAT24 eventually issued a $35 credit for my trouble. That's $0.57 short of the order but that's whatever. 

With all that being said Big Lantern, you get a 1 star review so everyone can see how poorly you managed this situation, and you've lost my business for good.
author: Tim C.

description: We order delivery here via Grubhub and it was really swift. The food came 15 mins after ordering around midnight. Food was traditional Cantonese cuisine. Nothing fancy but convenient and not disappointing.
author: Yanzhong L.

description:
I love this place. I get delivery from here at least a few times a month! 

Big Lantern has definitely got some of the best dim sum in the city, which isn't something I say lightly because we have amazing dim sum in SF!
author: Julianna B.

description:
I would avoid this place at all costs. It took over 2 hours for delivery. I had to call twice and both times was told it was very close.

After I finally got my food, I was severely disappointed. The quality was very poor and I had to throw out two of the dishes due to poorly cooked chicken.

DO NOT ORDER FROM HERE OR YOU WILL REGRET IT
author: Coop B.

description: Solid for quick deliver! We ordered general chicken, fried rice, and dim sum combo. Dim sum was bomb. General chicken was crispy and their broccoli was fresh. The only thing, their fried rice wasn't completely fried. And this order arrived way earlier which is good.
author: Ashad J.

description:
Oh em gee!!! Ok so... every Chinese restaurant has orange chicken right? But just imagine it without all that unnecessary batter coated all around it. I am so glad i ordered it. It's so damn good. It doesn't make you feel bad for indulging. Their orange chicken will stand out at a blind taste test. 
Customer service was super great also. 

Knowing mission street... I had to double park so when doing take out... plan wisely. Other than that... 5 stars.
author: Summer M.

description:
Our go-to for Chinese take out in here in SF. We always order the pork fried rice, orange chicken and mushu chicken. 

The pork fried rice is my favorite - it's not too oily and it has loads of veggies, egg and of course, pork.

Hubby gets the orange chicken. It's sweet, crunchy and comes with broccoli! Super tasty.

The mu shu has been hit or miss. This time there was barely any chicken and the tortillas were sticky. Maybe they shouldn't heat them at all and let us fend for ourselves. :) 

Great staying in and movie night restaurant!
author: Terri L.

description:
I guess if I was starving to death and Big Lantern was the only restaurant left on the planet, I'd go back. But that's pretty much the only reason I'd go. Got delivery - it wasn't technically late but it did take a loooong time. Or maybe I was just starving. 

I know vegetarian dim sum can be tricky, but this was pretty bad. We got the chive dumplings with meatless chicken and the vegetable dumplings. They weren't...awful. But I think they must have forgotten some ingredients or something.  They had absolutely no flavor at all and were rather rubbery. Also tried the veggie mu shu, which was oddly sweet, and the pancakes were more like thick tortillas. The whole thing was weird and they could do a lot better, especially for the price.
author: Gina L.

description:
WHAT A JOKE. I've been ordering from Big Lantern for years and now never will again. I ordered delivery at 9:45pm by the time I received it and realized the travesty that hey we're passing off as Crab puffs, they had closed. When I called the next day to let them know, I was told that I SHOULD HAVE DRIVEN OVER THE GROSS FOOD TO SHOW THEM! 

Let me get this straight, I had bad food delivered by you and rather than manage the situation, you tell me I should have driven it over?! In this city there are MANY MANY options, skip Big Lantern.
author: catherine f.

description:
I came here on a Friday night while visiting my mom and have to say that unfortunately 
it wasn't that good and needed more flavor. 

I came here because I heard they had vegan dim sum available and from my experience, vegan dim sum can be hard to come by. I ordered the Turnip Cakes w/ Meatless Chicken which tasted pretty good, but wasn't so amazing that I would go out of my way to order it again. I also ordered the Veg Combo Platter which I was even less impressed with. I've honestly just had frozen Chinese food that has tasted just as good. 

I did have friendly service though even if it felt a bit on the slower side at times. I should also mention that the immediate area was very down and out with lots of homeless people and overall it didn't feel very safe and some place you would want to walk around. It's a shame because I remember the Mission District being a lot nicer than this even 3-4 years ago. 

I'm glad I tried it, but don't really plan to come back unless I've heard their menu has changed.
author: Regina W.

description: This is my favorite Chinese food place in the Mission.  The food is fresh and good.  The portions are generous.  They fry to perfection.  The prices are good.  The staff is friendly and decor is nice.  I've been coming here for the last 8 years and I've not been disappointed .  My favorites are the taro puffs, the pot stickers, corn egg soup, turnip cakes and more.  They also have lots of vegetarian and vegan options.
author: John P.

description:
Im after surgery today and just got home from the hospital. The surgery was on my leg and I cannot walk. I live on the fifth floor. When the delivery guy came to my location he then called me and demanded that I come downstairs because he cannot park allegedly. After I politely asked him to come over and explained that I am unable to walk he dropped the phone. Then he called back and told me something like "come on my man and get your food". I've tried to reason with him again and he told me "f**k you". He was very rude. He spoke very poor English but I think I made it clear that Im on crutches and cannot walk. So I think he is just a bad person.

BTE there is not much parking in front of my building but plenty of parking  just around the corner from where he was.
author: Oleg K.

description:
We ordered delivery, so I'll focus on food and service. 

Food: Great selection of meatless options, but some of the options are not what you'd expect.  I love meatless General Tso's chicken and order it when I see it, but Big Lantern only offers meatless General Tso's meatballs. Though different, I asked my fiancé to order the meatless General Tso's from Big Lantern because I generally like meatless meatballs and General Tso's sauce. Unfortunately, when our food arrived almost two hours later (our first delivery was stolen, per the restaurant) I was very hungry but also very bummed. The meatless meatballs are really Italian tasting, and the sauce is good but very watery and runny. Overall, I feel that a frozen meal would have been more convenient, better tasting, and had better texture.

Service: Our delivery was incredibly late, but we were told someone stole our food from the delivery person during their first attempt to get to our place. Other than that, service was good.

Overall, I was not impressed and cannot recommend their vegetarian/vegan food. Since my omnivorous fiancé likes this place, I expect to have more than one opportunity to review them and intend to update my review if my opinion changes.
author: Shannon H.

description:
I'm housesitting for friends in the Mission and wanted to find a decent Chinese takeout place. I figured from the reviews that my favourite dish, sesame chicken, would be a safe bet. Boy was I wrong. The chicken was drowned in sauce that was so salty and strange tasting that I gulped down four pieces because I was starving and just arrived from out of town... but I couldn't even finish it. What a waste. 

That being said, staff was kind and friendly throughout the transaction. 

Perhaps their other dishes are better - but I'll be saving my money to try someplace else.
author: Alexis M.

description:
Okay, first I want to start of this review by commenting on people complaining how long they got their food. Don't give them a low rating star for your food being delivered. Blame the delivery company, not the restaurant.

When we ordered from Yelp24, they quoted us 55 mins. My husband and I were killing time by shopping at Petco for our new dog. We are a 10 min drive from Petco. We completely lost track of time and started racing home. I even made a comment saying, "well everyone else on yelp seem to get their food late, maybe he's not even there yet." WRONG! He was right on the dot 55 mins. Shame on me for judging! 

My husband ordered the Hong Kong style chowmein with prawns and I ordered the Hong Kong style chowmein with seafood. The noodles were crispy and they put the sauce and ingredients in a different container so we wouldn't have a sloppy mess! Great thinking. My husband and I don't share food because we're big eaters and we usually finish our meals, but this place gives generous portions! My husband also ordered the General Chicken! Lots of meat and less breading. Sauce was perfect amount and it was also delicious. We had the rest for leftovers and it was as delicious as it was fresh!

Way to go Big Lantern!!
author: Darlene M.

description: Undecided on where to have lunch after the nearby Carnaval parade, we made the right choice. The Kung pão prawn and the vegetable chow fun was served in ample portions for three with quality ingredients. We'll be back when in the neighborhood.
author: Marc M.

description: Ordered delivery for two vegetarians accustomed to having solid veggie food in Asia (with imitation meat etc.) and this place did not disappoint. Super authentic and delicious.
author: Joy M.

description: I love it here! Lovely service and food is great. Thank you Big Lantern! Got the General Tso's vegan chicken and vegan sizzling pot thingy AMAZING
author: CeeCee Y.

description:
I went here for dinner with a few friends last night and was pleasantly surprised! I had always walked by big lantern but never actually stopped in to eat. 

The food:  We were in new years recover mode and accordingly we really enjoyed the spice fried rice with bbq pork and the dim sum sampler. We had one vegetarian in the group so we got the veggie pot stickers (the meat eaters loved these as well) and the vegetarian delight which they were able to make a little spicy and came in a delicious sauce. 

The service: Waiters were attentive and re-filled our water frequently. It wasn't crowded so we were able to have a nice leisurely meal. 

Is it the most amazing food I have ever had? No. But it is really solid, a decent price, convenient location, with no line. They have tons of vegetarian friendly options which makes it easy for a group of people with diverse dietary needs. I definitely will be back.
author: Sarah S.

description: Ordered delivery which was a mistake the take out platters are really small and overpriced. I paid $60 for two entrees chow mein dim sum BBQ pork buns and an appetizer. The appetizer which was cream cheese crab puffs are filled with nothing but air!! I expected the puffs to be filled with some type of filling but I was so wrong. The chow mein was filled with veggies and a little bit of noodles. Sweet and sour pork WAS CHICKEN not pork. The only reason why I gave two stars is because the Mongolian beef was up to par. I'm disappointed in the portions they delivered to me. The portions have gotten smaller and the prices have gone up I will not be returning!!!
author: Sarai M.

description:
Don't order delivery from Big Lantern.

6:06pm order placed
7:10pm confirmed delivery time
7:20pm restaurant says the order has left and is out for delivery
7:50pm restaurant claims my order has been delivered

2 hours later I am starving and still have no food. 

FAIL
author: Rachel R.

description: Big Lantern is run by the people who used to operate Oriental Restaurant on Market Street between 6th and 7th.  They were sorely missed when they lost their lease and had to move.  The new location is not walking distance from my office anymore, but it is a short walk from the 16th Street Bart Station.  The food, like before, is great, and the menu is much larger, and they now offer vegan food.  I would eat here as often as I used to before their move, but getting to the new location takes a while.  The food is great with generous portions, and the service is fabulous.
author: Jennifer G.

description:
Service: the action of helping or doing work for someone.  I placed an order. I gave the restaurant my address.  When my order arrived, the delivery person called me and said they were outside.  I open my door to find no one.  I went back into my home, got my keys and phone and walked outside of my building in search of the delivery person.  I called the delivery person and found her down the block from my apartment building.  I signed the bill. 
"It says tip in cash," she said.
"Yeah and I paid you to deliver a meal to my door NOT drive to my neighborhood and play Hide n' Seek.  I don't HAVE TO tip you," I responded as I took my order from her hands and walked away.

The delivery girl preceded to curse at me as I walked away.
"Never order her again," she screamed.

I will happily honor her request and ensure that everyone I know does the same.
author: Eric J.

description:
Fam. If you respect your body and your stomach in particular, you will not eat here. 

My friend wanted some meatless chicken, so we decided to check this place out since they have an entire section on their menu dedicated to imitation meat. 

We went with the Braised Tofu with Bok Choy, General Meatless Chicken, and Sesame Meatless Chicken. 

Okay let's begin with the tofu. If any of you eat tofu regularly, you know you need to season it for it to be consumable. Unfortunately, Big Lantern did not follow these general tofu preparation guidelines. What we received were soft blocks of plain tofu swimming in thin gravy surrounded by large chunks of bok choy. I tried, fam, I really tried to enjoy the tofu but it was inedible. The bok choy was chopped into huge pieces that were extremely difficult to consume in one or multiple bites. I ended up slathering this dish in sriracha. 

Let's move on to the chicken. The General Meatless Chicken was funky y'all! It tasted bitter and sour-- as if the meat itself was bad. I did enjoy the cashews and veg that accompanied the chicken though. As for the Sesame Meatless Chicken, that was probably the tastiest dish out of the ones we ordered. It had your typical Sesame sauce, and the chicken was prepared in the most appealing way out of the two chicken dishes we ordered. It was fried, however, I would have appreciated if the fried shell was a tad bit crispier as it turned out to be on the soggier side.  

I do want to note that the service was pleasant! Everyone was nice and accommodating to us, so I don't want the quality of food to overshadow the other aspects of this place. 

Unfortunately, I don't plan on returning any time soon. About an hour after dinner, I experienced stomach pains, which I believe were a result of the food served here. With all of this said, I rarely eat "Chinese American" food so my standards for what Chinese food are pretty high (grew up in Singapore). Check it out if you wish!
author: Nicole A.

description:
This is one of my go to Chinese restaurant! They open late, have friendly staff and lots of vegetarian options! 

I order onion pancake, meatless chicken siu mai and the veggie chow mein! It all tasted very good and they give good portions! Tasted so good I forgot to take a photo for my snap story! :( I've ordered delivery using Eat24 and it came on time and the food tasted great!
author: Lily L.

description: Best Chinese delivery we have found in SF! Delicious dim sum. Our go-to when we want something a little nicer. Tonight was Chinese New Year and our delivery guy could not have been sweeter. On time and the food tasted fresh and yummy, and not oily like other places. We love this place!
author: Laura B.

description:
Ordered delivery from here last night. We got the Pork Siu Mai, Steamed Pork Buns, and Sweet Pork Ribs (yes that's a lot of pork). 

The Siu Mai was absolutely delicious. Probably the best thing we got. Well-seasoned and juicy. I was a big fan. Would definitely recommend this dish to anyone. It tasted a bit like a soup dumpling but with more meat (and no broth inside). 

The pork buns were decent. Not as flavorful as other ones I've had. The pork was good but the bun part was just fluffy nothingness; it didn't taste like much. Again that's fine because the pork was good, but ideally you'd like layers of flavor. 

Lastly, the pork spare ribs. These were alright. The rib meat was extremely tough and the meat lacked flavor. It came in a big vat of sweet barbecue liquid, but that didn't help a ton. 

I would definitely eat here again just to have more of the Siu Mai and Pork Buns. I'll update this next time I eat here with the new things I try.
author: Nick D.

description:
They have an odd menu with some homebrew creations that are pretty good.
Not sure what the cuisine is, and it sure sounds odd, but the raisins, corn and beef is really good. I also like the lamb variant of this dish.

The ginger fish with pea sprouts is another one of my favs from Big Lantern
author: David T.

description:
Awesome place I love food is great! location is great! and workers are awesome! 
I love that they carter to your needs and questions 
Salt and pepper  is awesome as well and I had a side of rice noodles
author: Ray D.

description: Open late and has the best sweet and sour pork in all of San Francisco. I know that's a huge statement, but true.
author: Jav G.

description: The food is great! And there are many vegetarian options. Be prepared for the entire family to be sitting at tables in the restaurant berating each other. One of the sisters is basically nonstop verbally abusing the youngest boy. It was so uncomfortable we considered calling for help. The poor child was scolded and shouted at for over an hour and he had done nothing at all and didn't even say a word. Do not go to this restaurant! Maybe takeout would be OK.
author: Alley C.

description:
Got delivery. 

I had the salt and pepper porkchop and dim sum platter. 

Freakin delicious and everything I expect from American Chinese food. 

Will need to order a few more times to give you something super duper useful. That's all I have for now. 

Ughhhh, so yummy!!!
author: Niana D.

description: Wide selection of food in large potions at a reasonable price. And the servers were so nice!
author: Jonathan S.

description: The most underrated Chinese in town! Endless meat-free options. My go to is the meatless sesame or five spice chicken, and my guy can't find better candy chicken in SF. And that free chow mein when you call in your delivery order is dangerously delicious.
author: Desiree E.

description: I ordered takeout here, the food was ready on time, which was appreciated, but the quality of the food (I ordered some dim sum dishes) left much to be desired. Most likely will not come back again, but I've also been spoiled by lots of great fresh dim sum over the years, so the quality may be fine for some.
author: June O.

description: I would probably give them 3.5 stars if half stars could be given.  A co-worker and I ordered from them through Eat24.  Delivery showed up on time.  My co-worker is a vegetarian, so we ordered some vegetarian dim sum and one of their lunch specials, a meatless chicken option.  The vegetarian dim sum was okay, the skin/dough of the was a little too thick and I'd describe it as pasty.  The taste of the inside was decent.  We liked the meatless chicken, it had a good taste and a good portion for the price.    Overall, it wasn't bad.  Probably wouldn't order the vegetarian dim sum again though.
author: Christina C.

description:
When I want casual vegetarian/vegan Chinese food, I eat here. I am not expecting super healthy, fancy plates and neither should you. I have eaten in a few times, and had delivery at least 10 times. Every single delivery arrived in 30 minutes or less.  I ordered delivery today and it took 20 minutes from the moment I phoned. I always call the restaurant directly to avoid extra fees.

My usual order is garlic noodle and kung pao tofu. This lasts me at least three meals so I get my money's worth! The garlic noodle is a must.  Also, any place that offers an extensive list of non-meat items is on the top of my list.
author: Kathy M.

description: I don't normally write reviews for small purchases, but I had the dim sum and hot and sour soup and was very surprised at how underseasoned it was. The char siu was good, but seemed a little overcooked. Soup had a great amount of mushrooms and veg in it, though!
author: Kalei F.

description: I don't yelp a lot, but I had to for this place.  I ordered delivery from them and it was one of the worst food experiences I've ever had.  The shrimp tasted liked rubber.  The egg rolls where almost chemical tasting, the fried rice just smelled old & the garlic noodles were greasy and soggy.  I was too scared to even attempt the soup.  GrubHub reached out to them and they didn't even try to offer a solution.  So disappointing.  Will NEVER eat here again.
author: Alexandra B.

description:
One of my favorite Chinese places! Great services and good food! Love their dim sum and meatless chicken options!
Shanghai baby buns and shrimp dumpling are my favorite dim sum! Sesame meatless chicken and tea favor meatless chicken are must every time I go!
author: Patricia T.

description:
Although the Yelp call to action button says "free delivery," when you order through Eat24, there is a minimal $1 flat rate delivery fee. Not a biggie but just awareness. 

Ordered the dim sum combination for $11.95, which includes 3 pork buns, 3 shrimp har gow, and 3 shumai. Amazing deal, considering separate orders run around $5-$6 each. Also snagged the potsticker appetizer, 5 for $7.95, and a few orders of sesame balls (great size, and thick mochi). Great option for party finger foods and delivery is a breeze. Would definitely order again.
author: Alison A.

description: Highly recommend this place! The food is delicious, and the service is so friendly and great. I would come back to this place in a heart beat.
author: Siddharth D.

description:
This place has fantastic food. The meat tastes fresh and isn't slimy. The veggies are fantastic too. 

I love their bbq pork fried rice. It is the best I've had in a while!
author: Ashley M.

description: Pleasantly surprised to find a Chinese restaurant with an exclusive (& large) menu of "Meatless Chicken/Beef" items. We tried the String Beans with Tofu, Fried Rice, Sesame Meatless Chicken and the Shaolin pot. Everything was very tasty. Efficient and friendly service. We also tried the Sesame ball with lotus root for dessert... really good! Would love to come back and try more dishes.
author: Sara V.

description: I ordered the meatless chicken. It was good, but I felt stoned as hell 20 minutes later. What is in that stuff?
author: Em L.

description: Great vegetarian options at this place! Delicious fake meat- chicken, beef, all of it. Little nuggets of goodness. Love eating here or ordering the food for delivery.
author: Lindsay L.

description: Ok the food is 5star quality but the delivery guy was rude because I didn't give him a cash tip I gave him a tip on my  card and he was so rude about smirking and walked away in mid conversation and muttered something under his breathe so wtf ??
author: Melissa S.

description:
I have ordered from Big Lantern for years. In the past, the food was fresh, not that expensive, and delivered oh so quickly. Doesn't hurt that I'm nearby. 

But this last delivery was a major disappointment and their costs have exploded. I mean, $7.95 plus tax for 5 potstickers? Outrageous! That is $1.59 per sticker. Ugh. Also bought the Singapore noodles, which were dried out and overcooked. Vegetable fried rice was full of that peas and carrots filler bullshit. 

These guys know about Postmates, right? And that Postmates will easily draw business away from them? They should be worried. Not sure I will order again.
author: N'olo J.

description:
Vegans and vegetarians beware!  They have stopped serving meatless chicken.  They have substituted vegan meatballs in all their menu items.  They are terrible, no replacement for the meatless chicken at all.  Bland, mealy and definitely NOT Chinese food!  They did not create new menu items in their Eat24 and Grubhub listings, so you might not notice the change until you get them.  This is a bit dishonest, because each item on the menus has ratings, and they claim that over 9000 people have ordered the General Meatless Meatballs.  They most definitely have not.

This is the last straw with this restaurant.  The rude owners and slapdash cooking made this a grade C eatery before, but now it gets an "F".
author: Ken R.

description:
Not your typical Chinese food place!  I mean that in the good way, not the scary "how is that sauce oranger than my orange tree fruit" kinda way.  It's SUPER VEGITARIAN POWER!!! cause like, I don't feel limited by my diet eating here :)  TONS of veggie options and my omnivore and carnivore friends leave happy too.

Add-in a fantastic lunch menu and speedy delivery and you have yourself a winner.

The veggie compo plate and the sweet and sour shrimp are fantastic!  Only things I can say bad are sometimes the food is a little dry and some of the veggies are pretty standard fare (like carrots).  And the to-go orders can spill sometimes and get kinda messy.  

Go for the tofurky imitation meats they have though.  Be brave, cause they are actually really good quality and tasty!
author: Thomas T.

description: This was one of the best Chinese restaurants I have been to in a long time. The staff was attentive, the food delicious, with plenty of vegetarian food choices and it was good value too! I look forward to coming back the next time I visit SF!
author: Alex I.

description:
I ordered a couple of lunch special plates and the soup that was served was so disgusting my whole family was in agreement that it taste like water and liquid smoke (not kidding). 

I have to say I was happy with the chow mein, but I'm still in search for a Chinese food place that's gonna have me running back time and time again. Still haven't found that place...
author: Joi L.

description:
Came here for dinner on a Saturday with a group of 5 (which grew to 7 as other friends joined us). The place was nearly empty, which normally raises a flag for me on a busy block, but it seems they do a lot more delivery orders (the kitchen staff were still running around sending out boxes like the place was packed!). 

This place was great, especially if you have reasonable expectations for the area and price point-- on a block filled mostly with bars, with large-portion menu items under $15 in San Francisco, I'm not expecting more than tasty grub for drinkers to eat. If you're looking for a supremely authentic or an awesome date-night spot, this place will be quiet and friendly (except for 1-2 other rowdy groups like ours), but probably won't impress anyone.

But on a night of revelry, this place fits the bill and more. I'd probably even use them for my next Chinese delivery order, though that might be where things get iffy quality-wise according to some of the other reviews.
author: Krista L.

description: One of my two go-tos for Chinese delivery, I always go back for the salt and pepper prawns - so simple, yet SO good! They deliver very quickly. While they're not always consistent quality-wise, we've had 99% positive experiences so we keep going back. Dine-in is a good option too, great dim sum.
author: Jeffrey H.

description:
I was craving some beef noodle soup and decided to get some from Big Lantern.  Unfortunately, the soup was not that good so my craving was left unfulfilled.  I also needed a veggie fix so I got some bok choy.  That was fine too.  

I ordered off of Postmates so I can't comment on the service, but the food was just mediocre and I don't think I'll be ordering from here again.
author: Lyn C.

description:
I ordered Hot and Sour Soup, Turnip Cakes and Chow Fun with Beef.
Of the three, I really liked the Chow Fun, because I asked for little onions, thinly cut beef and lots of vegetables ( zucchini, carrots, bean sprouts ) This dish was very good. I was disappointed with the Hot and Sour Soup because even though I asked for extra white pepper and it was spicy, it was bland, not sour at all, and not salty at all, not tasty, but it was peppery spice. I was able to doctor it up with the soy sauce, but, Panda Express did it better. I really expected better from a chinese restaurant. I prefer the traditional Turnip cakes with minced pork. The turnip cakes had a nice consistency. It was pan fried nicely. But, the taste of the sauce was off. The oyster sauce tasted more like hoisin sauce instead of oyster sauce.The delivery was on time. Nice, friendly delivery man. I will try this again, since I am having a hard time finding a chinese delivery near Alamo Park. I'll just have to be very specific with my order next time.
author: Sharon L.

description:
This is for their delivery only. 

Food quality seems to go down every time we get delivery from here. (We have no issues with dining in.)

Fried rice = greasy salt lick. 

General Chicken = one big soggy glob. And found cartilage with the white meat chicken. It would be acceptable, if it wasn't boneless chicken.

Green beans with tofu = good except we requested for no tofu. A huge pile of fried tofu going into the compost bin. 

Dumplings = still good. 

Overall, I need to remember my own rule of dining here only in person and not succumbing to delivery, because it's always disappointing. 

Sorry. We've got to stick to dining in.
author: Fannie S.

description: We were drawn to Big Lantern because of the praise for their faux meat.  We had veggie pot stickers and ginger onion meatless chicken with broccoli.  The pot stickers and faux chicken were very good and the broccoli was perfectly cooked, still a little crisp and bright green.  The sauce was mild, but had some fresh ginger taste to it.  We'll definitely be back.
author: Cindi L.

description:
I was starving (as usual) upon my arrival to work ( I work graveyard) it was close to 10pm and I needed delivery (NOT PICK-UP) I was really wanting Chinese food and my normal spot was closed. I am big on Yelp reviews in my venture to try out a new restaurant. It is usually a pretty good gauge of yea or ney. I decided on Big Lantern because the pics looked delicious! AND the reviews were positive. 
I ordered the chicken chow mein (with special instruction to cook the chicken well done) and the basil chicken same request for well done chicken ( I don't fare well it it is not firm in texture) enough about me ( too late?)  the food arrived earlier than est time given. I was pleasantly surprised!! 
The chow mein had that almost grilled flavor from an expertly seasoned wok I imagine.. the chicken was firm as requested BUT it was still tender!!! 
The basil chicken was a spicy ..generous collaboration of sautéed basil and YES! firm but tender chicken! Score! 
 It was more than enough to share. My order could have easily fed 4 maybe 3 really hungry adults. My co worker would not leave my office without the deets of where all that wonderful goodness came from. 
We order food A LOT.. Big Lantern will soon be in heavy rotation around the workplace I'm sure!
author: Sobossy 1.

description:
This place is operated with the expert efficiency I hope for in a restaurant, whether you dine in or order delivery. I am so thankful for a sit-down place in SF, where I can be seated, eat, pay, and leave in 30 minutes.

It's not the absolute *best* Chinese food, but definitely hits the spot when you need it. Get the BBQ pork pineapple fried rice and the dim sum combo.
author: Sarah L.

description:
First time we have ordered dinner for my family at Big Lantern through EAT 24 and they totally screwed it up. After 60 minutes we were told the order was out for delivery. After 90 minutes they were a no show. The phone number on their website is a fax number so could not reach them. After 120 minutes EAT 24 reached the restaurant and they could not even find the order. 

They offered to rush in 30 minutes and discount 30%. They should have comped the entire order in my opinion.  We cancelled as it was now too late to eat and we were ticked off with them. We will be going back to Red Jade for future Chinese orders. They get it right and usually deliver within 30 minutes the first time (and also have much better pricing).
author: Wayne G.

description:
This place is consistently delicious and wonderful. It is difficult to pass by, smell the amazing aromas, and not want to stop in.

My personal list of restaurant with menus which I will try ANYthing from are few - and this restaurant is one of them (one of the others is Burma Superstar - good god). I try something different every time I come in and have been wowed trying new things; I love being able to step away from my "usual" menu picks and know that whatever comes will be great.

Been a customer for over ten years and I plan on it staying that way. One of my absolute favorite SF staples. Great for groups and vegetarians. A must for locals!
author: Ashleigh K.

description: For the price, I'd expect better ingredients. The Chow Mein noodles were really, really oily, and had very little meat or vegetables in the mix. It's not far off from a typical old-school neighborhood Chinese restaurant, and the service is friendly, but there's just so many options out there to get something fresher/tastier.
author: Christian W.

description: Extremely slow service - ordered food at 12:20pm and did not receive it for 2 hours. The food was incredibly salty. Do not recommend.
author: Anurag G.

description: This restaurant doesn't look impressive from the outside, even the inside seems a bit rundown. What's special about this place is the vegetarian dim sum selection. If you have vegetarian friends, you know how hard it is to go have dim sum with them because most items have meat or seafood. This place has many veggie options, as well as many of the standard non-veggie selections. We only tried the dim sum so far, but the lunch/dinner menu also seemed pretty extensive. We came on a Sunday morning when they first opened at 11:30 and there were no lines. Parking could be a challenge in this area but it's close to the 16th street BART station. Would come back again if I am in the neighborhood.
author: Y L.

description:
Expensive. For dim sum, this place is much above the average price. The food was pretty good, but I just could not justify what I paid.
We got chinese broccoli, ha gow, shrimp rice rolls, steamed pork buns and siu mai. We ended up paying almost $25 each with tip... wow. 
Service was very slow. I believe everything is made to order, so we received some of our food almost 30 minutes after everything else and had to take it to go. The wait staff isn't anything spectacular either. 

I noticed people mainly get delivery here, but if I lived in the area, I'd only order to go from Big Lantern if I had desperate cravings for dim sum. I'm sure in San Francisco, with the infamous Chinatown, there are better quality and better priced dim sum restaurants close by.
author: Joanna H.

description: I waited three hours for food that never came despite protests several times during the ordeal that "we are backed up", "the food is on the way", "the driver is a few minutes away", and thirty minutes later... "the driver is a few minutes away".  Don't bother.
author: Benjamin Y.

description: I've been ordering from big lantern for a while, but our experience eating in on Christmas has lost them a customer across the board. While we were sat quickly and they were definitely busy, we were slighted throughout the service. Our server started taking our order, then simply walked away while we were ordering. Then, we had a second server. We completed our order, our drinks were brought to us, and I asked for water a second, and then a third time. Finally we got some water. Would have been nice to get a refill on that and I would have liked to order another sake, but that would have meant seeing a server... we didn't. We ordered soup, potstickers, two meat entrees, and pork chow mein. The sweet and sour chicken was cold and brought first, then time went by and they brought out potstickers, our soup bowls sat at the center of the table languishing empty for basically forever, and a young girl came out and asked us if we wanted the check. Uhhhhmmmm... how about our food, maybe? Then, and this is why I'm even taking the time to write this, she said, "you shouldn't have come here on Christmas." Don't worry, kid, we won't make that mistake twice. To top the whole thing off, she brought out some tepid chow mein with chicken... we had ordered pork. We were pretty hungry, so we dealt with it, but between the ringing off the hook phones, the terrible and incorrect service, the cold food, and the $96 check, we felt less than unsatisfied. Never again.
author: Brandi V.

description: I discovered this restaurant while looking for late night chinese in the SF area. I came to this restaurant hoping for the food to not be exceedingly unhealthy, or panda express style. Sadly this restaurant was unhealthy, or at least, what I ordered was unhealthy. I acknowledge that this restaurant has many vegetarian options, but for  ordering meat based options, it was unhealthy. The dim sum combination was dismal, even though I have read many rave reviews on them. Perhaps I ordered the wrong things.
author: Jason L.

description:
Have only done delivery so I cannot speak to ambiance nor service, but delivery staff has always been prompt and courteous and the food, ALWAYS on point! What I like: 

Steamed Wonton with Red Chili Oil, 
Cucumber with Garlic and Chili Sauce,
Combination Wonton Soup
Steamed Spare-Ribs, 
Turnip Cake with Meatless Chicken,
Taro Vegetable Puff,
Rice Noodle Roll (With: B.B.Q. Pork),
Shrimp Toast,
Stuffed Eggplant,
Sauteed String Bean,
Garlic Noodle (With: Vegetable)

Highly recommend!
author: cassy f.

description:
I've probably ordered from these guys a dozen times and it's always pretty good. Don't expect anything amazing but you will get a solid, classic Chinese take out meal. 
My go-to's are Orange Chicken, Sesame Chicken, Lo Mein, Hot and Sour Soup, and Fried Rice. 

Again, it's not going to blow you away but if you just want a good old fashion Chinese meal this place is hard to beat.
author: Joel W.

description: This place is great AND they deliver late!   The Seafood Hot & Sour Soup is one of the best things I've eaten in SF.  Just outstanding.  Order it, you won't be sorry!  Also love the basil chicken and Mongolian beef.
author: Mark B.

description: Restaurant completely ignored my Eat24 order after confirming. Terrible service. Don't order delivery if you actually want your food to arrive.
author: Tiffany D.

description: I love the castro district on a weekend. Sit by the windows and get a free show! The food is standard american chinese. The pork Bao was good and everything was as expected. No stand outs but no big flops either.
author: Jessa Y.

description: My boyfriend and I chose Big Lantern for dinner because it was the only dim sum place in the Mission Area. It isn't my favorite dim sum in the city, but it's affordable. I'm bumping my review up from 3 to 4 stars because I think this place would be awesome for vegetarians! All the traditional meat dim sum they have is also offered in imitation veggie options. For example, they have both regular BBQ pork buns and imitation meat BBQ pork buns. Really unique!
author: Sasha P.

description:
Solid Chinese food in the Mission. Really close to one of our favorite bars, and it can be a nice break when we don't actually feel like Mexican food. Which is rare LOL.
Loved their dim sum. Typical Chinese dishes are great. 
Service is always fast and friendly. 
It has been a whole since we had some dim sum. We need to go back soon.
author: Kat R.

description: The bok choy in my order was not washed properly (or not at all), there was still sand and dirt in it. The rice noodle rolls were good, but the sauce that comes with it is supposed to be slightly sweet, not salty. The roasted duck has very little to no meat, just skin and fat.
author: Derika L.

description: Place was okay at best. No people in there when we went, probably for the right reasons. They should just make better dumplings!
author: Brad J.

description: Love the honey walnut chicken and the fried rice! This is my to go spot for Chinese food.
author: Jada J.

description: This place is honestly such a great find. I've been here twice, both times super late, and its been absolutely amazing both times. Their dim sum, on hit. Chow fun? Oh my God. Chow mein? Yasss. And they're open late? All of the yes.
author: Angie S.

description:
Interesting meal. We wanted to have some good pickup Chinese food but this didn't quite meet the mark. 

We got the veggie dumplings. They are a bit thick but not terrible. Definitely something for when you dine in. 

The eggplant was delicious. Highly recommend it. It is doused in oil but was delicious regardless. 

Finally, we had the honey walnut tofu. Don't.
author: Akshaya V.

description:
Did not order delivery like most other Yelpers, but ate in the actual restaurant. On a Saturday afternoon, the place was mostly empty (rather large restaurant) but heavily staffed. I came here craving dim sum and ended up ordering some shrimp dumplings, sesame balls, and their lunch special Mongolian beef. Everything was just okay. To be clear, this place is very Americanized Chinese food, so if you're looking for highly authentic experience and flavors, this is not the place for you. The shrimp dumpling's skin was oddly gelatin-like and sticky, but the filling was decently flavored. The sesame balls tasted great, but the fried outside portion was not crisp enough for me to poke even a chopstick into it without using a lot of force. The Mongolian beef tasted fine but felt heavily Americanized with extraneous sweet brown sauce. It lacked punch / spiciness and was more sweet than savoury.

Everything was just okay but I will say that the employees working here seem very sweet and attentive. I overheard one lady saying in Chinese to a delivery boy as he went out the door that he forgot the vinegar for a customer's order of dumplings and that she didn't want the customer to have to eat the dumplings without it. So he went back in and the lady employee put the vinegar into the delivery bag. I thought that was a nice gesture.

All in all, if you do decide to come here, I would set my expectations. Red Lantern caters to a certain audience and unfortunately it's not so much for me.
author: Claudia C.

description:
I've been coming here on and off for about a decade, so yeah I'm a fan.  It's a great place to grab appetizers in the Mission when you're hitting one of the dive bars, or to go sit down with your gal for dinner.  Kat and I recently visited and it was just what the doctor ordered!  I'm a fan of the 'paper wrapped chicken', 'pot stickers', the  'crab puffs', and the 'mongolian beef'.  We also enjoyed the 'pork buns'.  Prices are reasonable.  Parking can be tough in the neighborhood, just a warning not their fault.......
I will happily be back for more!
author: Jim P.

description:
This place is the bomb dot com. We order delivery regularly and it always comes super fast and piping hot! Some of our go to dishes:

Big Lantern Spicy Fried Rice : Put it in my mouth ASAP. Loaded with all the meats and even shrimp sprinkled in too. Yumma.

Sesame Beef : YES GAWD I really just can't stop eating it ever.

Crab Puffs : Cream cheese and crab in my panties.

Hunan Crispy Chicken : Some whole other level shit.

Listen, I am by no means a Chinese expert but I am an expert at ordering the cuisine online and binge watching TV in my sweat pants. This place is great. Like I said we order delivery most of the time but have dined in too. The service was cheerful the the server was a sweet gem of a lady (it might help my GF speaks mandarin). 

Thanks for always having my back Big Lantern!!
author: Biddie T.

description:
I truly hate writing bad reviews, but when I'm being ripped off and having my money taken over $0.50 discrepancy of tip it needs to be said.

I ordered through Eat24 (partially their fault) and they didn't note that I tipped 15% through their app so the driver thought I was going to tip cash.

He got mildly combative over the tip which I was charged so I gave him $2.40 to cover for it as I don't carry cash often. He promptly calls Eat24 to demand for a tip authorization, and they promptly charge me again for $6.71 calculating the after taxes and fees price.

This also doesn't even cover the fact there's also a $1 charge for delivery (food arrived late and slightly cold anyway) to bring up the total to beyond $10 for a tip of $44 worth of food.

Certain restaurants I order through them have he strange "no tip received issue".

Better watch out and check your credit card charges.
author: Jimmy H.

description: My absolute favorite place for meatless options/Chinese flood. It's so good I recommend it to anyone. Even my friend who eats meat likes the fake meat served here more than real meat. Their food is amazing. I'd try their vegetarian dim sum it really is my favorite.
author: Antonio S.

description:
Hopefully my foods on the way two hours ago because I just got off the phone with them and they're apparently closed ( telling me to contact their 3rd party company ) eat 24 to find out what happened to my order, then was hung up on after being very calm over the phone. Why would I contact somebody you have under contract to find my order ? 

Not chill ...
author: Anthony G.

description:
I've only ever gotten Delivery from this restaurant so I can't speak for the service but I can tell you if you are vegetarian this should be your favorite Chinese Restaurant in SF!!!

I'm actually not vegetarian but I'm a big fan of meat substitutes when done correctly and I often prefer it over certain meats. 

I've had both vegetarian and chicken/meat here before and I actually will only eat the vegetarian options here because I found the chicken/meat to be unsatisfactory. So that's the only reason I'm giving Big Lantern a 4 instead of 5 Stars. If you only eat Vegetarian here it's 5 stars or off the charts!!

All that being said I absolutely love their Crispy Meatless Chicken with Garlic Sauce!

Ordering Tip: You will find there Meatless Options under Chef's Specials as well as Vegetarian. They offer "Meatless Chicken, Beef and Fish"
author: Goth Kitty Jen J.

description:
I ordered egg drop soup and chicken fried rice via DoorDash last night around 10:15. I was pleasantly surprised that the food was delivered in about 30 minutes (which I know is more of a DoorDash review than Big Lantern but worth noting).

The food was packaged well - I say that as I'm noticing a lot of people grumbling about the lacking utensil/napkin situation but I had plenty. Another plus was the food arrived super hot. 

The soup was delicious! I got the small portion and it was a generous size - enough for two servings. The chicken fried rice was tasty - a tad greasy - but hey, it's fried rice so that is expected. I definitely have enough for several leftover meals. 

I'm docking a point because I found a small egg shell in the fried rice - boo. 

Overall, good food for a late night Friday craving. I would order from here again!
author: Liz G.

description:
Ordered for delivery. Delivered within 35 minutes.

Ordered vegetarian dim sum plate and shrimp shu mai. Food was very good - tasty and fresh without too much oil. Vegan pork buns stayed surprisingly fresh while in transit. Overall highly recommended!
author: Don S.

description: This place is amazing. I've never been inside, but this is by far my favorite Chinese place in the area. I spent a year and a half living in this neighborhood and looking for a replacement for my old favorite Chinese place. I think I've found it. The vegetarian options are amazing, delivery is reliable. Just amazing. Also, they delivery all the way out to the Richmond! Really happy to have found this place.
author: Kierra S.

description:
I ordered off the Dim Sum menu. The delivery was prompt (about 40mins from placing the order to arrival), and the food was warm and flavorful. It was more on the expensive end at $24 for Sesame Ball, a small Hot and Sour Soup, and Sweet Rice Tamale with Meatless Chicken

Love the vegetarian options!
author: Kait W.

description: What happened to this place?   They raised prices, and food Is not nearly as good as it used to be.   We found several pieces of beef in meatless turkey dish!!  Not acceptable!!!
author: Ryoko M.

description:
Evenings like tonight are ones that make you happy to be alive, especially in San Francisco. 

The longer I live in the Bay Area, the more amazing people I get to meet. My travels through the vegan food circuit have lead me to so many funny, interesting and genuinely kind-hearted souls, and I am very grateful for that. 

My friend Rosanne P. made a reservation for a baker's dozen, but only 11 were able to attend. The menu is slightly overwhelming, especially for newcomers. I had only been to Big Lantern two or three times, and it had been ages since my last visit, so I was ready and willing to return. 

We ordered family style so we could get a taste of everything. We selected quite a vast array of Chinese delicacies, veganized: 

*Steamed Wontons with Chili Oil
*Onion Pancake
*BBQ Meatless Chicken Bun
*Spinach Dumpling with Meatless Chicken
*Chow Fun with Meatless Chicken
*Sauteed String Bean With Fried Tofu 
*Garlic Eggplant
*Sesame Meatless Chicken
*General's Meatless Balls
*Sesame Balls

My favorites were the Sesame "chicken" and the green beans and tofu. Everything was delicious except maybe the General's Meatless Balls (I'm not even sure of the real name, but they were ball-shaped and kind of strange-tasting). The eggplant was a little undercooked, but otherwise, the cooks did a fabulous job of keeping up with our gigantic order. The pacing was perfect. We never felt rushed nor did we feel like we were waiting a long time for anything. 

Water glasses were promptly replenished, which was very much appreciated, as most of their dishes leaned towards the spicy side. I love that! My friend Roshi and I kept adding more chili to everything. I am a heat freak. The hotter, the better. I did choke slightly on my first bite of the wonton with chili oil, as I was not expecting for it to have such a ferocious kick. Definitely worth ordering!

We all feasted until our bellies were bulging and our belts were waving a white flag... it was an incredible meal shared with ten lovelies, and I'm so very glad that we chose Big Lantern for our friend Clyde's one-day-too-late birthday bash. 

I will definitely be returning for some take-out. Sorry to anyone I have to ride next to on BART, as I'm sure my tofu and veggies will be stinking up the train. If I offend your olfactory senses, I would be more than happy to share my dinner with you.
author: Brandi W.

description: Great service! There are plenty of vegetarian/vegan options here and the food came out very fast.
author: Kat O.

description:
An extremely extensive menu for all greasy Chinese dim sum and entrees cravings, open till midnight. The vegetarian/vegan plates dim sum are pretty decent and cheap! 

Highly recommend the taro vegetable puff. Uniquely crispy/deep fried on the outside, creamy goodness on the inside.

Service is pretty good, despite it being a Chinese/dim sum place!
author: Stephanie P.

description: The food is ok but do not order delivery from this place. The drivers call and ask you to come down and they don't want to deliver to apartments.
author: Andrew S.

description: Best Chinese food ever!!! Especially for vegetarians!!! Their meatless orange chicken is divine. Everything I've ever eaten here was amazing. Service is extremely fast and staff is friendly.
author: Keely A.

description:
Decent food with great store hours. I got to the restaurant at 11:40 and they gladly accommodated my last minute orders. 

I stumbled upon this place after craving some late night munchies. I ordered Beef Satay Chow Fun and Fried Onion Pancakes, two relatively satisfying dishes.

The Beef Satay Chow Fun (dry) was definitely good! I wasn't a fan of the vegetables, but it wasn't too bad! This is definitely a 4/5 dish! Plus, the portions were huge for one person. 

The Fried Onion Pancakes (appetizer) was okay. It had a strong flour-ly taste which... to a certain extent...is not exactly a tasteful dish. I wish it had more green onions and tasted less like batter. But hey! At least it was warm, crispy, and definitely delicious at a near midnight time. Oh, and please skip the dipping sauce. It didn't complement too well.

I was disappointed our water cups didn't get refilled, but hey! Its a Chinese restaurant after all, so I can't complain too much.

If I'm ever craving Chinese food, Big Lantern will definitely be on my list of considerations!
author: Chinsin S.

description:
I'm sorry but this place is not good..  I was super excited to try a place that had a large selection of vegetarian dim sum, but I've definitely had better. Came here on a Saturday night and this place was basically empty. Even though it was empty, the table that we sat at was very dirty - had they not had enough time to at least clean the tops of the empty tables?

Whatever, we got over that and went into ordering food. We basically ordered every veggie dim sum option on the menu. I wish I could've even liked one of them, but unfortunately all of them were super greasy or tasteless or cold. It's not like this place is even that cheap; there's way definitely better places for dim sum in the city.
author: Malika R.

description: Giving this place a second chance since I been hearing good things about this place. I ordered my usual dim sum favorites for delivery.
author: Evelyn H.

description:
If I could give no stars, I would, but that's not an option here. 

I ordered through the Eat24 app, order was confirmed and estimated delivery time was an hour. An hour later and still no order, contacted the restaurant, they said it was on the way. 

An hour and a half later, still no order, called the restaurant and they said that it's NOW just on its way, which meant it would have taken 2 hours for the food at this point, and that's just ridiculous. Whoever it was who picked up my call was very unapologetic and with an attitude as if my order inconvenienced them. Don't worry Big Lantern, don't think I'll be causing you any more trouble by giving you any business in the future. And by the looks of it, this isn't the first instance. Get your act together.

Poor customer service! She told me to contact Eat24 to receive a refund, kept insisting to wait for my food. How long do you want to keep your customers waiting? Eat24 was more than accommodating, even offered to have the meal paid for on them. Learn a thing or two about efficiency, customer service and who knows... Maybe this would be the last review of this type.

This review could have been different had I actually received my order, it could have tasted great but no one wants to wait 2 hours for cold Chinese food.

I highly recommend that no one order from Big Lantern, ever.
author: Ren M.

description: Be careful and watch your receipts they add money to your total after you leave. Completely not OK.
author: Melanie G.

description:
They are a ten minute drive from my house and the order took two and a half hours to get here. Unbelievable.
Wow and I made the mistake of ordering from them again and it was even worse!!!!!! Oh my god. Close this place!!!
author: g g.

description:
My review is based on a delivery order.

The order was committed to be delivered an hour after it was place.  I placed it via Eat24 and tipped 20% in the hopes of expediting the delivery (the app shows an average of 45-60 minute delivery times).  

An hour and a half passed.. No food.. They finally showed an hour and 50 minutes after delivery.

The food.. Sweet and Sour Pork and Chicken,  both were barely like warm and soggy from soaking in sauce.  Iced teas were no longer iced but watered down.  The canned drinks supplied were warm.

I cannot recommend Big Lantern for delivery.  Perhaps for dine in?  I cannot say.
author: L. W.

description:
Placed an order for delivery but it will
Take 1hr and 15 minutes, so I called back to cancell it after 5minutes the guy said that IM STUPID! Really ? This place is a JOKE! 
I changed my mind because It will
Take longer.... Very bad customer service
author: Joan P.

description:
In the Mission standard Chinese takeout is rare. There is plenty of Thai, Burmese, Japanese, etc. but Chinese is a bit lacking. Big Lantern is a solid Chinese takeout option. You can eat in the restaurant, order on Eat24, or grab takeout from the restaurant yourself. 

Food - they have a standard menu with all of the usual Chinese takeout options. I've had a the Kung Pao Chicken, Combo Fried Rice, Chicken Chow Mien, Mu Shu Pork, and Broccoli Beef. All of the dishes have been very delicious and well cooked.

Atmosphere - nothing special at all, typical casual Chinese style restaurant. I have never eaten there, I usually prefer to grab takeout.

Good solid option for Chinese takeout. They have pretty good dim sum too if that's what your craving.
author: Juliet S.

description: Worst Chinese food that I've ever had. Super salty and tasted like MSG. Gross wontons were tolerable, potstickers mushy and salty, and chow mein was pure salt and something vile. I couldn't eat any of the meat as I started to gag on it. I felt like there was definitely something wrong with it. I threw it away...wow $40.00 for crap Chinese food...Never again. Only plus was the driver was nice.
author: Heather H.

description: Went on a holiday and the service was very slow. Had reservations and still had to wait behind other groups. Food was good in the end but not sure we would done in there again. Takeout or delivery seems like the way to go.
author: Patrick S.

description:
Big Lantern, you have been good to me.  I've been lucky enough that after 4 different apartments, I'm still in your delivery area....because I have still yet to set foot into the mythical restaurant that only exists in my dreams (and when I walk past it on 16th street).  Your delivery is fast and well packaged, and you always call me when you arrive.  You're so sweet.

The Chow Mein, Sweet & Sour Chicken, Meatless dishes are great for the veggie peeps out there.  I used to LOVE the chicken salad because it was different than most - fried chicken with peanuts on a bed of lettuce and yummy dressing, but I think the recipe has changed.  Dear chef - if you see this, the shredded lettuce dies upon delivery and turns the salad into SogFest 2015.  

Regardless, this place is super Om nom nom nom.
author: Jenn T.

description:
Delivery of some slightly different Chinese fare is a welcome option.

Liked that it was quick with delivery and did a nice take on pot stickers. Oh, wait, I ordered EARLY, not in the 8-9pm crush that has so many folks up in arms.

Get this: If you place an order past 7pm and expect it to be fired to order AND delivered -- that is 60 min. minimum. It is like some folks think there is a microwave at the other end of phone. Maybe they would prefer that.

Having said that, their curry options were only passable -- I warned off on this choice, but what are you gonna do? But the "classic" Chinese fare was very nicely done, with crisp veggies and not at all greasy.

Give it a shot -- early in the evening.
author: Jeff T.

description:
Awesome veggie dim sum! So hard to find. 

We got delivery and it was delicious.
author: Alex Y.

description: I hate to write one star reviews, but this is just a cautionary for people using credit cards to order delivery. They will manipulate the total amount on your order, which is just so unethical. Also I threw out the food after two bites.
author: Ibi S.

description:
I've had delivery from here and eaten in. It's a great Chinese food option in the neighborhood. For some reason there is limited Chinese restaurants in the Mission. I'm a vegetarian, so I love all of the veg and meatless-meat options on the menu, specifically the vegetarian wonton soup, which can be difficult to find. I haven't had a chance to try all the dim sum options, but look forward to going back to do so. 

On a rainy Sunday night, there were only a couple other parties eating in, but you could tell they were getting a lot of delivery calls. Solid food and good price.
author: Emma S.

description:
Good vegetarian dimsum choices which is the main reason to come here 

Cold Sesame Noodles were a solid B+
author: Sam M.

description:
Bad. Just...bad. 

I ordered the general orange chicken and shrimp dumplings through eat 24. The chicken was SO tough I could hardly bite into it--severely overcooked chicken with way too much dough and drenched in orange sauce.

The shrimp dumplings were ok.
author: Andreea M.

description:
I ordered delivery today. It came VERY fast. Unfortunately,  the food was DISGUSTING.
I ordered Garlic noodles with prawns
And the combination appetizer plate.

I've had Garlic noodles a million times at a million places. These were foul. Just noodles, tons of stale oil, and garlic. In addition the prawns were bad. I mean seriously off and now I'm afraid I will get sick.

The appetizer combo was huge in portions- only problem is EVERYTHING was fried to a crisp. I almost broke my teeth biting into the chicken wing and the crispy prawns.

Again, I've ordered all of these foods before and know how they are supposed to taste. This was not good. Maybe the chef was having a bad day or in a hurry but I feel like I'm gonna barf now.


Nonononononono 
Don't order from here.

Side note: To their credit, they did give me a refund.
Now if I could just get that awful taste out of my mouth.
author: Octavia H.

description:
Flew in late to SF and ordered food to my room as I was too tired to drag myself out - this place took 90 minutes and a follow-up call (was juuuust about to cancel) to deliver average / below average food - but missed the oh so critical water bottles. I'm pretty sure they charged for these too - I'll never know as they neither provided a menu nor a receipt. 

Tip for future business - don't overcharge your customers to leave them sleepless, hungry, and thirsty!
author: Dani S.

description: The guy I'm presuming is the owner is a great guy--attentive, will alter a dish any way you want.  Food is good, reasonably priced and it's a good place to sit and have a lunchtime chat.   It works for me.
author: Daniel P.

description:
I like coming here with non-vegetarian friends because there are solid omnivore AND vegetarian options from every part of the menu. The meatless chicken fried rice, in particular, is tasty and fairly inexpensive - the portion is big enough for two meals. My omnivore bf loves the great value of the dim sum sampler too. 

I was excited to try their vegetarian dim sum as well, but the options are a bit uneven. While the traditionally veggie-centric kinds are great (fried radish cake, etc), sadly, the meatless chicken buns can't hold a candle to real char siu bao, which I still miss from my omnivore past. Still, it's not the fault of Big Lantern that AFAIK there doesn't seem to be any vegetarian approximation of char siu pork yet, so I don't hold it against them, and I'm just glad someone is even attempting to make vegetarian dim sum at all. :)

The lunch specials are a good value and always come with soup, which is great on chilly SF summer days. :P

Although you can't tell from the outside, the interior here is actually pretty nice, with Chinese art and high ceilings. It's rarely totally full, so it's easy to get seated. They do a thriving takeout and delivery business, and they're very thorough about including utensils, condiments, and even fortune cookies in every takeout order.
author: Cat C.

description:
Won't order from here again. I use Eat24 to order take out often, Big Lantern was the only Chinese place open on the app. I placed an order, was told to wait an hour. 1 hour passed and I called to check on the status. A snarky girl told me my order was on the way and hung up. Waited 40 minutes, called again. 
No answer. 
Emailed Eat24 (Martha was great) she called Big Lantern and was told my order had been delivered. 
I received a call from a man telling me it would take an additional 30 minutes for him to get his car (again hung up on me) 
Martha and I waited 40 mins (total time about 2 hours) and then heard back from the mystery man saying he was outside. I looked out the window, no one there! I asked him where he was and he said Haight, I'm on Francisco-Across town! His response "oh my God"
I asked to cancel, without confirmation he hung up. 
Martha from Eat24 was able to get me a refund.
I'm still hungry and it's midnight :(
author: Jarrod R.

description:
Big Lantern used to be our go to place for Chinese. The food is pretty good, but the last few times the food arrives cold and an hour late. This time, it has been one hour and 30 minutes, and I call they just say very rudely "thank you for being patient" and brushed me off when I try to explain my dissatisfaction.

Sorry, but wont ever be ordering from them ever again.
author: Bryan H.

description:
Way too salty and there was msg too. 
Even the egg rolls were too salty. Terrible! 
Will never eat there again.
author: Milo B.

description:
More than 5 years after writing my first review for Big Lantern, we ordered dinner from them last night.

Hot and sour soup, still tasty and fire seasoned, yum!
Turnip cake, you make me smile!
Chicken salad, such a favorite of ours.

The dim sum menu is still a house favorite, but the menu has so many good dishes, in all these years we've never had a bad one.

Maybe one of these days I'll eat in their physical location, but their chow on a warm evening on our deck with a nice bottle of wine...perfect!

Enjoy!
author: William M.

description:
I bit the bullet. 
I had already found my "go-to" Chinese restaurant, but thought I'd try Big Lantern for a change. 
There a TON of things in the menu! That's a huge plus. And they had the specific dish I Iiked, so that sealed the deal. 
It was easy enough ordering through Eat24, & they had a $5 off promo. 
Immediately after I ordered, Eat24 gave a 60-90 minute delivery time, but was quickly changed to just 60 minutes. 
I was really surprised when the driver rang my bell at exactly 60 minutes. Somehow I didn't think it'd be here in time. But it came, the driver was very friendly, and the food was hot. 
The dish was prepared differently than my usual restaurant, which was fine. I'm always up for trying new things. 
The only other problem was the dish was rather greasy. Not that I stopped eating it...I ate every last bite. 
The soup on the other hand was really watery & was definitely bland. I'd read other Yelp posts claiming their food was bland, but shrugged it off. The soup was totally bland. 
Problems occurred after dinner, when my stomach became really upset. I'm not sure if it was food handling, the grease, or what. It wasn't terrible, but it lasted from that night until the next day. 
While I was really happy with the delivery, & the food wasn't terrible, I still think I'll probably continue my quest for my favorite Chinese restaurant.
author: Reed S.

description: I've ordered from these people 3 times. On my last order I decided to write a comment on my order. The comment said "Can you please give us an extra fortune cookie." These sick disturbing people gave me the 2 cookies in one bag and a sorta empty bag they were also soggy.
author: Dan D.

description:
So I was on yelp for like and hour trying find a place to deliver.  It was close to closing for most places so alot were pickup only.  So I finally narrowed it down to this one and another indian restaurant  and I chose this one.  I placed my order online , here through yelp...which is the app eat 24.  The estimated time for delivery was 10:30 and the guy showed up around 11:10.  Also once the guy came to my address he had a hard time finding what room to deliver my food to he had to call me a couple of times before he got the food to me.  Around 11 I called the reastaurant to find out if the food was still coming to me and the waiter on the phone said yes the driver just left with your food.  

So I tried the soup first.  I really didn't like the flavor too much it had almost a sour fishy flavor to it and when I eat hot and sour soup I like it more on the tangy side, but I finished the whole cup ,cauze it wasn't that bad, plus I was hungry(I really hadn't eaten anything all day).  
Onto the Dim sum plater: first i had the (shrimp rolls) very good, although at this pooint I realized that I forgot to order vinegar and hot and sour sauce.  the "shrimp dim sum" was very fresh tasting and they replaced the "shrimp" with some sort of tofu?it tasted fine.  
The next one was the mushu"pork filled" this they filled with big white sticky?rice and lots of tofu, i didn't really like this one too much, but I don't really like the original one anywayz.
  Last onto the "pork bun"  This was pretty good.  Next I tried the Fresh Mango Pudding and this was my favorite of all the items.....even though I couldn't finish it because I was still so full from eating just so little food(hence having not eaten all day) 

 The Dim sum is still there as well as the peach buns, ( I probably will eat in the morning...since that is usually when you eat dim sum anywayz).  I would order from here again,but probably just cause it is hard to find vegetarian alternatives to authentic chinese food.  Next time I will try to order one of their main dishes , like there tofu sandwhich, "tuna" sandwhich, or one of their main rice dishes.  And of course I would order the mango pudding again.
author: Jennifer G.

description: Wow! I've come to expect MSG-soaked faux chicken with questionable broccoli and greasy sauce when ordering out Chinese, so it was great to finally find a place that makes their food sans ickiness. Their chicken and broccoli was excellent: not overstated or overlooked, tender, and nicely sautéed in a thick but grease-free sauce. It's hard to mess up white rice, but I was pleased that it was still warm and moist when it got to my door. My vegetarian companion was equally pleased with her dish. Will definitely be ordering again!
author: Bianca F.

description: First time ever - through Eat24 - big order of a number of dim sum items and Hong Kong Style Chow Mein with Prawns.   Must say, this place was way beyond expectations!   Food arrived within 10 minutes of scheduled time, it was hot and clean and tasty - could have used crispier Hong Kong Style noodles in the Chow Mein but I get that when traveling in a to go container, water condenses and crispy goes "bye bye", LOL - otherwise, it was wonderful.   We will use again and again and again I'm sure.
author: Annie C.

description:
I wouldn't order again and here's why
