the general's chicken was over-fried and heavily stuck together.  it was also cloyingly sweet.

the chow mein was also congealed into the cube shape of the box.
author: mike s.

description: My only Chinese GO TO choice in the area and I love it! Chinatown is my other option but not as convenient to where I live. Fresh and timely delivery. Generous with added items I hadn't ordered, freebies.
author: Sue Y.

description: I go here for the awesome seafood hot and sour soup mainly but also the great steamed wonton with red hot chili appetizer and the sizzling combo platter. Basically, the food is pretty damn good. The service is also great!
author: Moy V.

description: Starving in San Francisco!  I waited 2 1/2 hours, called the restaraunt, and chatted with EAT24 before cancelling my order. The restaraunt never called me back, nor apologized for the delay. This is a very sad day for me, as I had always had good experiences and liked the food from Big Lantern. Now, I will never order from them again because their recent service has been horrible.
author: Jaime R.

description: It's been good for a long time. Very consistent for delivery-fast & arrives hot. I usually don't stray far from the norm here for delivery, despite the menu being super extensive. The dim sum is fine, the soups are great, and anything fried is usually a winner here. Not super thrilled with the veggie options, they use a lot of sauces and oil. Can you get better Chinese in SF? For sure. But will they deliver like BL? Not a chance.
author: Morgan R.

description: Simply the absolute BEST Chinese restaurant in SF. I've been over 100 times and it's 5 star. Delivery is always fast and hot. Food is always good. Clearly some things are better than others but that's personal. Quality is universal.
author: Jamie D.

description: I was stuck home working late and needed a late-night dinner... found that Big Lantern is open until midnight! My only complaint is that the menu doesn't explain the dishes very well--more detail would be helpful. That being said, I ordered the green beans with fried tofu, the vegetarian egg rolls, and the tofu in curry sauce--order arrived faster than estimated (thank you!), delivery driver was nice, and everything was hot and fresh. (I live close to BL, and it was 11pm on a Sunday, so maybe the other reviews are just catching them at a peak time?) In my opinion, the food was super tasty, and the big portions mean I will have Chinese food for days, haha. Will definitely order again, especially for last-minute late night dinners!
author: Domini D.

description:
I recently found this place and order from them several times a week. I love eating here. The employees are very friendly and their delivery is PROMPT even when they are busy they have never been more than like 10 minutes late!

Love these guys! Try the Generals Meatless Chicken, it will change your mind on Tofu!
author: Suzi C.

description: Great veggie kung pao.  Speedy delivery usually.
author: Ryan R.

description: Sadly I never got to try the food. I placed an order and waited almost 2 hours before canceling. Order was placed on a Sunday at 2pm. I called to see if the order was received and they said yes, and it was on it's way. 30 minutes later, still nothing. I would not suggest ordering for delivery unless you have an insane amount of time to wait.
author: Gina H.

description: If you are hungry, order somewhere else, because by the time you get your food, you will have died of starvation. The delivery service is ridiculously slow. I had to call Eat24 and then call the restaurant directly just to get my order. 2 hours later, I received my food, cold of course. It may have tasted better, even slightly warm. Food was maybe 3 stars, I just can't stand bad service. Perhaps, dining in will be better, I'd rather not find out.
author: Bridney R.

description:
Postmates was running their $4.95 special so I thought I would order something from them. I ordered from Big Lantern as a trial.

Food was delivered piping hot. 

Ordered Kung Pao Meatless Chicken and Big Lantern Spicy Fried Rice.

Everything tasted fresh. However there wasn't really any flavor that jumped out at me. It was sort of bland middle of the road.

I will change my review after ordering again with something else, but for now, it stands at three stars.
author: D M.

description: I ordered pick up and apparently grub hub didn't update their prices because I got there and they said I owed them money. If this was like a $15 difference I would understand. It was $2. He literally made me pay him $2 because grub hub didn't update their menu. Very rude, confusing, not well organized, and we saw someone pick up food off the floor and put it back in the pot.
author: Penny L.

description: one word: Big Lantern Tea Flavored Meatless Chicken.
author: Roger C.

description: This is my go to for Chinese takeout. I wouldn't really call it "traditional" but it's great nonetheless. Sure it's not Michelin Star cuisine, but for the price and convenience it's A-OK.
author: Wyatt M.

description:
We were in San Francisco and found Far
East Cafe inChina town still open. We went inside and ordered fried rice, sweet and sour chicken ,and half of roasted duck.  All the foods that came out were cold. For health safety, food should be in right temperature when serving. I will not bring my family again to this place.
author: Pat L.

description: We ordered late night delivery- awesome they were open at 11pm.  The veggies were very good, well prepared and fresh. Kung Pao shrimp was a great choice with a decent amount of shrimp. Spicy Mongolia beef was not that spicy but a good flavor. Great little place!
author: Stacie D.

description: Better than average food (spicy Hunan chicken, Mongolian beef). Pleasant service.
author: Inigo M.

description:
If i could give NO STARS i would. I would give 0 stars to Eat24 AND THIS UNPROFESSIONAL, UNETHICAL, restaurant. 

I have family in town from across america and we ordered food at 8pm. Order ##Y344-51448 through Eat24. I should have known something was up because the restaurant's phone number did not work. 

It is now 10:59PM!!!  We just received our food. COLD FOOD!!!

We are supposed to be asleep right now, but instead we are sitting around looking for things to eat around the house. The order page said UP TO 90 MINUTES and it has been three hours!!! That is false advertising. The EAT24 support was just as slow in responding to my messages as this restaurant. 

THREE HOURS??!! The delivery guy gets here and says "we're super busy" well obviously you are under staffed. You will never ever get my business again. This 100% unacceptable.
author: Jazmyn W.

description:
I'm writing this review expressly to address the many 1-star reviews on this page. Note that most of them are very recent, and many specifically cite "Eat24" or an "app" in the full review.

Most of these reviews in fact reflect failures of Eat24, which seems to have trouble with late-night orders in particular. I've been a Big Lantern eater for years and just to check, tonight I ordered it once more.

We got the Szechuan beef, general meatless (sesame), combination platter of appetizers, and fried rice. It was delivered --on a Saturday night at like 7:00 PM, mind you, peak hours-- in 45 minutes by a very nice guy. It was all packaged perfectly, was quite hot, and tasted, as always, delicious.

I'm sorry so many have had bad experiences with Eat24, but I'm sorrier that they're blaming Big Lantern and leaving horrible reviews for a place that in about 20 orders for me has never once erred or screwed up in the ways described.

PLEASE: if you're considering Big Lantern, know that many of these 1-star reviews reflect the poor service of Eat24 (and perhaps other apps), which has bad service and seems even to allow ordering after Big Lantern has closed.

For those who want to try Big Lantern's delicious Chinese food and truly world-class meatless substitute dishes, don't be dissuaded by folks who tried some terrible app and now blame the restaurant. And more generally: don't use Eat24.
author: Mills B.

description:
100 mins into the 90 min delivery time resulted in a frustrating call where no one could locate my order for delivery - the credit card was charged quickly enough and I had t repeat my telephone number and address too many times.     At this point, don't much care what the food tastes like - my first and last order

2+ hrs later... after way too much time waiting for eat24 on chat, I find the order was never placed

read these reviews more thoroughly and found that this place has very unreliable delivery orders - and they never called me back like they promised to do - awful experience.
author: C S.

description:
A friend had gotten delivery from here and as fans of dim sum, we wanted to give it a try but having had some bad luck with what looks like awesome restaurants and lousy delivery, we decided to eat in first. What attracted our attention was the very large selection of vegetarian and fake meat dim sum.

We came in for lunch on Saturday. The first thing I noticed was the sheer volume of choices in the menu. It was amazing! So many choices! I didn't know where to start. We wound up settling on meatless egg rolls, the vegetarian dim sum combo plate (veggie dumpling, siu mai with meatless chicken, and bbq meatless chicken bun), the turnip cake, bbq pork buns, and another type of dumpling. 

The food came out quick which was great since we were starving at this point. We got a *tonne* of food, so much we couldn't finish it all. It was delicious though and we ate to the point of being stuffed. We probably would have kept eating if we could find room for it but alas.

The price is decent, although we had drinks which raised the bill a tad. We left really happy with our lunch and we definitely will be ordering for delivery in the future. I have a feeling Big Lantern is going to wind up on our regular food delivery options!
author: Cassandra J.

description: I am so disappointed. I love the food but the service is so bad - no customer can win with this place. They lie about when food will be delivered, ETA;s etc. and they trip up on their words that you know they are lying. I can't stand dealing with them so I will just have to find another chinese food delivery place. Sucks because the spicy rice was delish.
author: Audrey T.

description:
No doubt the best Chinese-American food that I've tried!! I couldn't believe how good it was! The food here is the closest that I've had to Beijing food.

The Big Tea Lantern Prawns (I think that was the name) were too good! And portions are big.

If you live in or are visiting the city- the food here is BETTER THAN CHINATOWN!
author: Ruvan D.

description: I love this place. They are so accommodating on the phone and delivery never takes more than an hour. The chicken chow main, veggie fried rice, egg rolls and dim sum are the bomb.com. We order now at least once a week!
author: Camille A.

description: It took an hour and a half for them to deliver the food. Once it arrived, the delivery driver would not come up to my hotel room as other delivery drivers have done in previous days. While the food had good flavor, the texture was tough as though the items had been sitting for some time. For those reasons, I would not reorder from this location.
author: Vincent I.

description: I've been ordering from here for a while and have to say hands down this is great Chinese food for the belly:)
author: Olafur G.

description:
DO NOT ORDER ONLINE FROM THEM!!

I placed an order through Eat24, and it had been 2 and half hours before it came. My boyfriend and I were starving and the delivery guy gave zero cares in the world that he was late.
When I spoke to the manager on the phone his words were "you should just have canceled the order"
Well I kind of wish I did, but are you serious??? What kind of business plan is that?? They have poor customer relations, and their food was cold and rubbery and I found a weird looking unidentified black object in my food.

Very disappointed, especially because they have good ratings.
author: Angie G.

description:
There is seriously nothing to hate and everything to love about Big Lantern.

Location? Prime. On 16th right by two of my favorite bars - Kilowatt and Gestalt Haus. The next time you're hungover, maybe fill yourself up with chow mein before drinking some really good craft beer. 

You can sit outside at one of their sidewalk tables, take in the sun, and do some of the best people watching in the Mission. A bum seriously started puking almost right in front of our table, yet somehow that didn't make a bad experience for me. City living, right? 

The staff here are very friendly and the menu is HUGE with lots of vegan options for your lame-ass friends. They offer some pretty damn good Chinese food for pretty damn cheap too. $18 for my friend and I. Can't beat this.
author: K M.

description:
Ordered almost  $100.00  of food from this restaurant ( for myself) since I am a busy working professional from out of town. Food was HORRIBLE, cold, unappetizing . 
Spoke to restaurant directly and they were unwilling to give partial refund or discount. Didn't eat 95% of the food and into the trash the food containers went... Food And Money in the trash!!! Do not eat at a restaurant that does not care about its food quality and customers ... Big Lantern will be dim light soon.
author: Vickie D.

description:
This place was delicious!

Their Mu Shu Pork and Chicken Chow Fun was amazing! 

I'm used to Mu Shu dishes coming with those really thin pancakes/tortillas, but this place had a full on thick flour tortilla. With some hoisin sauce added to that tortilla, that just made my day!

The String Bean with BBQ Pork was a bit on the salty side, but the rest totally made up for it. 

They also served dim sum which I didn't get to try, but will definitely be back to try next time.
author: Eddy M.

description:
Portions are alright, but the general chicken was basically general chicken jerky. Also the fried chicken on my appetizer plate (which I got to test out their flagship appetizers) had feathers still attached (??). The eggrolls were good; the crab puff was not. The fried prawns had almost no flavor to it at all.

The rice, however was really good.

I feel like I didn't order the right things.

They do get bonus points for being open late.
author: Charles N.

description: There was a metal screw in their fried rice. Don't waste your money at this place.
author: Robert I.

description:
It took nearly 2 hours for my order to arrive. To make matters worse, both vegetarian dishes had meat in them. Big Lantern had been a favorite place for quite some time but after this rather unpleasant experience I doubt I will ever give them any business from now on.

So much disappointment!!
author: Aaron S.

description:
Good pan-Chinese restaurant with an extensive menu, including many vegetarian dishes! 

I'm not veggie by any means but it's great to have some lighter options when eating out at Chinese places. Their "meatless" meat items are not replacements for chicken or beef for sure, but quite good in their own right as tofu/tempeh/mushrooms and I would order them. 

I say "pan-Chinese" as they have dim sum, standard Cantonese, some Sichuan type and northern Chinese style dishes. A bit Americanized for sure but they're good. The four-stars are really for the breadth and taste of veggie dishes.

We had a large dinner group on a Fri night and received attentive service.

It's too bad Eat24 seems to be botching their delivery service but their food and service are good, and I'll be trying them for delivery too!
author: Aki N.

description: A lil' on the expensive side, but worth it for the good food. Delivery time can be a little slow, but definitely not unbearable.
author: Heather N.

description:
fist off, we placed an order at 11:37 it is now 12:46!!!!!!!!! we called to see an hour after we placed our order and they hung up on us. we where at work and choose to wait but now we regret it. thus place gets a zero in customer service! zero in food since they never showed up. after 2 hrs. never order for delivery because you just might nit get your order!!!!!
now i am hungry and can use a sniker bar! lol
author: Sabritas E.

description: I ordered delivery. Why instead of two cups of hot tea (see Hot Tea in menu) 1.5 usd each, I got two plain tea bags? In what way were they hot? Why don't you say in menu that it's one tea bag that you sell for 1.5 usd?
author: Ekaterina K.

description:
Okay, I wish I can give them more than just 2 stars because of how good the food is. Unfortunately, the reason why I am giving only 2 stars is because my boyfriend and I came in to eat during my lunch time. Ive been going to eat at this restaurant since i was 14 volunteering at the Boys and Girls club next to the shell gas station, but anyways as we sit down to order our drinks and food, everything was great and yummy except for the waiter she never came to our table to ask if we needed anything I asked her for a cup of water about 4 times never came with a cup of water, I asked her for sweet and sour sauce gave me an attitude and never came back with it.. we asked for the check, it was pretty high for just 2 lunch specials and two drinks.. ($50) she brought the check my boyfriend paid and gave her $60, we sit there at the table talking and when we got up to leave i said wait she never brought you your $10 I asked her and she had the audacity to say, "You want your change? Because that's my tip" giiiiiiiiirl I was mad i was like excuse me? you did not even attend us at all.. but yeah thats just one part of it. 

I order again today to have my food delivered, and the total came out to $14.73 for 1 lunch special and a soda idk how or why soo much.. but the delivery guy is rude smoking a cigarette and blowing it in my face. I give the guyt $15 because he was smoking, and he looks at me and says "you just give me $15? no $16?" And again I said yeah because you are rude and you are smoking and blowing it in my face. To top things off, he starts talking mess in his language and drives away. BTW My order is completely wrong!!!!!! 

I AM LIVID AS MUCH AS THIS PLACE IS GOOD, I DONT THINK I WILL BE DINING IN OR ORDERING FOR DELIVERY ANY TIME SOON...
author: Bianca R.

description:
This review is for dining in.

My friend and I came to Big Lantern on a Wednesday night at 7:30pm. We were greeted by a friendly host and seated immediately. The restaurant was about 1/3 occupied. It was a nice atmosphere for my friend and I to catch up.

The number of items on the menu is pretty overwhelming. I ended up getting the Wood Ear Mushroom Chicken at the suggestion of the waiter. My friend got the Salmon with Asparagus. We also got sides of rice. The food arrived at the table about 10-15 minutes after ordering, piping hot. Both dishes were delicious and the portions were huge. We each had more than enough to box up and take home for another meal.

Halfway through the meal I asked if they had any spicy sauce to kick things up a notch and the waiter brought over a spicy oily sauce that took my dish to the next level.

Overall, a good experience at Big Lantern. I will definitely be back to try a few more items on the expansive menu.
author: Angela C.

description:
(See pics) Review #1116. More of 3.5 stars. Inexpensive greasy good Chinese food (yeah they are many expensive and overpriced ones.) Lots of dish choices. The spring rolls (vegetarian) were good crispy. The eggplant with chicken and prawns came with lots of rice. It was tasty but not that spicy despite the look. Do like how they properly cooked the eggplant to very tender. The dish was loaded with sodium so drink lots of tea afterwards.

They also serve dim sum, and a varied selection of faked meat dishes for vegetarians. Have not tried and something to check out on the next visit.

The space was nice with the recent renovation, decorations and newer seats that gave the place a clean feel and it was not noisy. Both are a rarity for Chinese places. Good service too.
author: T L.

description:
Ordered take out from here.   Generally it was pretty good.  I wasn't expecting truly authentic Chinese and it wasn't, but it was definitely acceptable for delivery and very good value in terms of portion size.  

- Mu shu chicken - the filling was very good, but the pancakes were too thick and smelled stale.  
- Garlic pea shoots - no flavor, very bland.  Wouldn't order again. 
- Mixed veggies - good assortment including corn, zucchini, broccoli, but again not much flavor. 
- Vegetable dim sum combination - this wasn't what I expected.  It turned out to be fake pork buns, fake meat shiu mai, and a vegetable dumpling with very thick glutinous skin.  I wouldn't order this again. 
- Free chicken lo mein (due to order exceeding $30) - this was pretty tasty, and had a nice combination of chicken and broccoli, but it was drenched in soy sauce. 

Overall $36 before tip.  It was delivered in 50 minutes.  The portions were very large so it was pretty good value.  But the flavor was hit or miss.
author: Vivian W.

description: Took two hours to get my food when I was quoted 1 hour. Everything was cold and soggy and when eat24 reached out to the restaurant they refused to do anything. I work in hospitality and that statement stings. My order is also wrong including the mango bun, instead they sent me red bean... I Will NEVER order from this place again and will recommend everyone to stay away based solely on POOR SERVICE!
author: David V.

description:
I don't care how good your food is.  When you're guilty of stealing $230,000 (that we know of) from your workers, you're scum.  It's pretty simple.  Any business owner who knowingly underpays employees should not only be liable for back pay and fines; he or she should go to jail.  Every time.  No exceptions.

Here's the proof:  http://insidescoopsf.sfgate.com/blog/2012/03/09/why-has-there-been-a-rush-of-restaurant-wage-violation-busts/

Scum, scum, scum.
author: John S.

description:
It's so unfortunate how horrific their service is, because the food is actually pretty decent. A $30 order will take them OVER TWO HOURS and talking to the restaurant doesn't help. They make up excuses and lie to buy time, and when the food does show, you'll open a bag of flipped over boxes, sauces leaking everywhere and just a cold pile of trash. If you complain well enough, they'll refund you for a dish or two or offer you a "discount" perhaps, so I highly recommend you voice your complaints to them! It'll slightly lessen that anger in your hungry stomach. 
 
This is how they deliver their food every time. Guaranteed! It's the only thing you can expect from Big Lantern.
author: Kylie L.

description: Great dumplings! Service tends to be a little slow.
author: Krish C.

description: Be warned--we loved this place and ordered from here weekly, until they sent us a meat dish instead of the vegetarian item we ordered, on TWO separate occasions! Fool me once....etc. This shamed customer won't be back, and if you want to get served what you've actually ordered, you shouldn't either.  At least until they develop more respect for their customers (and staff) than they have for their high turnover profits.
author: Be F.

description:
I ordered from Eat 24 for something delicious for me and my Giant last Saturday.  Not only did they have a great selection, but they were accessible.  I ordered at 2pm on a Saturday thinking it might be a down time.  I got the order on the dot 75 minutes later, and I live in the Mission District (which their delivery times says 45-75 minutes.  Recommendation to users and restaurant: Let's face it, after the reviews on here and my experience, expect 75 minutes plus.  The restaurant might want to update their delivery times to reflect exactly how long it will take...)

Food: Sampler of Dim Sum (outstanding)
Shrimp Dumpling (outstanding)
Hot & Sour Soup (asked for extra spicy - not spicy at all)
Bacon wrapped shrimp (outstanding - even included an onion in it, which helped it not get super dried out from deep frying it)
Seafood and vegetables (great - lots of great garlic)
Kung Pao Prawns (lunch special - no frills - just the dish and brown rice - $1 extra)

Order from them again - Yes, with planning for long wait time.
Food - Great overall.
author: Stacey D.

description:
wow, i can't believe i first reviewed this place 5 years ago. i still love their food but it's so expensive. i ordered shrimp spicy fried rice and it came out to $12... it only had 6 or 7 shrimp in it. come on now.... if i'm gonna pay that much for it (which came in a to-go box instead of the bigger containers), i expect at least 10! :/

but i stick by my original review, the food is still greasy AF.
author: Alyssa L.

description: Decided to eat here after a night at the bars. Didn't read any reviews beforehand but after the experience we had I was definitely surprised to see all the negatives! We got the meatless kung pao chicken, the meatless five spice chicken, and orange tofu. It was all amazing, especially the five spice. Apparently dining in is the way to go here.
author: Ryann P.

description:
Sooooooo many vegetarian options!!!!    Fast, friendly service and the place is clean too.  If you're a soy-loving vegetarian/vegan, this place is a treat. 
Also, I got the best fortune in my fortune cookie!  It says "All thing has a cause.  Look into your pass for answer."
author: Daisy A.

description:
This meal was mediocre. First me and my boo thang ordered orange chicken beef and broccoli and chow mein. They brought out general chicken. Uh we didn't order this. Let the lady know. Five minutes pass they brought back chicken that looked the same except with orange peals in the sauce 


20 minutes later after looking at the chicken sit in front of my face while I drooled looking at it. And after my boo daddy asked the lady where our noodles and beef was she brought it to our table 20 minutes later to be eaten with our cold orange general chicken. 


Next time after that I'll go to emmys on ocean ave
author: Chenea P.

description:
I've ordered here over 20 times; routinely, the delivery time runs up to 2 hours.  Up until now, I was fine with that. However, today they even refused to deliver it to my Apartment - citing lack of parking as an excuse. 

I'm done with this place.
author: Ben L.

description:
Yuuum. If you're looking for some vegan/vegetarian Chinese food, and have been feeling a little burnt out on Golden Era or Loving Hut, Big Lantern is a great alternative. 

Conveniently located on 16th between Valencia and Guerrero, Big Lantern's prices and food portions are actually quite generous considering. Both times I've been I got the five spicy mock chicken. On a huge plate is a pile of the chicken and delicious broccoli. For a spicy dish, it could be a little bit spicier but that's how I always feel. Last time I was there, I also tried the sesame mock chicken, which is basically the same thing in a different sauce. I'll probably be ordering that next time.

There's a ton of dim sum options here too, but I haven't tried any yet. With all the food on the regular vegetarian menu, it might take me a while to venture to the dim sum.

Definitely wanna check this place out again soon.
author: Jon T.

description:
My new go-to delivery Chinese
- cheap and awesome hours
- delicious fresh veggies
- rich won ton soup
- addictive spicy fried rice with pork that's crispy and diced perfectly bite-sized
- even adds a big container of delicious garlic spicy sauce for sautéed green beans
author: Laura C.

description:
I really really liked Jasmine Tea House before they sold to other. According to my husband, Big Lantern is somehow related to the original Jasmine Tea House.

I'm sick. I want sizzling rice soup. I want the original Jasmine Tea House sizzling rice soup. I'm a big baby when I'm sick. 
So we ordered from Big Lantern who yeah delivered. Also got Kung Pao. I didnt eat that. Soup was for me.
Ok, soup was blech. But, ya know, I'm sick so can't really be trusted. 
Husband liked the Kung Pao...he gives it 3 stars.
author: El B.

description:
Great food, friendly service, good prices, and nice portions. The storefront signage is actually obscured by a tree, so look carefully. 

A note to families, though: They had Tosh.O playing on the TVs which isn't exactly child friendly usually. I'm sure you could ask to have them change the channel, but for my party and I, it wasn't a big deal.

Be forewarned that it's ridiculous trying to find a parking spot in the area.
author: Daniel D.

description:
Very disappointing ordering experience!!!
We ordered via Eat24 and after one hour we got the call that BL did not even start cooking our order! After a long day we decided to order - now 9:30pm, order canceled, no food, still hungry, thanks!
author: Mark T.

description:
Delicious vegetarian Chinese main dishes and dim sum. Quick and fresh delivery.

We loved it and will order again!

We tried the chive and meatless chicken dumpling. This was delicious. My other favorite was the vegetarian potsticker. Bother were great.

We ordered the vegetarian dim sum sampler. The "pork" buns had very little "meat" and was mostly just the dough. The other two dumplings were okay. But the chive and pot sticker were definitely stand outs.

We also tried the Sichuan "chicken" and asparagus. Tons of asparagus and less of the meat. Flavored nicely though. Tasted good but I will try another dish next time.

Everything was delivered hot and as if it went right from the pan to our plate.
author: Zoe D.

description:
Note!!! Hours on Thursday -- only open until 11. 

Rediscovered my Yelp account from 2010 to review for this place. Came here many times a few years ago, but last night I drove here after picking up my partner from SFO exciting to get some late night (veggie) Chinese, walked in at 10:50 and the girl was very nice but said they were closing at 11. We said it said midnight online, she said yes they have been trying to get it changed for a while now. Nonetheless they still let us order to go and threw in some complimentary rice for our inconvenience. Food was great! Thank you Big Lantern.
author: Brittany B.

description: My old lady and I ordered pot-stickers, sesame chicken, and chow mien (because they were out of chow-fun) for delivery. Delivery did take a while but we understood because it was Saturday night. Pot stickers were good, chicken was delicious, and the chow mien was some of the best I ever had. We are going to order again tonight, second night in a row, and hope they have some chow fun! It was that good!
author: Everette R.

description:
I fucking love dim sum. Real talk. I love everything about it. The little bites. The tiny baskets. The communal experience. It all does it for me. Sadly, being a vegan my dim sum options are often limited... if not nonexistent. I haven't actuall had dim sum in about 3 years because of this. If only I had known Big Lantern existed sooner!

They have a TON of options for both veggies and meat eaters alike, and they deliver. Delivery dim sum! You mean I can eat while naked in bed?! Does life get any better than this?!

Only if they opened a delivery mini bar too.
author: Jillian M.

description:
I am writing a follow up review to CG posted above.  
 
We were completely horrified to find a worm/bug cooked in our food. Have ordered from this place many times in the past never with any issues.

When we called to tell them what we had found, their answer was "Well, what do you want us to do about it?"  Considering we just spent over $60 on our dinner, that wasn't the answer we were looking for. 
 
If you order from here, I'd look before you bite.
author: Elyssa D.

description: Found roach on bottom of my steamed pork bun. Can't trust what I am eating.
author: Josh E.

description: This is the first time I ever tied dim sum. I don't have anything to compare it to....but I really enjoyed it. If I'm ever in the area again I plan on stopping in again. It seemed as if there was a large selection. I enjoyed being able to see into the kitchen. Service was good.
author: Mary Jordan S.

description:
This place is responsible for the worst delivery experience I've ever had. So in a way, they should be proud of this achievement. I placed an order at 9:25pm. At 10:47pm I inquired as to its whereabouts. The owner said it would be 20 more minutes. At 11:15 I asked again, he said the driver was on his way and that it would be a few more minutes. At 11:40pm, he said it would arrive any minute... At 12:07am I cancelled the order. 

The issue isn't so much that it took almost 3 hours and never arrived, nor that they were completely unapologetic the entire time. The issue is how the issue was handled. It is pretty clear that the driver was never enroute. I know that the first thing you're thinking is why didn't I just cancel the order after about an hour and 15 mins and order from another place. Fair question. Part of the reason was that it had gotten so late that I was somewhat committed to the order and also because I was watching Game of Thrones and didn't want to step away. Part of the issue is that had they just admitted that they messed up, I could have cancelled the order and placed another one. 

So the bottom line is that Big Lantern earns a one star review, a rating that I rarely give. The one star is also extremely generous. If you are reading this Mr. Lantern, I think you handled this situation terrible and I don't want to call you a liar but I also don't know how to finish this sentence. 

Oh and seeing as this order was placed through Eat 24, the entire facts of this are verifiable and on record. However, Eat 24 handled the whole situation very professionally and tried everything in their power to make it right.
author: N S.

description:
Ordered for delivery... After 2 additional phone calls to find out where our order is, it finally arrived nearly 2 hours after placing order. The deliver guy was very nice and was apologetic, and I feel a little bad for getting upset with him, but hey, I was hungry and he was late and that's what happens. They should have called.

On to the food... totally mediocre at best.

The chow fun had no flavor, 
The onion pancakes takes gross and like shortening, coating your tongue in a gross way, 
The basil chicken wasn't basil-y at all but served with a big tub of hoisin, The dish was mostly steamed.
The Singapore style noodle were lightly curried, slightly dry but okay overall,
The shanghai dumplings were on the dry side.
The shrimp dumplings were average at best.

Over all, there are a million other bad Chinese restaurants to choose from.
author: Fareed R.

description:
Was quoted 55-90 minutes for delivery, and the food arrived in 25 minutes.

Initially, upon opening the bag in which the food was delivered, my roommate and I exchanged concerned looks due to the foul odor permeating throughout the room. It cleared quickly, and only tasty food smells remained.

The Dim Sum Combination Plate was delicious and perfect for sharing - all three were delicious, with great texture & flavor.
The Beef Chow Mein was a little bit on the oily side (as Chinese delivery Chow Mein tends to be), but the veggies and noodles were flavorful and perfectly-cooked, while the beef was tender and well-seasoned - the portion was large and even after sharing between two adult guys, there are leftovers.

All in all, a really great Chinese delivery spot.
Definitely will be ordering from here again.
author: Jonathon W.

description: Huge vegetarian collection. Tasty food. Fast service, and really quick delivery. I order from here pretty often. One star less coz it's not the cleanest. Everything else is good.
author: Deepa A.

description:
Ok, So this place was fine the first couple times I ordered from here. The food's a little greasy but not anything I can't look past. 
The other night I called in and ordered the Kung Pao chicken. The man on the phone was incredibly rude! He even hung up the phone before I could give him my credit card info! At this point I wanted to cancel the order but was too starving to do so. The food arrived 45 minutes later. The driver was friendly but all the sauce had spilled out of the plastic container and was all over the inside of the bag. My card had already been charged so I said nothing to the driver.

All in all I give the food 3 stars and the service 1. I don't think I'll be ordering from this place again.
author: A. Tellez T.

description: Better than you're average takeout. I have never actually eaten at the location, but the selection of vegetarian food is terrific and tasty. Highly recommend for Vegetarian, Vegans and Pescatarians.
author: Juan G.

description: I've been going to Big Lantern for years. When I was vegan, I relied on them for their meatless chicken. They're SO delicious. If you're looking for Chinese food in the mission, you NEED to come here. They're the absolute best.
author: Anah R.

description:
Ordered delivery last night - NEVER AGAIN!!

I should have listened to my gut when I read all the reviews reporting ridiculous wait times. I ordered on line at 7:15 and TWO HOURS later they finally arrived. No explanation, no comp, the sauce from one of the dishes was all over the inside of the bag, and to top it off they got my order wrong. The food was decent tho, so two stars for that.

Seriously Big Lantern, step it up.
author: Kate M.

description:
Disappointing-  We ordered the General Beef (with Sesame) and Orange Chicken for delivery.  

The General Beef, was dry and had almost no "beef", just breading and sauce, and a stingy portion of sesame sprinkled on top.  When I stuck my fork into it to get some from the plate, it was stiff and when I ate it, it was just plain bad.  The flavors were fine, but the quality of meat was awful.  

The orange chicken was orange colored and was tender, but had no orange flavor, just tasted like soy sauce and was salty instead of sweet and sour.

The order on eat24.com said 60-80 minutes for delivery, but it came in about 45 minutes 1.8mi delivery.

I would not recommend this restaurant based on the quality of the food we had.
author: Emmanuel M.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in SF and one of the only veggie dim sum.. I would give it 5 stars but my absolutely favorite dim sum, the taro vegetarian puff (think deep fried Chinese mashed potatoes) doesn't always come out hot enough. But don't let that deter you, it is amazing, as is general meatless chicken.
author: fritz h.

description: Food is good, pricing is a little high for what you get, the waiter is dull without any personality.  Ambiance is great with lots of light with carpet needs cleaning. Very few people at noon Sunday lunch crowd.  Bathroom was dark, dungy, smelly and broken toilet.  My first time for Sunday lunch.
author: Dino M.

description:
Ordered for a late night delivery and it took a little bit but that's to be expected in the city! The food was delicious and the portions were pretty good to share for the price.

Chow me in tasted a little funny but the combo fried rice was really delicious so I definitely recommend it!
author: Maya F.

description: This place is absolutely terrible. It took over 2 hours for our order the come, when we tried to cancel and get our money refunded the manger hung up. Never order from here, you won't get any food.. or your money back.  I wish zero stars was an option. This place is garbage.
author: Megan M.

description:
They got rid of the super grumpy waiter who was almost always there there grumping around the tables and used to answer the phone a lot - yay!

They taste great - at least the things I often order.  

They have not taken two hours to deliver food since the one time they did...  In fact one time they brought food to the door practically right after I hung up the phone and returned from my venture to the corner store.  They will even deliver to the Outer Sunset if you order $25 or more - that's good!

They're a go-to delivery essential at my house and not bad for dining out either for an inexpensive quick meal or a meal with many people.
author: Dizzy L.

description:
Against my better judgement, I ordered delivery because I was lazy. Word on the street (Franny S.) is that you must dine in to enjoy the less greasy version of these dishes. Delivery time 1.5 hours at 5 miles out. 

Onion Pancake: bland and thin, comes with peanut sauce. I like mine thick, doughy on the inside and crispy on the outside. 

Big Lantern Tea Flavored Chicken: flavorful and tasty. I liked the texture of the chicken (crunchy on the outside and chewy on the inside). It was a bit tough but I like my meat tough. 

The meal excited my stomach...not in a good way. Perhaps the grease?
author: N ..

description: Overall good food especially meatless chicken and non-meat options, however, their service is not on par with the food being served. I'm giving this review after dining here for more than 8 times. Over the last few months I have been only taking pickup orders and twice they messed up my orders - once the wrong food and the other time, food left for delivery - waited for 45min and the delivery guy had to bring back the food.
author: Ram A.

description:
It seems that nearly every staff member of where I work goes here for lunch. Which always kind of perplexed me. I mean, why would you go get Chinese food when you work in the Mission? Especially if it's about 4 blocks away?

I finally gave in to the temptation, or maybe it was pressure and had lunch here yesterday despite the fact that I had brought my own lunch to work.

I trudged the four blocks in the lousy rain (hey, I'm from LA ... walking ANY distance AND in the rain is NEVER fun for me).  I ordered the sesame chicken lunch special for two reasons: 1) It had a little chili pepper next to it indicating it was spicy and 2) It came highly recommended.  I ordered it with white rice (you have the choice of brown also), and extra spicy, in fact, "as spicy as you can make it" is what I said.

For a bit under 7 bucks I got a load of chicken, white rice, small salad, egg drop soup, and a fortune cookie... and boy, was I full!

The chicken was delicious. Not like the sesame chicken I'm used to, but almost like a cross between sesame chicken and orange chicken. I didn't think it was spicy, although mine was "extra spicy" but my coworkers could barely handle their own meals (so I guess it might be spicy to some).

I'll definitely be going back. It was really good for an awesome price!
author: Vanessa F.

description:
Vegetarian dim sim at Big Lantern was awesome!  So many choices and all the ones I tried (which were quite a few) were delicious.  I especially recommend the Taro Puff, the veggie Wonton soup, and the spinach dumplings.  This place will definitely become one of my new favorite places to hit up.

ps.  very friendly service!  :)
author: Tara R.

description: Great food but the order came in a bag that was a sopping mess of sauce. It took a lot of careful extraction to keep sauce from spilling onto everything.
author: Kyle K.

description: I have never had a bad meal at this place. I am vegan an am excited that this place has a lot of vegan options!!! And  non vegan options too. I love that I can bring all of my friends, no matter their diet, to BL and everyone's pallet is accommodated. Staff is always friendly, and the prices are reasonable. Love the cheap drinks too.
author: Honest M.

description:
They don't deliver to me so I have no complaints about the service, we always get takeout.  Usually wait 10 or 20 minutes depending on how busy they are, so not bad.  
dim sum pretty mediocre but not bad

mongolian beef spicy and flavorful
kung pao chicken tasty and juicy
beef and broccoli little dry but not bad
free chow mien after ordering a certain $ amount of food greasy and a little bland but not bad

overall pretty decent, but that being said I am comparing it to a number of extremely sub-par chinese restaurants we have eaten at since moving to the bay area.  We were glad to find one that is at least consistently palatable enough for us to have food that complements kung fu night.
author: Amol T.

description: We had some walnut prawns and dim sum delivered and it was guuuuuud
author: Arielle M.

description: Called at 9:00pm for delivery to a hotel. They took the order. With still no food I called the restaurant after 40 minutes, but they didn't even answer the phone. After an hour they couldn't find the order. Then the driver shows up at 10:30pm. Are you kidding me?
author: Al N Ran V.

description:
Your basic chinese resto.  I had the hot n sour soup.  Despite their promises, I don't believe it was kosher.  I also had the garlic-chili cucumber dish, which was good, but so spicy I coughed!  Add to that some veggie steamed dumplings, and I was good for the night.

Service was curt, but sufficient.  Being a Monday night, it was not full of cute hipster patrons as I was hoping...
author: Sean S.

description:
I ordered delivery through grub hub expecting a long delivery time based off of these reviews. I received my food in 75 minutes, but the long wait time was okay since I budgeted for it.

Food:
Lemon Chicken - Excellent
Mandarin Meatless Chicken - Good
Crab Cheese Puff - Good

No rice included with either the Lemon Chicken or the Mandarin Meatless Chicken, which was a little surprising.  The portions are pretty big though, and they have lots of vegetarian options.

Would eat here again, with the expectation of a 75+ minute delivery time.
author: Ashley C.

description: The shanghai dumplings were great, plus they have a lunch special on weekends with portions large enough to feed two. We went on a Saturday around noon, there were only 2 other parties eating so the staff were very attentive and the food came out quick.
author: Sarah W.

description:
I just went with a friend today for the first time and we both enjoyed the food we had very much. It was pretty home-style Chinese-American I guess, but I enjoyed my BBQ Pork Egg Foo Young and my friend ahd Shanghai Eggplant with prawns and she LOVED it. We also shared an order of fried turnip cake dimsum, and it was decent, nothing special, but on the plus side a veggie version. The Hot and Sour soup that came with the lunch specials was just OK, better after sprinkling a bit extra vinegar. The menu shows a potential for many veggie dishes, though I am not sure how much one can trust or not that things are completely veggie, so if anyone has a better feel for that.... in the case of more particular vegetarian friends who have been "tricked" before, let me know.

I was thinking I should try their delivery sometime since we are about a mile away, but if I do I will not expect it to be fast, given what many others have written.
author: Asher B.

description:
I have only ordered delivery from Big Lantern and was surprised the first time I tried their sauteed string beans.  There was a tasty, light soy-like sauce with garlic.  However, when I ordered the same thing two weeks later, the green beans were not as crisp but the flavor was still satisfying.  

If asked, they will give you a free veggie fried rice if you order two entrees.  Both veggie and meatless chicken fried rice are decent.  Either paired with the string beans and some chili oil/soy sauce makes for a satisfying, convenient, and not too greasy Chinese meal.

You can also place your order online at Eat24Hours.  However, I do not know if/how they'd honor the free fried rice with order of 2 entrees deal.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
I was looking for some dim sum late in the day but also feeling lazy--so what I needed was a place that delivered.

I ordered shrimp dumplings, chive dumplings, pork buns and egg custard. They all tasted pretty good and the price was okay. Delivery took an hour, which is too be expected I guess. I'll have to try their other stuff some other time, but I'll definitely remember this place for future reference.
author: Dimartin N.

description:
I've never actually been to the restaurant, but I've ordered from them for delivery via Eat24 8-10 times now.  I am literally in love with their General chicken.  It's this spicy tangy sweet almost dry rubbed dish of deliciousness.  I also love their Chow Mein (with beef), which I almost like better cold as leftovers than hot.

They are the only place I've had delivered dim sum that were actually great.  The one must order are the wontons in chili sauce.  So delicious.  

Only thing I've ordered that I didn't like was the lo mein with pork.  The lo mein was great (if a bit tasteless) and was loaded with fresh crispy veggies, but I was not a fan of their roasted pork.  I'd also skip the gyoza, they're a bot too doughy.  Other than that everything I've had was good.
author: Ali B.

description:
If brunch in general is challenging for the mixed veg/non-veg crowd, dim sum can feel like a lost cause. 

That's where Big Lantern comes in. 

While I can't speak for the non-vegan half of the menu, except to say that the baked BBQ pork bun was delicious, the vegan half was really good! 

As a group of four, we decided to share food. We were really pleased by the wide selection of vegan and mockmeat options. The chik'n siu mai had the perfect texture and were quite flavorful. I loved the sweet and tangy BBQ chik'n bun. The texture of the turnip cakes were spot-on. But the best of the vegan options was the sweet rice tamale, which was a great balance between sweet and savory. 

And I loved that the sesame balls (Chinese donuts) were piping hot. 

Four stars for the food, knocked one point because the vegans deserve the chance at their own baked BBQ chik'n bun. 

Grateful to Big Lantern for being the perfect place to bring a mixed omni/veg group of friends!
author: Shana H.

description: Good salt and pepper wings but mediocre szhechuan chicken.  Definitely worth a try again for other dishes.  My second time ordering for delivery they took over 2 hours, so I cancelled the order and asked Grubhub for a refund.  The restaurant didn't even apologize.  Just "oh ok".
author: Jack T.

description:
My office used to order lunch delivery from Big Lantern regularly. I've tried some chicken dishes, seafood dishes, lo mein and some dim sum items. Food is standard. Most of the time, it was super greasy and too bland. 

Service was decent.

Again, another Chinese restaurant that was just OK.

With the variety of Chinese places in San Francisco and Oakland, it's easy to run into a Chinese establishment that just is sub par.
author: Natasha S.

description:
Takes a bit long to get delivery but it's worth the wait. 

I would highly recommend the chicken fried rice, broccoli chicken, or shrimp dumplings to anyone!

Other dishes I've had and enjoyed, but are a bit more polarizing:

General Chicken- This is a fairly sweet dish that is fried and very unhealthy. However it's good when you get it and great to eat later after being in the refrigerator.

Chow Mein- Very good when you get it, but not a dish you want to put in the refrigerator to save for later as it is quite greasy and congeals.
author: Alex T.

description: Convenient location, very filling. The crispy tofu with peppers needed something more... It was a bit bland. The mandarin faux chicken was very good.
author: Anna M.

description:
I signed up on yelp tonight solely so I could give a review on the terrible food we got tonight. We ordered delivery from Big Lantern through eat 24. No problem with the delivery but the food was the worst Chinese I ever had. 
The one star is for the potstickers. They were at best okay and at least we were full when we finished eating. 
The general tsoa's and the orange chicken were the worst doughy pieces of an excuse for Chinese cuisine I thought I would ever taste in SF. 
It was meager bits of chicken with mushy funnel cake making up the majority of substance in each piece. I would not recommend anyone eat here and most definitely would not get it delivered if you choose to eat it. 
My wife and I have been searching for good Chinese delivery since we moved here last year and have had no such luck.
author: Jeshua R.

description:
I've now been to Big Lantern on at least a dozen occasions -- both for eat-in and take-out -- and my experience with the breadth of its vegetarian dishes is much better and much deeper.  I don't take back anything of my previous review (other than the rating), as I acknowledge (both then and now) that my earlier review was premature.  That said, I stand by my qualified hesitation regarding the General's Meatless Chicken.  I've never gotten it again, and I don't think I ever will.  I know now, however, that one can order the General Meatless Chicken without it being deep fried.

My favorite dish, bar none, is the Kung Pao Meatless Chicken.  It is, in fact, the very best vegetarian kung pao I've had anywhere.  Despite my concern about the veggie chicken based on its deep fried preparation, this veggie chicken is amazing.  It's delicious.  It's wonderful.  I love its taste and texture.  I've tried it in the kung pao, the basil meatless chicken, and the Mongolian meatless chicken (different kind of meatless chicken, I think).  I've also enjoyed the Mongolian meatless beef -- the meatless chicken was better, and the price of the Mongolian meatless beef the most expensive item not on the menu (I think they jack up the price to screw unsuspecting patrons).  I've tried the fried rice -- both veggie and meatless chicken (veggie better).  Moreover, I've tried some dim sum -- all vegetarian -- the egg rolls, the potstickers, and some of the dumplings.

To be sure, I have some reservations about Big Lantern.  First, I've found that the food is uniformly better during the week than it is on the weekend.  There is a different chef, and the kung pao in particular is not nearly as flavorful Friday-Sunday, as it is on Tuesdays or Wednesdays.  That said, when BL is on, it's really quite satisfying.  The portions are reasonable; the flavors are vibrant.  It's classic Chinese food prepared in a vegetarian way, which is so very difficult to find.  The soup (vegetarian wonton) and the dim sum, universally, is just okay.  It's well prepared and not greasy, but it also lacks flavor.  

Overall, with experimentation, one gets a good sense of what's good to order at BL.  And, with that, it stands in a class by itself.  While I love Golden Lotus/Golden Era, it's Vietnamese, and these Chinese classics are not offered.  Oakland now has a place called Nature Vegetarian, which is a vegetarian Chinese restaurant, but it just hasn't delivered.  While Big Lantern is not a dedicated vegetarian restaurant, it delivers more often than not, with delicious vegetarian chicken (or meatless chicken, as they call it) that brings one back to her Chinese roots.

The only other game in town for a good Chinese vegetarian menu (other than Enjoy Vegetarian) is Wild Pepper further down in the Mission.  Wild Pepper is good, too, but leans towards the salty side.  Between the two, I prefer Big Lantern, although I think that Wild Pepper is probably more artfully prepared.
author: SalsaBoy S.

description: I ordered for delivery and was not satisfied with my food. Everything was under salted and had no taste to it. Thank god I had vinegar, soy sauce and other sauces to bring in some flavor. Won't be ordering from here again.
author: Ava A.

description: Took over 2 hours for delivery!! They didn't even apologize. Horrible service. I tried calling them several times and they said the driver was ten minutes away that was almost 1 hour and 30 minutes ago. Don't waste your time ordering from this place. Still waiting by the way.....
author: Charlene R.

description:
Came here because Mission Chinese Food  was closed for Independence day. When we first arrived I thought we were in the wrong place because it was so empty. The whole place had another party of 3 and ourselves for the night. 

The only reason I thought of coming here instead of another place because of all the people who mentioned this place that had gone to Mission Chinese Food . The place is not a  $ restaurant, the only thing under $10 is the lunch specials. Most items were around the $11 boarder. 

For the price we paid, the amount of customers that the business had that night and what we got, I totally do not believe the place is worth it. Our Mao Pao Tofu was nothing special, our spicy fish had a few pieces of cod and our Tea lamb was overcooked and tasted more like beef.
author: M C.

description:
I walked in and was happy to smell the familiar scent of a Chinese restaurant rather than the Asian-Fusion nonsense which has become so pervasive over the last 10 years. 

The Hot and Sour Soup was perfect: a beautiful balance of both flavors with a fine, not too oily texture. I ordered the Roasted Duck lunch special and was surprised at how large the portion was. Mind you there was a LOT of rice, but it was still a very generous helping overall.

My waitress did not bring out my Hot Sake until my meal was nearly complete, but she was friendly enough. 

Overall, good if you're hungry on a budget. Nothing new or exciting in the entrees, but they have got their soups down.
author: Andrew D.

description: Always ordered from them using Foodler. Recently it's been taking them two hours to get two portions of dimsums delivered. No apology or explanation. Quite unfortunate. Not going to be ordering from them again.
author: Anant N.

description: I LOVED this place! I got the Sesame Meatless Chicken in a lunch special. It didn't say it on the menu, but a lunch special means: the entree, some salad, some veggies (brocolli), rice, and an orange :}. Then they also gave a fortune cookie at the end (even though it tasted quite terrible)!  GUESS HOW MUCH I PAID. Over 15% tip..$8.30!! Wth, right?! I was shocked. There was too much food for me to finish, too!! The "chicken" was soo good!! Man, the workers were nice, too. Water was always filled! The Olympics was playing and they didn't rush the customers :}. There was also a menu for Dim Sum with meatless Siu Mais, Meatless BBQ Buns, and some other meatless stuff. What the hell! Where have I been?! I didn't try it, but TRUST ME I'LL BE BACK. *DRool
author: Betty W.

description:
The boy was hungry and his co-workers were here, enter Yelp Mobile directions which allowed us to find the place.

Walking in and reading 'Dim Sum', my heart soared. You only need look at my Dim Sum list to know, I ADORE the stuff.

Right away I ordered pork buns, as per usuality. Then went with a sizzling rice soup and an order of foil wrapped chicken. The boy got a sweet and sour pork dish and chow mein.

Two words? Too spiced. Not spicy, spiced.

My soup didn't bother me at first, but slowly I started to notice that it was more salty than I have ever, EVER found sizzling rice soup to be. For those of you who do not partake, SRS is usually quite bland and subtle, the strongest flavor being the chicken within the broth. This was so spiced up I literally could not finish it.

But then add in some of the most over flavored foil wrapped chicken I think I have ever tasted, and Chow mein that we could barely touch (I actually choked at one point from the overwhelming flavor) and you have yourself one very disappointed Meg.

The sweet and sour pork was fair. I mean, it's quite hard to mess up sweet and sour pork, and the porn buns were good but small.

Two stars.

Because I don't care how big your lantern is honey, you got some damn small buns.
author: Meg T.

description:
Now don't come here for the service, atmosphere or decor. It is simply about the food. Quick, cheap and good. Vegan options are great - the meatless chicken is a favorite. I did find the soups a little lacking in flavor as well as the garlic eggplant a little oily but didn't stop me from eating it.
Brought leftovers home (since you get a shit ton) and tasted even better warmed up! I always find that with Chinese food for some reason though. All in all, I'll be back - it didn't leave me feeling overly stuffed or gross afterwards so thats always a plus!
author: S. M.

description: Great place for veggie dim sum and a big selection of vegetarian/vegan dishes on the menu. More importantly, they actually make their dim sum from fresh ingredients. It's not frozen out of a bag like some places. Dim sum favorites include the taro vegetable puff (light, crispy & flavorful-I could eat 10 of these!), chive dumpling, tofu vegetarian roll, and turnip cake. If you like garlic, the cucumber with garlic chili sauce appetizer is not to be missed. It's a little spicy, salty, slightly sweet and oily (like most garlic chili sauces), and tastes amazing with steamed rice. When you're done eating all the cucumbers, save the sauce and take it home. The garlic chili sauce is delicious on everything. I've even used it to marinate tofu the next day and mixed it with noodles to make szechuan style noodles at home, yum!  I'm also a big fan of their meatless fish, although sometimes the v-fish has arrived as v-shrimp which is ok since I like that, too. Just ask to be sure which veggie fish they're using if you have a preference. You'll see all the usual suspects in the veggie section of their menu including kung pao, general tso, mu-shu and beyond (like the crispy fried tofu with spicy pepper). Really delicious food for the neighborhood. Prices are competitive and for people who complain about how much they're paying here, come on, it's not Chinatown, look around. And for the Mission, it's excellent. I'll admit, delivery isn't great. If you order delivery, make sure you can wait 60-90 minutes for them to show up and you're willing to re-heat once it arrives. And since I'm giving you that tip, don't expect anything crispy to be crispy when it gets delivered. Know what delivery food means and give these guys a break. Delivery will never be as good as dining at the restaurant, period. Dining at the restaurant is really the way to go. So do it!
author: apple t.

description:
Eating at Big Lantern is much like a game of Russian Roulette--you never really know what you are going to get. 

We have ordered delivery and eaten in--ALWAYS eat in.

Delivery is a crap shoot, and often the food is cold. It has become a running joke around our house. But as mentioned in other reviews, they have excellent vegetarian options...when they remember to take out the meat.

But after our Christmas debacle, we might be a Big Lantern-free house.

We ordered dinner online. After an hour we call to be told our dinner was on its way. An hour later it shows up...cold. When we go to eat the vegetarian pot stickers, we are welcomed by a mouth of pork. Talk about a Christmas surprise for a vegan and a vegetarian.

So we call back and complain about our stone-cold meaty dinner. They respond with they will send it back out.

After another hour, we call again. And again. And again. No one answers. Finally when they do (about 2 or 3 hours after they were resending our food), we are told "it is on its way."

It is now lunchtime the next day. Throughout our eating experience, we have called Big Lantern 51 times. Our food is still "on its way." When it arrived for lunch, it matched dinner. Cold. And the delivery boy was upset he had to get out of his car. Def not worth the wait.

Lessons for eating at Big Lantern: Never order hungry. And when they say the food is on the way, they are lying. The food is NEVER on its way. And always double check if you want something meatless. And always eat in.
author: Bethany F.

description: Before I would order from here pretty often, however I have noticed a downward slide in the food and service.  I usually order delivery and the restaurant is not too far away however the driver usually always takes about 1 1/2 hrs to get here.  One time it was over 2 hours.  Food quantity has been sort of skimpy lately too, so that was sort of the nail in the coffin for me.  Not ordering from here again.  There are other places just as good and won't have to deal with long delivery times.
author: Leon L.

description: Ordered food from here using my Eat24 app and I've never waited this long before. It's been 2 hours and still no food. If you're hungry order elsewhere because this place is a joke.
author: Heather B.

description: Decent dim sum in a pinch and in the mission.  Would get dim sum here if i was too lazy to drive to at least SOMA to Canton.  Been meaning to go back and try the regular chinese food.
author: Aaron W.

description: Can't rate the food because I am still waiting on it. I ordered at 10:25 for an 11 pm delivery. When I called at 11, it was 'on its way' - and 45 minutes later it's not here, I'm hungry, and Big Lantern isn't picking up the phone. Never again.
author: Casey T.

description:
We ordered delivery at around 10pm on a Saturday night and it took about an hour for our food to arrive. The food we ordered was not good at all...not even average.

What we ordered:

Beef ball - $2.95
-made with beef with a lot of fat...it was also very oily and not tasty

Pork sui mai - $2.95
-looked like frozen packaged ones from the supermarket

Baked BBQ pork bun -$3.95
-burnt and no taste...bbq pork filling was mushy

Foil wrapped chicken - $3.95
-not what I expected. the chicken was super salty and mixed with vegetables...not the way it's supposed to be made.

Garlic spinach -$7.95
-the only dish we considered average. good portions but nothing spectacular.

We will definitely not be ordering delivery from here again. The food was just not good, oily, and not cheap.  The only reason we ordered from them was because they're one of the few Chinese delivery places that open late but I think we'll pass in the future.
author: Angela F.

description: Best Chinese delivery I've ever had in SF. Not the fastest, but totally worth the wait. If you're looking for motivation to cook for yourself, then don't order from here!
author: Sarah I.

description: This place is awesome!  I ordered food for 100 people at two locations for Chinese New Years.  The food was delicious and they were on time.  I also order dim sum and other things for delivery on a regular basis and I have never been disappointed.
author: B c.

description:
Most things here are very good and the fake meat is pretty amazing. I had the fake orange chicken and it was better than real orange Chicken from most places.

Good place for lunch especially.
author: Christopher Steven O.

description:
Ordered delivery, the delivery driver was rude as all hell! He didn't want to walk up to my apartment, told me to come meet him outside on the corner. I wouldn't do that and told him to use the intercom and ill buzz him up. He didn't want to do that so I told him to take the food back and ill get a refund. He finally used the intercom and i tried buzzing him up but he kept hanging up the phone before the door unlocked. Finally he got upstairs and I had my dog with me growling as i opened the door. He was rude still, told me i didn't know how to use my intercom and I was stupid. I called the restaurant and complained but don't really know how much good that will be. 

Fuck this place, totally scary disrespectful driver.
author: L N.

description: DO NOT ORDER FROM THIS RESTAURANT.   I ordered through eat24 and not only were they rude, but it came almost 2 hours late. The food wasn't even warm. Also, they didn't even bring all the food I ordered and when I called, they hung up on me. I will never come back.
author: Connie L.

description:
Late. Ordered for delivery through Eat24 at 8:41. Didn't get our food until 10:45. We called several times, and each time we were told the food would be there in a few minutes. Lies.

Expensive. Three dishes, a noodle and some rice was over $50.

Bad food.
Noodles: super salty, unidentifiable meat that was like salted leather. So bad we tossed it out after one taste.
Honey walnut prawns: imagine corn-dogs, but with shrimp in them. Had a few. Threw the rest away.
Salt and pepper wings: looked and tasted like they were re-fried, no chicken flavor, super-salty, dry and hard.
String-beans: so-so, not much flavor, beans were a bit limp. Ate half, the rest went into the bin. Sauce leaked out into the bag, so the driver must have really been booking in order to get our order to us TWO HOURS after we ordered.

Never again.
author: Edward J.

description: Big Lantern makes perfectly acceptable food, and the extensive menu offers you your choice of a variety of different regional cuisines. That versatility is its greatest strength, because everything else about this place is a bit lackluster. The food isn't particularly noteworthy: it tends to be greasy and is sometimes rather bland. When I leave, I feel like my pores are saturated with corn syrup. The service is middle-of-the-road, and the food is rather pricey for what you end up getting. I appreciate that this place has a wealth of vegetarian options, and I'm pretty sure that's how it gets its good reviews. If you eat meat, there's certainly better Chinese food to be had elsewhere.
author: Aaron Y.

description: This was good chinese, not phenomenal- maybe a bit better than average. They forgot the sauce for the Big Lantern Chicken with delivery so that sucked but everything else was correct. They took 90 mins on a Sunday at 2 pm. Everything was still hot and they even gave us the requested items (chopsticks, fortune cookies, napkins) for the correct number of people when we checked the boxes on Eat24. Will order from again but please don't call me from downstairs asking me to meet you on the street to get our food. I ordered delivery because I am in my PJs! ;-)
author: Piper W.

description:
Been here twice in the last 2 months and both times was deeply impressed with the food. This is an omnivore restaurant but with a substantial vegetarian menu. The dim sum menu was at least half vegan!
Ever since our trip to NYC in October an a visit to the Vegeterian Dim Sum house in chinatown, we have been yearning for some good chinese dim dum. My girlriend and i love this kind of food, both as diners and as chefs.  Our kitchen can produce a handful of exceptional dim sum dishes but many are taking a while to master and here we sampled 2 of the ones we are working on.... in particular, cheung fun and chive dumplings.

The chive dumplings. Oh man, these are good!! Pan fried, delicate wrappers filled with chives and i think spinach or a similar green. Wondeful!
and Cheung Fun or rice noodle rolls. I adore this dish and their version is very good. I am trying to master this one but so far to no avail. First place in the bay area i have found who have a vegan version on the menu!
Fried tofu. One can "taste" a lot about a chef by examining one of the simple dishes on the menu. Soft tofu, lightly battered and fried. Perfectly prepared! Barely any oil noticable on the dish and the tofu was crisp on the outside yet very soft inside. With the hot mustard they put on the table, oh yeah!!!!

the wonton soup. Someone in the back assembled the wontons seconds before they were served! The wrappers were so delicate and the vegetables were very crisp. A delightful take on a standard chinese american dish.

Service ie ok, not great. Atmosphere is cozy, and you can hear the other people's conversations. We will make many returns to check out more of the vast menu!  5th star can be earned if the dishes stay at the high standard from the first 2 visits.
author: Philip G.

description:
I asked for a recommendation and the waiter served me singapore style rice noodles. I loved it! It was surprisingly light and fresh, and completely unique to me. Thin rice noodles, capsicum, onions, bean sprouts, curry powder, sesame seeds, probably some other ingredients, and three kinds of meat! The shrimp that came in it was also surprisingly fresh and tasty. The other two (bbq pork and chicken) were standard. The portion is for two people. It cost me $8. Yay! I'm a fan.

Note: They had two menus. One for dim sum and one for everything else. Everything you'd expect in an American Chinese menu, plus more.
author: Rahil P.

description: I don't write many reviews, however I thought I'd write one for these guys. Food took 2 hours to deliver, was supposed to be 68 mins, was told there was traffic (9pm Sat night, Google traffic didn't support this). Of course the food was cold and tastes only ok. Be weary before you order.
author: Renata M.

description:
Delivery only took a few minutes over an hour!  The woman on the phone was polite and helped me cancel an order through eat24, because I couldn't use the coupon with cash (sucks! Boo eat24!).  

***Side note: Call in to order, you get FREE Chow Mein or Fried Rice if you order two entries!  Which is why I opted to cancel with eat24 and call in my order!

What we got:

-FREE pork chow Mein: Good, Pork was fresh, buuut seemed to be mixed with some older pieces of Bbq pork (darker color and dry), not too greasy, fresh veggies,  Luke warm, 4 out of 5 stars because it wasn't hot enough.

-Sweet & Sour Pork (sauce on the side): Okay.  Shouldn't have gotten the safe on the side.  It was my 1st time doing this I like it already mixed, plus sauce on the side is .75 more.  Cold, fatty, one piece had no meat in it, it was just a ball of crunch. 3 out of 5 stars.  i've had better.

-Sesame Chicken (sauce on the side): Cold. Tender, crispy and nice cuts of meat.  54stars.

-Stuffed Crab Claw: Cold.  Too much breading and too little crab meat. 3pcs.  Wouldn't order again.
author: Patrice M.

description: The orange chicken was like orange sauced tree bark.  I think I might have broken a crown chewing.  The worst chicken I have ever had.  Also they forgot things from my order.  First and last time I order from here.
author: Boyd N.

description: Honestly one of my favorite go to spot because of their vegetarian items. Check twice before eating though if you do order vegetarian. Few times my delivery (80 min wait) was real meat items instead but they brought the correct items back. Taro dim sum is pretty good but a little on the pricy side $4.50 for 3 pieces. I usually spend about 30~40 dollars for dinner here.
author: Lily Y.

description:
Organized lunch delivery for the first time from Big Lantern and was really happy with the service and food.  I called in my order for 5 people yesterday for delivery at 11:30am today, and the delivery guy arrived 15 minutes early...that's a true bonus (and 18% tip for him - thanks delivery guy!).  Usually delivery from any other place to our office is always at least a few minutes late.

Their menu offerings are a bit different and refreshing to see: some lamb choices, salmon & chicken fried rice, meatless dishes, garlic noodles, and steamed wonton with red chili oil.  I really like this.

I ordered the Orange Beef lunch special for myself and it was really good.  I was surprised to find red chili peppers in it and frowned that it was going to be too spicy for me, but happy it was only slightly spicy - that I can handle.  Definitely am going to order delivery from this place again for the office.
author: Emy B.

description: This is a delivery staple for me, order At least once or twice a month, food always arrives fast (under 30 minutes) hot and delicious.   Is it my favorite Chinese joint?  No.  Most adventurous menu? No.  But is it the place I think of first whenever I want Chinese food? Abso-lutely!
author: Darren R.

description: Had take-out from Big Lantern the other day with a friend. They have great deals on lunch specials. We both ordered the Garlic Chicken ($5) which was zucchini stir fried with chicken and served over rice. The order also came with a sweet and sour soup. I love that they offer both white and brown rice, the food was fresh and clean tasting, and the portions are great for the price.
author: Elaine N.

description: We just ordered nearly $100 of food, and each dish is nearly inedible. Everything is incredibly oily, and lacking in any flavor or balance. It's comically bad. I have a hungry crowd with many different tastes and none of us could even finish a single dish. I'm genuinely shocked. The "numbing noodles" aren't numbing at all. Basil tofu barely tastes of basil, it's just deep fried with some basil leaves added.  They forgot to add ginger to our Ginger Broccoli. We're just flummoxed with how poorly cooked all these dishes are.  It was an expensive order, but it's the price to pay to find out that there's much better Chinese in San Francisco...
author: Lucy B.

description: Hit or miss sometimes good sometimes bad thought I had food poisoning, but turned out to be the stomach flu. I still don't think I'll go back
author: Alan M.

description:
Delivery took 2 hours and the driver is super rude..."I am very busy"
The food arrive cold and disgusting.
author: Ray L.

description: Good option for late night Chinese delivery. I recommend the sesame chicken and Chinese broccoli. Delivery is very fast compared to other places.
author: Ula K.

description:
I live around the corner ... about a 1.5 blocks ... as a handicapped person, they've never given me any grief about delivering so close to the actual restaurant.  In addition, they're more than accommodating whenever I'm well enough to walk there.

I ALWAYS order the Salt & Pepper Prawns.  It's like I'm addicted to them.

Great Dim Sum .... Great Food .... Gets my vote for best Chinese in the neighborhood.  (I didn't order any Chinese delivery while they were closed for remodeling.)
author: Jepp P.

description: took two hours for delivery!!!  when we received the food the sauce was all dried up food room temp.  I will not be ordering from this place ever again.  along with shitty service when i called to check why it was taking so long and they never gave me a reason. just that it was busy, but two hours thats ridiculous they should of said that not 45-to an hour.  like i said if you like cold and dryed out food this is your place otherwise i would pass
author: Stacie C.

description:
I grew up in a vegetarian household eating meatless chicken from Chinese restaurants. Then, one tragic day, my favorite restaurant closed, and from then on out I ordered real meat in Chinese restaurants. 

Now I'm a meat fiend and will almost always choose the meat over veggie option any day. EXCEPT Big Lantern's meatless chicken. It brings me right back to my childhood. Tasty, fried, slightly chewy goodness!  

For $23 we got an order of Sesame Meatless Chicken, Lemon Meatless Chicken, and two orders of brown rice. The Lemon Meatless Chicken is quite lemony - they're not messing around.
author: Talia G.

description:
This restaurant was listed as the TOP 100 Chinese Restaurants in the US. according to the Chinese Restaurant News trade publication.  This is a really nice place. The decor is pretty good.  Service is fast and friendly. I tried the Dim Sum combination, the curry puffs, and sweet rice tamales. The Dim Sum combination was good. It consists of three mini pork buns, three siu mai, and three shrimp dumplings.   It is served with hot mustard and hot chili oil.  It was well made. It was not dry or greasy.  The curry puffs were interesting. It is different than the ones I am used to seeing.  The pastry is dry, flaky and sweet.  The filling is a bit dry and reddish. It looks like grounded chorizo meat. It has a strong and spicy curry flavor, but it took a while for me to notice it.  Again, it was not greasy and was well made.  Overall, I like it.  The  sweet rice tamale was good.
