There was nothing really special about it.  It was flavorful and the rice had the right amount of moisture. They simply  took a good Chinese dish and gave a Mexican name.    

Later on, I tried one of their meatless chicken rice plates.  I had the General Meatless Chicken.  It was really good.  I do not know what they really put in these fake meat products, but it was really good.  It tasted like chicken, and had the right texture.  Of course, it was not as greasy or oily as chicken.  It did have the right amount of moisture. I was very satisfied.  The sauce they put on it was different than what was expecting.  It was more fruity, but not overly sweet. The sauce was thicker, and they used the right amount of it.  It had little or no garlic in it.  Some places usually drown the meat with too much sauce, that is either watery or sugary. This place got it right.  The rice was pretty good, not overcooked or undercooked.  

The prices are little higher compared to other Chinese places, but it is well worth it.  I did notice that the  flatware they used was above average compare to what other Chinese places use.  The stainless steel flatware had a bright polished finish and had good weight and balance.  Other Chinese places tend to use cheap, lightweight, dull, flatware that would bend easily if used to scoop slightly frozen ice cream.  Basically flatware, that is a one step higher than the free plastic  spork you get at a KFC. 

Overall, I was pretty happy with my visits and look forward to trying other items on their menu.
author: Hiroshi K.

description: Best vegetarian Chinese food in the city!!! The General Toa meatless fish is my favorite but really everything I've had from there has been amazing!!
author: Amanda L.

description:
The group of us were so dead tired, so we got take out delivered. Took more than an hour to come, but it was delicious. 
Eggplant was so saucy. perfect with rice. chow mein was tasty. fried rice was bomb. orange chicken came in big pieces but good too. finished off with a fortune cookie...or more like...advice cookie. I'd love to try the meatless chicken if I'm ever up in SF again.
author: Vicki V.

description: Who calls themselves a "Dim Sum" place when all they serve is stale warm soggy dumplings.
author: Balu V.

description:
By no means is Big Lantern the best dim sum I've ever had in my day, but it's also not the worst. As the third quip when rolling across these here Yelp stars proclaims: it's A-OK.

The big appeal of this place is the price. Whereas you might drop a Franklin on a dinner for two at some trendy spot elsewhere in the Mish, you can leave this place satiated for about $25 on average (based on three previous encounters here). It's also pretty quick, so if you're just looking for a solid base to counteract the impending booze binge down the street, it's a good call.

Of the stuff I've tried, I really dug the sweet rice tamales, the vegetarian puff, the shrimp dumpling and the pork bun. The last item has a tendency to be a little dry at times, but when it's good, it's pretty pleasant.

Don't come here expecting miracles that some traveling foodies expect to find at every corner of San Francisco. But come here to save a buck on some pretty decent Chinese grub.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
I used to really like Big Lantern, the food is great and they have a lot of variety. Unfortunately, after many bad experiences (numerous 2 hour delivery times, cold food, and missing items) I can't recommend this restaurant anymore. Which is a shame, because they used to be good. 

It seems that if  the late and cold food is delivered and a customer calls to complain, something should actually be done about it. Unfortunately, when you call Big Lantern to make a complaint or ask for the REST of your food to be delivered, you are just ignored by staff/management. 

Do yourself a favor, and go to another restaurant that values their customers more.
author: Tony D.

description: The food may be good, but the service is terrible. Two hours for delivery is way too long! And the food they delivered was cold.
author: Victoria D.

description: Best Meatless Orange Chicken Ever! Love that this place serves dim sum in the evening and they are great for take-out. They give you a free veggie fried rice if your order is over $30 I think. Super fast service too!
author: Sami L.

description: Took two hours for our order to arrive, and my mu shu pork came with flour tortillas.  We will not be ordering from here again...
author: Scott And Jim H.

description: This place has gone to the dumps. Not what it was before. Avoid like the plague.
author: Faisal M.

description: The only place I go for dimsum. The siumai is to fucking die for. Dip it in the chili oil and soy sauce and you have perfection.
author: Leslie M.

description: It's rare that I'm happy with the food here.  Certainly anything "szechuan" hasn't been spicy, and hasn't had the right flavors.  The only thing I've had that I've actually enjoyed was the String Bean Beef.  It was perfect.  The beans, the sauce, the beef, the dish had a great umami and texture.  But I've probably had 5-6 things since and I've regretted every one.
author: Jon E.

description:
I actually have no idea how the food tastes here because it never arrived.  
I ordered food at 11:50am and I was told it would be delivered within an hour.  When it didn't come, I called them and asked when it was arriving.  They said they were sending the driver to deliver then so I waited.  And waited.  After 2 hours of waiting and being starving, I called to cancel the order.  No idea if the food is decent but service sure is sh*t.
author: susie k.

description:
Let's get this straight. Big Lantern is not the healthy fine dining experience you are looking for. Their delivery service is slow, but functional. It's not the best Chinese food in town. But it *is* THE BEST comfort food for your wilting dollars. 

You send a ping out to your friends, not expecting a reply. And you find yourself in the Mission, with 12 hungry friends on a Friday night. Some are vegan, some are veg, some eat meat, some have crazy food allergies. What the hell do you do? Big Lantern to the rescue!

They have crack, aka excellent meatless chicken of any flavor. Sesame is my fave. The foil wrapped chicken is amazing. Dim sum for dinner, check. A huge menu where you almost can't go wrong, check. Something for everyone, check. Also, yay good beer. The service is fine, the restroom clean, and the kitchen fast.
author: Helena L.

description: This place!!  I ordered through EAT24.  They said 45-75 minutes.  It was almost 2 hours.  Then the food is cold.  Cold fried chicken is basically inedible.  The rice andcrab puffs I reheated.  The excuse is one driver.  It just sucks to waste money on this place.  I won't order from this place again!
author: Barret M.

description: Ordered shrimp dumplings today for delivery. Two orders of 4 pieces each. One was just okay. The other was SPOILED. It was so bad i reflexively spit it out of my mouth. Disgusting. This was my third time ordering - and my last.
author: Sasha P.

description:
Hi,

I first came into Big Lantern by mistake running from a crowd gathered outside The Roxie and a buff guy smoking outside Kilowatt. Ducking, into a booth, the wait staff surprisingly brought me a menu and a glass of water. Not really knowing what to do I chugged down the water and sat helplessly staring at the waiter. He asked if I knew what I wanted and couldnt help but start screaming, "I'M VEGAN!". He smiled despite my sudden volume and pointed me to an entire page of vegetarian dishes. I heard someone next to me order the "General Meatless Chicken", so I exclaimed, again unable to control my volume, "GENERAL MEATLESS CHICKEN!!"

He went away and I nervously choked down my water.
He brought it out... and it was delicious.

Being Nocturnal, it's hard to find a good place to eat that isnt a diner full of tourists with cameras (as I have a phobia of flashing lights). 
I now frequent this place despite the often heavy traffic on 16th. They've recently let me enter through the back which has been a relief and has cut my breathing exercises before entering in half.

I'd say come by and say hello, but I'd probably just scream.

-BatBoy
author: BatBoy x.

description: I ordered sesame beef for delivery around 10:00pm. At 11:10 pm someone dropped off what should have been a great order of food. What I got was some kind of deep fried matter that was brittle. It could be crushed between your fingers like a vanilla wafer. I have no idea what this stuff is other than disgusting and totally inedible.  Avoid this place entirely.
author: Michael G.

description: My significant other an I eat here so much we affectionately refer to this place as "Big Lang Lang". The food is great if you're looking for cheap, dirty Chinese food. At one point I was eating here at least 1-2/week subsisting on vegetarian orange chicken, red hot wontons in chili oil and crab cheese puffs when I was hungover. No longer a robust, young 20-something with a fast metabolism, I eat here only on occasion. But sometimes you really can't resist free delivery for dim sum. Just make sure to ask for extra spicy magic chili sauce.
author: Sara I.

description: Love this place. Friendly, prompt, family service and heaps of vegan options at reasonable prices. The food is alway delicious, fresh and hot. Highly recommended.
author: Brian K.

description: Across the street from the Roxie this Chinese restaurant serves reliably delicious Cantonese food without pomp and circumstance; just good food and attentive   service.  Had the mango salad last time I was there and the subtleness of the tastes and the attractiveness of the presentation were consistent with what I've come to expect from this noble establishment.  Take out biz was hopping but still the kitchen kept pace with the diners eating in the spacious, well lighted dining room.  Try the hot pot; deliciously evil with hot peppers and sizzling ingredients.
author: John H.

description:
Ordered delivery online at 6:38, was quoted 45-75 minute delivery time.  Try 120 minutes, after calling to find out what black hole their driver fell into.  It takes no rocket surgeon to predict what came next, food was cold, soggy and frankly gross. I got online with Eat24Hours and the best their "customer" service rep could do was tell us that we should hang around for another HOUR so that the driver who arrived so punctually the first time could come by and pick up our food.  Hahahahaha.  Why don't I just punch myself in the dick?  I'm starving and you have the balls to ask me to wait for your driver?   I had a few bites of the Szechuan Beef which I asked for "extra spicy".  It was basically an old shoe.  Taste and texture.  Pass.  Pork Siu Mai was good albeit cold, but good.  Shrimp Dumplings likewise.  I'll look elsewhere to satisfy my Szechuan and Dim Dum desires.  You lose another customer Big Lantern.

Quick Edit:  Right after posting this the restaurant called back and said that they would give us a free appetizer next time and apologized for the late delivery.  In all fairness, they tried I guess.  So props for that.
author: Mark C.

description:
Big Lantern is a long-term classic favorite special treat among pretty much everyone I know.  It might possibly be the best Chinese food on the planet.   

One day, I drove 40 minutes each way into the city just to find out that Big Lantern was closed for construction.  I was absolutely devastated when I saw the sign.  Don't worry, though, they re-opened a few months later.

It's mixed menu but AMAZING veggie food, extensive selection, savory and delicious.   The food is pretty heavy, but in a good way (and sometimes that's exactly what you're looking for, right?)

Best dishes: Sesame meatless chicken, any kind of meatless chicken, veggie dumplings, numbing noodles, Singapore style rice noodles, taro puffs, or any and all kinds of veggie dim sum.

They have been known to give meat to veggies, though, so watch out.  I usually remind them 2-3 times that everything is veggie-only. 

Also, service is almost always awesome, except when they're super busy (i.e. Pride weekend.)  They just started serving soju cocktails, and the drinks are great.  But a few weeks ago they wouldn't serve any cocktails because it was too busy; and then today the waitress wasn't sure if they would serve them.  If they're listed on the menu they should always be served, no big deal (hopefully that's what will happen in the future.)

Big Lantern has grown in popularity over the years, and once in awhile you have to wait for a seat.  Lunch is the best time to go.  

Conclusion: Always order extra food for leftovers :)
author: Clementina S.

description: I love Big Lantern!  I come here fairly regularly.  Lots of vegan options, including on the dim sum menu.  Friendly staff.  Good for groups.  Take out is easy too.  :)
author: Miss W.

description:
9-17-13
Sorry Big Lantern.
Your nice folks, have fast delivery,a nice clean restaurant,  and are nearby.

But the fact is that I have not had one good tasting delicious meal at Big Lantern ever ...says a great deal.  My friends feel the same way.  Its not just me.  It seems to be the opinion of other here on yelp.  TASTE seems to be the major complaint on yelp.  Your cashew nut chicken has no taste.  It is terrible..  The chicken is likely overcooked but the sauce is just as bad.  If you have had the same chef for years then he is the issue.  The problem is that you likely have known the food is graded as an "F"  but the chef is the owner or is related to the owner for your meals to be that bad and not have improved in years.  You know it.  You must know it.  New faces don't return do they? The ones like me forget and return by mistake.

I understand you have been in business for years so you must know the food at your restaurant is terrible.  Nothing is delicious about any of the meals I have ever had there.

I ate 1/3 of my cashew nut chicken meal tonight because I kept telling myself. it had to have a good tasting spoonful somewhere and because I paid $22 for it including the cream cheese (below aveage), some rice and some drinks.  

The old saying that you get what you pay for does not ring true in this case.
It was over priced and the food gets a grade of an "F".  My meal goes in the trash.  I just hope I don't forget and order from your place again.

Respectfully, i challenge you to improve your food quality, freshness,taste  and customer base.  Till you face reality or deal with what ever in house issues you obviously have your restaurant  will remain below  even sub par.  I honestly think you folks need Gordon Ramsey (Hells Kitchen) to kick some ass down there. 

I honestly don't mean to be critical.  I suspect I am wasting my time telling you so I have taken the liberty of addressing the concerns with Gordon Ramsey.  You guys can fight. and place blame on each other just like on tv.  We want good food.

.
author: John D.

description:
It's Chinese food. Nothing special or above average Chinese food. I find that most Chinese restaurants serve this similar, not so authentic, American version in Chinese cuisine. I enjoyed my meals as much as I usually enjoy a greasy plate of chow mein and temporarily satisfying wonton soup. About 30 minutes after my meal i felt like I ate too much sorta healthy, super oily wheat based products. 

They do have a nice faux meat menu for the vegetarians. However if you're a vegetarian eating fake meat, you might want question you lifestyle choice. Good luck!
author: Caitlin F.

description: I am a vegetarian. I ordered vegetarian orange chicken and table next to me order regular orange chicken. They must have coooked regular and vegetarian together because I ate some that was made with chicken. Total turn off since I get so grossed out with meet. And it's morally wrong to sell something and for what it is not
author: Wanyi T.

description: Order from Eat24.. Where is my food tho? I mean, it's over 90 mins. And you said you still need extra 20mins to deliver?
author: Jerry S.

description:
If you guys could just quit spilling the sauce all over the place on delivery orders this review would be worth 5 stars. Centuries ago the ancients perfected chinese take-out packaging. Why use shallow plastic containers that poorly contain your delicious sauces?

This is my go to spot for chinese delivery. I eat here almost once a week, cheap, convenient and rarely disappoints.
author: Shawn S.

description:
So I'm sitting across the street from this place at the german pub waiting for my buddy to show up for beers and I'm gettin' hungry since it's 9pm on a wednesday night.  Across the street through the window I spot this multi-colored neon sign that I swear said "come on over..we'll make you some great food and you'll be soooo happy".  You know like the cartoons where the cooking aroma wafts through the hallway and out the window and down the street and turns into the shape of a hand and lifts the guy up by his collar and gently floats him all the way back to the pot where he sits down to eat the juicy goodness before him!  No, really it read BIG LANTERN.

What a great name. A beacon of light.  I had no trouble remembering the name.  Not only because you remember the names of great places, but because it's a catchy name.

You must know the following - they make dim sum MADE TO ORDER.  Not only that - compared to half a dozen other dim sum places in the bay area that I've tried, it is THE.MOST.DELICIOUS.FRESH.TASTING.DIM.SUM.EVER.    Did you hear that?  EVER!!!!!!!!!

Also remember that the first of the 4 times I went there was 9pm at night.  They serve dim sum all the way to midnight I think.  Service is friendly and most excellent each time I've been.  They have a cool semi-outdoor enclosed seating area along the sidwalk with a few booth seats.  Very cool.  They really satisfied my late night food cravings before beer, then did it again a few weeks later after having a few pints, and revealed themselves as one of the brightest gems in the bay area.  I wish I lived closer so I could visit once a week.
author: Dwayne B.

description: Solid inexpensive Chinese food and dim sum.
author: Jin N.

description:
I love Big Lantern. I never eat there but I always order for delivery. Very prompt even in my remote Potrero cave. Everything is great from the dishes to the dim sum. They deliver dim sum!!!

Everything is great except for the white rice and that is why I am giving it 3 stars instead of 5. I used to believe that if your rice is bad then everything else fails but that's just not the case with BL. The white rice is a big fail but everything else makes up for it. I have since switched to brown rice which is way better and healthier.
author: Tony G.

description:
This is a Vegetarian Review.

Honestly, this is the best Chinese food I've ever eaten.  The variety for a vegetarian at this place is IMMENSE.  I truly cannot stress enough how heavenly this place is, so I'm just going to name off a small portion of what they have to offer.

- Meatless Chicken out the whazoo!  Breaded, not breaded, big chunks and little, this place is a soy chicken lover's *dream*.  Curry, General's, Sesame, Sweet & Sour, Five Spice, HONEY WALNUT!!!! - and, seriously, I think at least a dozen more.

- Meatless Beef.  I can't say much about this - I never liked real beef back in my carnivore days, so I don't order it.  But if you want it, they've got it.

- A lovely variety of vegetable dishes.  Black Bean Asparagus, Garlic Broccoli, Garlic Spinach, Dry Sauteed String Beans (my favorite), and on and on.

- Tofu dishes, of course.

- Yummy dim sum (served anytime) dishes like Taro Vegetable Puffs (HOLY GOD!!!!!), Taro Cakes, and several other vegetarian items not found at many Chinese spots.

- Plus they have things like the Meatless Chicken Salad - a yummy shredded cabbage salad with a crisp coated meatless chicken "breast" on top, and a creamy, sweet and light dressing.  I've never had anything like it anywhere else.  When I first had it I got so hooked that I really had to keep myself from losing my shit and eating it every day.  ;)

Honestly, if you are a Vegetarian I can vouch for the fact that you will love the food at this place.  It's clean, dining there is lovely, and they are quick with service and short on chitchat.  Nice folks with no language barrier.

Also, they DELIVER!  They always say "45 minutes" for the delivery time, but tonight it literally got here in 20.  And right now my food is sitting on the counter waiting for me, so I'm afraid we've come to the conclusion of this portion of tonight's entertainment.  

Try them out - THEY ARE GREAT!  :D
author: K W.

description:
The food here used to be absolutely stellar, then the restaurant closed for a time ("for remodeling" they said on the phone), and when it reopened they had probably lost their chef.  The food from that point on has been pretty hit or miss.

We live in Hayes Valley and have NEVER had any of these issues with 2 hour delivery times that others report here.

The pot stickers are USUALLY excellent though sometimes when delivered they're soggy and unappetizing (of course they're better when dining in the restaurant and eating fresh out of the kitchen rather than sitting in a steamy box for about an hour awaiting delivery).

I suspect this is the real reason for the "closed for remodeling" issue:

http://insidescoopsf.sfgate.com/blog/2012/03/09/why-has-there-been-a-rush-of-restaurant-wage-violation-busts/

We still order from here from time to time, but each time we're aware of how far the quality has slipped since around or 2007-2010 or so when I first started eating here.

In short, you can do better.  It's clearly not going to return to its past glory.  We've given it YEARS now to do so but it hasn't.

UPDATE 2/14:

By now we seldom order from Big Lantern, and when we do (out of old habit) we usually finish and say, "Gross" and "Let's not order from them again."

It's hard to believe what it was in the past compared to what it is now.  I used to tell people it was the best Chinese food in the city.
author: Upscale B.

description: Super rude employees and owner. The owner actually tried threatening me after I complained that the chicken was under cooked. They use bad cheap ingredients that taste very watery and not warm. I would spend your money somewhere else besides here. San francisco has so many better options for Chinese food. Skip this and do yourself a favor.
author: Darian L.

description:
Sesame meatless chicken! Garlic string beans! epic!

The phone service is shoddy but dinning and take out is fine.

Also free chow mein when you order two entrees for take out!
author: Kevin C.

description: This place is amazing! I've ordered several times using GrubHub and the food has always arrived on time if not early. It has always been flavorful and more than enough.
author: Alex A.

description:
I'm here visiting San Francisco and was really craving Vegetarian Orange "Chicken". I tried it for the first time on a trip to LA and loved it so I did all I could to find a place that would deliver it to me in North Beach. 

I placed my Big Lantern order around 2:10 on a Saturday afternoon. I ordered Orange "Chicken", white rice and veggie dumplings. They said it would arrive by 3:05. So I waited, and waited. And then waited some more. When it got to be 3:15 I called and said its been more than an hour and asked about my order. The woman was nice and said she would call the driver but she was sure it was on its way. She said she would call me back. They never called back. I called back at 3:40 thinking ok it's been almost an hour and a half it should be here. She told me he was very close and that she was sorry for the delay. The driver then called me and said 5 minutes. He finally arrived about 10 minutes later. Like I said, I'm not from here so maybe this is the norm in terms of delivery in these areas. 

Clearly by the time the food arrived, it was not very hot but the orange chicken was good. It was pretty fried, which I somewhat expected, but it had good flavor and really good texture for fake meat. The dumplings were ok, they had good flavor but because of the delay in delivery they weren't very hot and started getting a little moist from the steam in the container. 

All in all, I would definitely eat at Big Lantern again but I think I would go into the restaurant rather than order delivery. Kudos on the orange chicken though!
author: Meghan S.

description: Great selection of vegetarian options BUT make sure you check your food before you take a bite. The past two times I've picked up my take-out order they gave me meat instead of veggie dim sum.
author: Holly E.

description:
Nothing says treating a hangover without some good ole chinese! 

We were upset that another Korean restaurant was closed so we decided to try this place out. My friend is a local here and swears by them. We made a simple order of pot stickers and chow mein. The place wasn't terribly packed but we were being patient. Took a little long for a simple order but not to worry! Food came and it was delicious! Not the best but pretty darn good! 

I'll make sure I come back again!
author: Ezequiel R.

description:
I'm extremely upset at Big Lantern.  I'd ordered their meatless chicken once before, the General Meatless Chicken.

This time, I ordered Meatless Mango Chicken, some veggies, and some vegetable fried rice online.  I specified that I am vegan and to not use any egg, please.  

The order was delivered to me and I immediately ate some.  But the meatless chicken was not the same as I remembered it.  It looked, felt, and tasted like the meat of chicken.  After eating some, I started to feel insecure about it and called them.  Sure enough, they had given me the corpse of a dead chicken.  And I ate it.  Needless to say, I'm extremely upset -- extremely.

They say they're refunding my order, but that's really not good enough.  I'm so upset, I'm literally crying about it.
author: Melissa B.

description:
45 min delivery - ok given

Practically used a roll of paper towels to clean up mess delivered. - uh ok I guess

Tortillas used as Mooshoo Pork wrappers - uh...

Out of 5 items ordered I ate 2 crab Rangoon. - ....

Lesson learned ...  I miss Eliza's.
author: M B.

description: I've ordered delivery here a few times hoping that their food will help curb my Chinese cravings, but alas, I am usually disappointed. Both times I've ordered the order arrived exactly within 45 minutes but the food was bland, no longer warm, or flavorful.
author: Priscilla M.

description:
Every time I've ordered from this place, the food and service has drastically decreased in quality. What was once a delightful treat is now nothing but aggravation. 

After placing an order shortly after they opened, I had to wait 2 hours for the food to arrive, and not once was I contacted by them to let me know that there were any issues. I had to call twice to speak to someone, and each time they told me "it was 10 minutes away" and that they would "call the driver." 

This place is not worth the trouble and the excuses. Why should I have to pay for their scheduling issues and lack of accountability?
author: Erik G.

description:
I like Big Lantern best for its delivery. They are fast and my food has always arrived piping hot despite living in a different neighborhood. I think the prices are fair and the portions are generous. 

This is not my go to place for in house dining but it it definitely is for delivery. They also have great vegetarian options. I go for the meatless orange chicken and garlic eggplant.
author: Leuwam T.

description:
Sometimes I just really want standard American Chinese food...and that can be kind of tough if you're vegetarian.  Although I don't usually crave fake meat, I do like it sometimes and this place has plenty of options.  It's not particularly healthy or refined, but it totally satisfies any greasy Chinese craving you may find yourself with.

LOVE the orange meatless chicken, orange meatless beef, kung pao meatless chicken, and vegetarian dim sum sampler.  I'll be back for sure.
author: Cate M.

description:
Big Lantern is A-OK... if you know what I mean.

I've had both dine-in and take-out service and was surprised both times at how quickly we got the food.  The portions are also enormous - good for saving a few bucks.  

Food-wise, they've got a pretty decent size vegetarian menu in addition to meat dishes.  Nothing too special, nothing too authentic - just decent American style Chinese food.
author: Ivan L.

description: Ordered delivery for the first time. They were super fast, but the food was mediocre. Too bad. The vegetarian potstickers are not that great. And the mu shu was bland. I won't be eating from here again. Lesson learned. Go with what you know.
author: jaime n.

description:
We are always on the lookout for inexpensive but tasty vegetarian food options.  We decided to try Big Lantern because it seems to be one of the few places with a decent selection of truly vegetarian dim sum.  

We were not disappointed!  We got a few of our favorites, the rice noodle dim sum was delightful, as were the tofu rolls.  We also got the vegetarian selection, which was very tasty.  Additionally, we ordered extra food to take home for later - the mango faux chicken, and the spicy not-meatballs.  Both were not only delicious (and spicy!) but the servings were generous enough that we had leftovers for the next day!  Always love that!

Want to mention that the service was swift and gracious, and they got our order exactly right.  I noticed some criticism here based on take-out orders made via an app or third party delivery service, and all I can suppose is that the fault is not with Big Lantern, their food or staff, but with the app or delivery service, because our dining experience was lovely.  

I recommend Big Lantern as a choice option for vegetarian Chinese food in the Mission. It instantly became one of our new fave places for food!
author: Aldyth B.

description:
Another easy and tasty place to hit up in the mission 
We usually get pick up to take home but sometimes we do stop into eat. It is a typical Chinese restaurant but they do offer quite a few dim sum options. My favorite though is the Chinese food not the dim sum. Regular menu items we get are: 
- hot and sour soup 
- salt and pepper pork chops 
- beef chow fun 
- and the special eggplant dish they offer 

everything is okay prices not super cheap but more on the pricey end of fast Chinese food. It is a nice mix of hole in the wall charm but nice enough you enjoy eating in their establishment. I love how close this place is and the are very nice about phone orders. The only major negatives are 1.) we like to order late night chow fun, sometimes after going out and they always say they have it, until after we pay and then they say the only have chow mien. 
2.) There are no descriptions of the dishes on the menu which makes me hesitant to try different things.
author: Nicole S.

description: Never got my food so I don't  know what to say about the food since I never got to taste it. But I was starving ordered my food at 10 pm and now it is 12 am and nothing and their restaurant  is closed. Dissapointed.
author: Elizabeth E.

description: The mabo tofu was like drinking hoisin sauce and too highly concentrated.  I expected there to be some ground pork, but there were clumps of hoisin sauce in the dish and way too much msg in the lunch entree mabo tofu  and the soup.  The soup was gelatinous and I felt really thirsty after a sip of the soup.  I came because Caucasian friends were from the area who wanted to eat there
author: G L.

description:
After a grueling workout, 10 of us came here for a late dinner.  Granted I was starving, but the food wasn't bad.  Poorly paced in delivery, but some dishes were actually exceptionally well cooked.  

Pass: Hot and Sour soup, Westlake soup, Singapore noodles, orange chicken

Definitely order: Tofu with Shrimp (It's the silken tofu with prawns on top), Mongolian Beef, Garlic and Pepper pork

If you need more, order: Braised tofu with bok choy;  chicken and mushrooms.

Generous use of garlic in many of their dishes.  Vegetarian food that even a carnivore like me is willing to eat.
author: Kathleen W.

description: Good soup and vegetables and we got the food in about 40 minutes after ordering but there was no indication in the menu that the chef special tea flavored chicken was breaded.  When we got it we were disappointed especially because it was all bread and no meat and basically tasteless. We ended up having to cook our own main course.
author: Jerry R.

description:
Really?
Who in the world thinks this spot has any decent food?

I was shocked when i ordered the special recommended by the man over phone and it turned out to be a deep fried mess with red a sugary red sauce.  I expected clean flavors with high quality but instead it was a high fructose mess.

The meatless chicken is good but the sauce was overwhelming.  
The fried rice was short grain rice and awful.   

Overall it wss gut bomb.  Save yourself and go somewhere else.
author: Joseph M.

description:
GOOD IN THEORY, SAD IN EXECUTION

I can't believe this place has got 3 stars, because it's just as mediocre as the rest of this city' anemic selection of Chinese take-out. Granted I moved here from NYC, and you just can't compare on any level (so I won't). But I am a SoCal-born Chinese-American girl, so I think I may know a thing or two about cheap Chinese food, regardless of the city. There are some pros, though, so I'll lay it all out:

PROS:
+Fast delivery to the take-out-wasteland known as SoMa
+Well-priced
+LOTS of vegetarian options
+Valiant attempt at a "Dim Sim" menu
+Open late on weeknights
+Accepts credit cards (via eat24hours.com)

CONS:
-Bland, flavorless, stale food
-Poor quality ingredients (canned mushrooms, really?)
-Rice is not included in the entrees
-No descriptions/ingredients provided for many dishes
-Lame delivery dude (waited outside on the street in his car)

For completeness, this is what we ordered for dinner delivery, with specific critiques:

1) Pork Egg Fu Young (doesn't come with rice; sauced to death)
2) Beef Stew Noodle Soup (noodles were disintegrated from having sat in soup--a cardinal sin! ...and beef chunks were more fatty grizzle than meat)
3) Chive Dumplings (the dumpling skin was mealy and too thick/gummy)
4) Tofu Vegetable Rolls (arrived cold and slimy, no real veggies anywhere to be seen)

I guess I just had my hopes too high...
author: Annie M.

description: Extremely average food. Large helpings. Average ambiance though I do like the red lanterns.
author: Dani Z.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE. Big Lantern is quickly becoming one of my favorite places in the entire city. Here's why: I'm pretty much a vegetarian, but I REALLY miss chinese food like orange chicken or sweet and sour pork or what have you. This place has a huge menu (I mean, HUGE) and I've probably tasted a dozen dishes and everything was good (with the exception of the veggie fried rice being a bit bland).

The meatless chicken and the meatless beef are SO GOOD. Who knows how good they are for you, but man, they are delicious. i've tried the orange, the kung pao, and the general and want to go back for the 5-alarm sesame or something like that.

They also have DIM SUM and a bunch of veggie options like vegetarian steamed buns (!!!). 

Lunch special comes with a small portion of an entree (but still enough food) with rice and a mini salad.

Service is nice and attentive.

Sure, you can get equally good or better food elsewhere, but there are few places you can get 1) delicious fake meat chinese dishes in 2) big portions for 3) a great price. All together this place becomes one of my fave spots.
author: Courtney A.

description: NEVER NEVER NEVER ORDER FROM HERE.  If there was an option for negative stars I would do that.  I just waited over 2 hours for my food.  Food got here: Vegetarian Sizzling Rice soup was cold and had meat in it.  The restaurant completely omitted the meatless sweet and sour chicken.  My vegetarian guest has no dinner to eat after we waited 2 HOURS.  The other food that did show up is mediocre at best.  Asked the restaurant for a refund and they agreed only to refund the amount we paid for the food that didn't show up.  No offer to refund or give credit for the bad experience, meat in soup or mediocre other food. In San Francisco you have a ton of options; cross this one off your list.
author: Kelly L.

description:
Not the best looking place from the street, but the best tasting Chinese Food i have had yet in the city.

The soup & dishes have all been good, ready quickly, pretty good service.  But the Orange Meatless Chicken is amazing!!! Unique and absolutely tasty! must try
author: David W.

description: Just got delivery from here and found a bug in the food. I think its a moth grub. Just l took a picture (http://goo.gl/3qQY7R). Super gross and will never order from here!
author: Carl F.

description:
Went there with a friend of mine last week, and I must say this place is absolutely rocking.
Food: My buddy ordered Mongolian beef, and man it smelled soo good. The taste was splendid and I will for sure order it the next time I go.
We also had garlic eggplant and curry tofy, and they were equally awesome. I recommend this place to vegetarian people. Probably the best Chinese food I have had in the city.
 
Service: The service was amazing and the server was very warm and nice. I really liked her and she made sure the food was brought out really fast.

Ambiance: The ambiance is like any other Chinese mom and pop place. it was small and clean but nothing very fancy.

Price: very very economical. we ended up paying about $32 for 3 dishes and large quantities of brown rice.

Definitely  a must go place if you are in Mission and feel like eating chinese.
author: Rishi K.

description:
1. delivery to anywhere in san francisco

2.  the meatless general "chicken" is very good.  i thought it was chicken breast pieces.  i was gagging with anger with my first bite until i was reassured it was soy and then i happily ate it all.  yum!   

3. they're very polite, delivery was on time.
author: Noel J.

description:
I'm really disappointed and a little confused. We always used to order from Yum Yum House and then they closed and so we ordered from Big Lantern because they combined or something... Here's the thing - the food is not as good. 

The meatless Kung Pao was still pretty tasty and the garlic eggplant was pretty good, BUT sending tortillas out with Mu Shu is ridiculous and totally not acceptable. I know it's in the Mission, but I don't want Mexican tortillas with my Chinese food. I was super bummed. We're off to find a new Chinese delivery place....
author: Mac M.

description:
2nd visit. Great dim sum, reasonable prices.  Amazing Pan Fried Buns!! Wow! 

Great lunch place!
author: David M.

description: Delivery only: I can't comment on the food... But only because I've been waiting for it for over 90 minutes and it's still not here. Won't make the same mistake again.
author: Wynn R.

description:
I rarely order Chinese take-out...but we were watching the Giant's game on a rainy Saturday night..it sounded good. 
I decided on Big Lantern based on the positive Yelp reviews...wrong move. 
We ordered the Mongolian Beef, Prawns in Lobster Sauce, String Beans and Tofu, and a Chow Mein. 
Our order arrive in a little over an hour. I opened up the bag and was in disblief...the three main dishes were in clear, plastic containers.. a large amount of the sauces in the dish have seeped out and made its way to the bottom of the bag. It was one huge greasy mess! I was actually surprised that the hot food did not melt the plastic...but it was likely unsafe to eat. After taking some time to replate the food clean up..we finally got to eat.
The string bean and tofu was overly fried..and just tasted dry and gross. 
The Mongolian beef and the chow mein were so greasy they just were not palatable. 
Half way through our meal we were over it. I hate wasting food but I couldn't fathom eating more of that crap. Next time I will make a drive to Henry's Hunan or order from Bamboo...
author: Mimi T.

description:
Delicious food, courteous wait staff, and large portions at a reasonable price.  The vegan sesame un-chicken is so flavorful, and the texture is firm, almost slightly crispy.  The two guys who accompanied me are meat eaters and they raved about their dishes.  I'm eating leftovers as I write this -- so good!

Updated: still a fan.  The meatless Kung Pao (which came out as cubed tufu) is alright, but my iron stomach is doing backflips.
author: J D.

description:
I ordered :
General Meatless Chicken w Broccoli
Vegetarian Pot Stickers
Brown Rice

The food was delicious and delivery arrived before the time.
author: Jessica R.

description:
absolutely love their shrimp dumplings.  The pineapple fried rice also hits the spot and you can't go wrong with their sweet and sour pork. 
I haven't done take out, so I cannot comment on that, but in dining service has always been prompt and nice.
author: Naomi D.

description: At first I was skeptical to buy from that place but my desperate hunger pushed me to go for it. I must say I was impressed by their patience and accommodating me even though I walked in 10 minutes before close. I ordered the prawns with black bean sauce and added mixed vegetables and steamed rice to go. The presentation of the food was appealing and the taste was great. I'm a very picky eater and have a high taste for restaurants. And if I like this place, it means it's good. If you're hungry, go for it. You won't regret it. Enjoy!
author: Ahmed E.

description: I've been coming here for the last six years and its my number one choice for Chinese food in the city, the price and service are great and the food...hands down my last meal on earth. When you come here you can't go wrong with the sesame beef or the honey walnut prawns. Their meatless/tofu menu is also really good, though I haven't tried much of tofu items the generals meatless chicken is amazing. This is a must try Chinese restaurant. Enjoy!
author: Louis C.

description: Always delicious, lots of variety, accommodating of special requests, friendly. I love Big Lantern.
author: Wendy M.

description:
I am a native San Francisco who has grown up eating at various Chinese restaurants across the city, and I must say that the dinner dishes they serve here are great! 

The sauces they pour over their dishes aren't crowding the dishes and making everything oily.  The meat dishes are served really well, tender, and juicy.  And the vegetable - green beans are what we ordered - were just oozing with aroma! 

And my absolute favorite part about this place? The potstickers with the slighty hot sauce oil! So amazing!! 

The price wasn't that bad and being that it's on the Mission and served by true Cantonese folks, this place is a must-try!
author: Reb R.

description: What happened to you Big Lantern? I always enjoyed ordering food from here(cause of the price and the taste) but im reconsidering it. Ordered twice already from this place and it took them 1.5 hours+. I actually have to call the place just to make sure the food is being delivered or not. Hello, isn't the whole point of the "online delivery" is supposed to make everything much faster? If they do this one more time, I'm pretty sure every customers who ordered online are not going to be happy.
author: Cavin T.

description:
Big Lantern makes one of the best wonton soups I've ever had. It's my number one choice when I'm feeling sick and need a good soup.

My favorite foods here are the shrimp dumplings, onion pancake (with sock rocking peanut sauce!), and the meatless sesame chicken. But honestly, everything I've ever had here is awesome.

Plus, they have nigori sake! yay :)

When in season, check out the garlic pea greens - outstanding.

Also, not sure why Yelp is highlighting a bad review from 2008 up there... kinda weird.
author: SisterMable S.

description: First came here on a Saturday night a few months ago, seeking a light, quick, pre-drinking bite walking from BART. Saw this place had dim sum, it had been a while since I'd had that, & figured it to be just right. Expected dim sum in Chinatown, or even The Avenues, not Mission. Ah, the quirkiness of San Francisco and its restaraunts - good ones can be found all over the city. This place is on 16th, just up the hill from Mission BART station, going towards Dolores. As for the menu, highly recommend the hot & sour soup (there are with & without shrimp versions) to clear the senses & palate. From there it was all about the various platters. Thoroughly enjoyed the siu mai dumplings & the dim sum combo - a little of everything. The vegetarian will be just as satisfied as the meat eater here. From the looks if the remainder of the menu, they also offer a wide variety of noodle, rice, and dishes from the regions of China one would expect (Szechuan, Canton, Peking). Am looking forward to making my way round that menu, along with the rice noodle rolls w/ prawn platters. G
author: Glenwood J.

description:
This place is your pretty standard greasy Chinese place.  You know if you like it or if you don't.

What sets them apart:
 * Lightning fast delivery
 * Good dim sum (combo is awesome)
author: Lenza M.

description: This place is ok. Pretty inconsistent with the quality and portions. This is a place where you need to know what to get because not everything on their menu is worth it. Best bet is to stick with what you know about other Chinese restaurants and dishes.
author: Bantu Z.

description:
Yummy! My boyfriend and I order from here almost every weekend. Craving got bad enough once that we over-ordered (a lot of leftovers) and the delivery guy thought we were hosting a party. In some sense, we were. But it was a raid party on an MMO.

Dishes that we order almost every time:
* Turnip cakes - As a rule, I don't like veggies and I don't like dim sum. So that's how good these are. Probably one of my favorite dishes from here.
* Crab rangoon - Not much crab, mostly cream cheese. Crab rangoon is generally sinfully good and these are no different.
* BBQ pork buns - Good and a staple. I like it because it has less meat, I think my boyfriend thinks there's too little in there.
* Peking duck - Not enough steamed buns given with the order, but the duck is non-fatty and the skin is crispy and perfect
* General Tsao's - Ordered this the other night, very good

For the price and the ease of delivery, it's 5 stars. Don't let the haters fool you. I'm going to be a repeat weekend customer as long as we live within delivery range.
author: Sylvia L.

description:
Absolutely revolting. If it were possible to give 0 stars I would. 
Last night, my friends and I placed an order for 3 orders of vegan meatless chicken fried rice as well as general meatless chicken. Being vegan for 10 years we made sure to specifically write "vegan" under additional notes. We got home after driving across the city to pick it up only to find that the general meatless chicken was not meatless (realizing this AFTER we all have taken a bite). When we called they were really apologetic and delivered us our general meatless chicken, which took them nearly 45 minutes.
But that's not it, while in the middle of eating my, what I believed to be vegan food, I stumble upon a shrimp tail. By this time I was livid, we had no groceries at home and had ordered Chinese because we had worked all day and were exhausted.
When I tried to call to explain my story and ask for a refund they put me on hold about 20 times every 30 seconds. One guy even had the nerve to try and tell me that they don't cook with shrimp, apparently he thought I was born yesterday because there is shrimp on the menu.
My advise, this place is repulsive don't even waste your money. I will never eat here again.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
Quick and yummy chinese food, perfect for take out.   It's nice to eat there too, though.  I always get the sunflower chicken.  It's hot, but the crunch of sunflower seeds and the fresh sliced vegetables mix so well together, it's a definite favorite.

This isn't high class dining.  But it's damn yummy and that's all that matters.  Bring a group here and have fun.

If you call for pick up it's always ready in about 20 minutes, it's wonderful.  I live very close by so by the time I call, get dressed and wak there our food is ready :)
author: Caitlin D.

description:
This place was a wonderful delight. 

We ordered:
*  mock orange beef (which came with broccoli as well)
* vegetarian mu-shu (delicious and rare to find in other restaurants but came with Mexican tortillas instead of Chinese pancakes!!) 
*plate of veg. dim sum combo 

Will definitely be back soon. It is very difficult to find good vegetarian Chinese food in San Diego, and even harder to find veg. mu-shu that is done right and has good flavors. Thanks for the good times Big Lantern!!
author: Nathalie R.

description: The food here was really great. Well seasoned, excellent preparation, and quick service. The portions were adequate and the price was reasonable. The salt and pepper spare ribs and twice cooked pork were so delicious!! The vegetarian options were also tasty. I would definitely come back and try the other dishes. .
author: William N.

description:
If you want Chinese food in the Mission, your choices are basically this and Mission Chinese Food (Lung Shuan).  Neither is particularly good.  Well, Mission Chinese food is the opposite of good, but let's not go there.

ON THE OTHER HAND Big Lantern is just kind of mediocre.  It's not too expensive, but then again, it's not Yamo.  It's not too tasty, but then again, I've had way worse nearby.  And better yet, the food doesn't have that terrible aftertaste I associate with Panda Express, ensuring that you don't feel like you're going to die from MSG fats overdose immediately after.

But do yourself a favor and stick to the American-Chinese food items, if you're expecting good Dim Sum, or Roast Duck or Pork Intestine with Chinese Pickles this is definitely not the place for it.  But if all you're craving is some sweet and sour chicken with a side of fried rice, well Big Lantern is a-ok!  

3 Mission Chinese Stars (2 Richmond/Sunset Chinese Stars)
author: Leon K.

description: We had garlic noodles, ginger onion broccoli with meatless chicken, and turnip vegetable bun. The garlic noodles were certainly garlicky, but the other dishes were rather bland.
author: Eva UnTiger S.

description: Ordered Dim Sum for a party and it was really great. Super SUPER affordable and good! They were very accommodating and I would totally recommend this place if you are looking to cater your party with Dim Sum. I did some research and this was by far the best (only) place near our place in The Castro that would do catering for us. Will order again!
author: Kelsey H.

description: The food is good, but I was really disappointed with the delivery.  Our food was 45 minutes late and when it showed up the delivery guy asked for a tip and I told him it was 45minutes late and he told me to pick it up next time...and the food was cold.  :(
author: Dustin C.

description:
I'm not sure why my (vegan) peers are raving about this joint.

Yes, they have (vegan) dim sum. Yes, it is good.

They also have a ton of fake meat dishes! Nomz. What sets Big Lantern apart from other Chinese joints with vegan dishes? The serving sizes! Generous indeed.

The one catch: An hour after eating Big Lantern, I feel like I have a gut full of grease... and I probably do.
author: shane s.

description: I love the food here, especially the dim sum and the wonton soup. But their delivery service is terrible! It takes forever, and a couple of times I've ordered they just never showed up. I definitely recommend doing pickup or dining there if you want to try this place.
author: Diana G.

description:
I will start by saying I created this yelp account specifically to rave about this place. I live in the east bay but like to drink in the mission and always make it a point to come to Big Lantern when I do. The dim sum is where it's at. Hello pork siu mai! Real bomb! Also the bacon wrapped shrimp are fantastic. Also the sizzling rice soup and hot and sour soup are great. Also they have a lot of "meatless meat" options that I have never tried but seems like a good thing for all the little veggie hipsters around.

The staff are great as well. Always very friendly, quick and accommodating. My girlfriend is a really picky eater and they will make what she wants, how she wants it. I've also had delivery once and it was really fast AND we called them like five minutes after ordering to change the order and they said it was no problem AND the food came fast AND it was new years eve! These reviews complaining about 2 hour waits were both posted on the same day and I would venture that whatever the problem was it was an isolated incident. 

Awesome place! Check them out! BIG LANTERN I LOVE YOU!
author: nick l.

description:
I love this place. I would marry it if I didn't have the best boyfriend ever.

Tonight I was sitting doing homework and just started CRAVING their meatless chicken. Luckily, they are open till midnight on the weekends and deliver ANYWHERE in SF. This is not on the menu, but they will make jalepeno meatless chicken and it is totally yum. Also, the turnip cakes and taro puffs are pretty fab. 

It is reasonably priced and they are always super friendly. Also, they have big weird fish in the little fountain at the front of the restaurant. Everytime we have guests visiting from out of town, we take them to the Big Lantern :) 

(P.S. Perfect for veggie/non-veggie couples, because both people can leave totally happy and full. Though honestly, the fake meat is so good that my boyfriend will often eat it with me!)
author: Tiffany P.

description: I really like the vast menu selections and the portions are great for family style! So much to choose from and so little time :)  I got the salmon with vegetable... poifect.  There was 6 people in the group-we had so much food- cant recall what they all got but it was all good. The ambience and service is great plus they are open late! 11pm - would def come back.
author: Margo R.

description:
I don't know how I've managed to NOT review this place after ordering from the BL for over a year or so.

Three Cheers and then some for the uber-veg friendly menu.  They keep adding new stuff and that makes me happy.

No Cheers for the sometimes weird smell that is sometimes hovering.  It's a mix between grandma's basement (which, for some reason, makes sense) and cleaning supplies.  It's not always there but when it is, it's distracting.

I'm grateful they're a block from school so whenever i've realized i hadn't eaten in 4 hours and have another 4 to go I can run in and grab a quick veggie bun or soup to tide me over.
author: Jen I.

description:
Their meatless chicken dishes are amazing, especially the five-spice meatless chicken.   The portions are huge, enough for at least two days.

When you order delivery, if you order 2 dishes, you get free fried rice!  Whooo free fried rice!
author: Hayley T.

description:
I really like the food here. There are only a few Chinese restaurants that I like and this is one of them. I've eaten at the restaurant and ordered delivery and have had good experiences with both. I find the quality of the food to be a tad better than most and I'm impressed with their consistency. I've eaten at some places that are so hit and miss that I eventually give up on them completely but I'm pleased to be able to say that Big Lantern's food is the same each time.
By this point they seem to recognize me as a regular so they're pretty nice to me as well, which I appreciate so that makes the in-house dining experience more pleasant than most fast paced, take out oriented restaurants. My one gripe if I may is that while dining in, the loud, annoying phones ring constantly the entire time making it a less relaxing experience. But I realize that they specialize in take out and that's the nature of their business, so I'm just pleased to have a good, reliable place in the area.
author: Hasad F.

description:
I started ordering her a couple weeks ago after receiving their menu on my door. Very good. Fresh ingredients, good quality, not so greasy like some Chinese food can be. 

Give'em a try. The prices are very fair.
author: Foodie D.

description: Good food!  I live close by so I order from this place all the time.  If you pick up your order of $20 or more, you get a free chow mein or fried rice with meat of your choice.  The Wor Wanton Soup is fantastic.
author: Bradley D.

description: I've only been here once but everything I ate was so-so. I tried the crispy chicken lunch special, mu shu veggies, dim sum combo (siu mai, shrimp dumplings, steamed BBQ bun), and taro puff. The dim sum stuff was kinda on the bland side but the other stuff was over seasoned. My dining partner did not digest it well. She ended up uncomfortable and in bed later in the day. I thought I tasted something in the mu shu veggies that might have been bad (expired). I also noticed it in the taro (there was some veggies in it). I was uncertain and continued to eat it. Fortunately, I am not that sensitive to food poisoning. I doubt I'll be back. I gave it 2 stars because the service was decent.
author: Elsie M.

description:
Chinese food for the Chinese New Year, we said. Now we weren't looking for a five-star Chinese food restaurant, just one nearby due to my friend's injured leg. The service was slow, although we eventually got everything we wanted, we had to really flag down the waitstaff 2-3 times for it. 

Now about the food - very edible. Dim sum was decent, kung pao chicken was decent, minced pork lettuce wraps decent. All around a 3.5 star restaurant -- Yelp provided the correct user-generated average score for this Chinese restaurant! Too bad you can't actually select a half-star on the rating meter though.
author: Angie C.

description: Amazingly delicious Meatless Orange Chicken - one of the best I've ever had, and believe me, I've had many. Cute little place, good service, and really affordable lunch specials. WIll be back!
author: C D.

description: Worst delivery service ever. Was given an estimate of 50 minutes, which is already pretty long. Gave a call after 1 hour and was told the food would arrive "any minute". Called back after 2 HOURS and was told the food was JUST being delivered (10-15 additional minutes). Never order delivery from this place.
author: Inar Z.

description:
Ordered from these guys many time but won't do it again.  They quoted me 43 dollars on the phone and the delivery guy charged me 65 then threatened me when I didn't give him a large enough tip!  Called to complain and was met with something that could barely be considered an apology for the delivery man's behavior and an argument about how I was wrong...  Be careful of ordering from this place, but if you do make sure you keep an extra 25 bucks on hand and a few friends around in case the delivery guy wants a bigger tip!

Basically, one star is too much for overcharged food and violence delivered to your doorstep.
author: Samuel C.

description: Thank you for meatless Chinese food.  God bless your delicious little hearts.  Our plates are clean.
author: Tess G.

description: The best chinese food I have had in a while. Had some of the meatless orange chicken and it re-instilled my whole faith in how good chinese food is. If you're in San Francisco and looking for good chinese food this is the spot to go.
author: Gabriel R.

description:
The general meatless chicken is out-of-control good, even though they should really call it General Brimley's Chicken because it's pretty much diabetes waiting to happen.  

Some other favorites include the basil tofu, ginger broccoli, and sauteed string beans.  I always feel that if I order lots of vegetables too, the damage inflicted by the general's chicken won't be as bad.  

Seriously though, this is probably my favorite Chinese delivery establishment EVAR.  Every vegetarian dreams of having Chinese food like this just a phone call away.
author: Marie S.

description: I seem to order the same thing each time I call ... Broccoli chicken with white meat only and potstickers. Love it!! The flavor of the chicken is so good!! The only reason I didn't do five stars is because it can take a very long time for delivery and the last few times, they forgot my potsticker sauce. Regardless, I will continue to order from them! Highly recommended!
author: Elise Z.

description:
I crave Big Lantern, constantly.

The food is delicious and the delivery service is great, what more could you ask? The employees are very nice too. I am obsessed with the sweet and sour chicken, I get that dish at nearly every Chinese place I go, and theirs is my favorite. 

I usually get delivery or pick up to go; they have great hours, staying open til 11pm on a Sunday is a huge luxury.

I've only dined in once with a friend...it was nice, aside from the super crazy guy a few seats away that kept interrupting our conversation. But that's the Mission for you.
author: Candy W.

description:
Dim sum: words that strike fear into the heart of any vegetarian who's watched, hungrily, carts laden with dumplings full of who-knows-what, the dishes your server swears up and down are vegetarian but arrive sprinkled with fried pork ("just for flavor!") or with the uncomfortable taste of chicken broth...

After emerging a hungry, nervous wreck from a few dim sum meals where, even accompanied by native Cantonese speakers, I still couldn't evade the surprise pork, I resigned to give up dim sum entirely.  Then I found Big Lantern. 

Their dim sum is on a menu with pictures, not a cart, and is served by people who understand vegetarians don't like pork or chicken broth--even just for flavor--and who will tell you the stuffed eggplant has meat in it (it does).  Even better, at least half of their dim sum menu is vegetarian.  And even better than that, you won't ever find a line.

They start with fresh food, don't drown it in grease, and serve up good tea with the meal.  And don't even get me started on their mock meat--the sesame chick-un is amazing.
author: Dana S.

description: Good food, but their delivery takes FOREVER! We live less than 3 miles away and somehow it always takes 65 min to over and hour and a half for our food to arrive. It's really frustrating, but we keep tolerating it for the good food.
author: Liz R.

description: What a nice restaurant. The servers were pleasant and I didn't feel rushed at all. The food is fine though we did order one of the fake chicken dishes, and the chicken was a bit salty. Otherwise, everything is else tasted wonderful. I would definitely go back again.
author: Janice O.

description:
Seriously I hate to give bad reviews, but I do not feel bad for this one. I ordered from here because they were the only Chinese delivery place still open. 

The chow mein was bland and greasy with a chewy texture The veggies were like huge chunks of carrots, green bell pepper, onions and random yucky fillers that were not cooked properly eg the onions were on the raw side. Mind you I actually like carrots and onions when it's done right. 

The minced chicken and lettuce cups were atrocious There was no veggies or nuts or anything, just a large amorphous pile of mystery looking meat that was dry and wayyy over spiced. The meat was a brown color as if it had been dyed by the seasoning..it was not a light sauteed glaze.   

The BBQ pork spare ribs had chunks of meat that were flavorless and dry, but the sauce was overwhelmingly greasy.

The Shrimp dish was a freakish neon orangy red. It was heavily battered but mushy! MUSHY BATTER! 

The beef and broccoli was the most edible of the dishes. However, as far as the dish goes, it was mediocre at best. At least that's what my fiance says (he's very forgiving and was used to generic suburban American Chinese food, aka low standards).

After forcing down what I could (not much), I threw it all away even thought we were still hungry. We didn't feel well either, it was nauseating "food".

Oh, and the prices were too high. -_-
author: Roxanne Q.

description: I used to live a block away and so would pick up Big Lantern pretty frequently. It has the best fake meat that I've ever tried (I particularly enjoyed the five-spice sesame meatless chicken).  That said, it otherwise is a pretty standard low-end white tablecloth American Chinese restaurant, which I often find somewhat heavy/greasy but oddly tasty and addicting.
author: S E.

description:
Okay, I'm supposed to be a savvy Gen Y 2.0, but I couldn't find this place when I tried.  My girlfriend and I looked for an hour in vain for a restaurant A) open late, B) serving peking duck for her, and C) serving dim sum late for me.  It seemed like this might exist in such a wonderful culinary city like ours, but we google-menupages-yelp failed.

Two months later, we didn't want to wait at Luna Park and walked to 16th, falling in the lap of Big Lantern.

Great, cheap dim sum, even late, beautiful peking duck, and cheap 'n' decent sake in one place? 

We'll be back, many times!
author: Sean D.

description: This place is the worst for delivery.  2 hours and counting.
author: Kristian H.

description:
After leaving the photo shoot, the girls and I were totally jones'ing for some dim sum.  Thursday night in SF and we want dim sum.  So Ligaya T. says that Big Lantern is really close to where we are, near a BART station where we are dropping off our passengers and will fill the bill.

After locating parking and walking two blocks, we were warmly greeted at the door by the resident homeless fella who like a true gentleman opened the door for us.

We were quickly seated and brought water and menus.

We munched on.....

-turnip cake
-sweet rice in lotus leaf
-steamed pork with black beans
-rice noodle with prawn (shrimp really)
-shrimp dumplings
-Onion pancake with peanut sauce (the star of the night - we got 2 orders)
-sesame ball's

$42 after tax and tip.  It's quirky and busy and bustling (they've got a serious delivery service going on).  If I'm in the area again, I would stop by again!
author: Bee D.

description: Delivery took 2 hours. Food got here cold and there wasn't anything special about it. It was just Ok
author: Viviana B.

description: This is the place I go when I want delish Shrimp dumplings! I also always get the sauteed string beans. Also their Generals Meatless Chicken is really good.
author: Heather Z.

description:
So I kind of have a craving for this place every day.  So much so that my boyfriend thinks its becoming an unhealthy obsession.  I ask if we can get Chinese food so often, that such a question is now synonymous with this one dish at Big Lantern. Here's the deal.  If you prefer to eat mostly vegetarian, its sometimes hard to get hearty Chinese. Sure you can find some delicious stir fry and noodle dishes, but I'm talking about a hearty craving for Sesame chicken, or something of the like.  Big Lantern is the answer.  They have delicious meatless chickens.  I'm not sure if they're tempeh or soy based, but they are SO GOOD.  My usual order here is the Sesame meatless chicken with brown rice and a side of crab cheese puff.  Wonton soup is also good. YUM. 

The reason I'm giving it 4 stars and not 5, is because EVERY time I order delivery I ask for a packet of hot mustard instead of the soy sauce packets they usually include... They always say, "yes that comes with the order," but 9 times out of 10 they don't give it to me, goddammit.  I don't understand this-- just put the damn mustard in the bag!  I am a hot mustard maniac, dammit!  Occasionally, however, when I get the sacred packet of hot mustard that I beg them for, it is my most favorite meal, like ever.
author: Honey T.

description:
Great lunch special. 

You get 
- Soup
- Entree
- Salad

For $6-8, and they offer their full dim sum menu in case you have a significant other that doesn't want something from the deep fryer. 

The ambience is what you pay for, but it's a solid go-to meal. I haven't been to dinner there much, but go for lunch all the time.
author: John H.

description:
Yummmmmm. I almost start to drool everytime I think about the dinner we got here.

The service was great too. Even though we came in pretty late, 9:30 I think, they warmly greeted us and took care of us. We had pork chow mein,  some fried chicken dish, and Mongolian beef. Yumyum yum. I think I'm gonna go back tonight.
author: Misty M.

description:
Thank you to Ligaya for suggesting this place.....it was so so yummy!! They were fast, and nice!! 

We walked in and sat down in less than 2 mins.....we even ordered within the first 10 mins of being there. They had all our fave's on the menu......Onion pancake, shrimp dumplings, seasame balls and more.

Now I do have to say that the bathroom was clean and to my surprise not as bad as I had imagined. 

The food was even better than bathroom, LoL!! The only real downside was the homeless man that came in and started to eat off of people's tables. But all in all it was great and I know I will be back.
author: Theresia D.

description:
Yay! I'm a fan. 

Bee D. wanted Chinese, I wanted Dim Sum and Theresia didn't care much either way... Bee was asking ME where is a DimSum place and I said "why don't you just look on Yelp?" lol but the internet was asking up so we did the next best thing and asked a Yelp Rep. (Thanks Ligaya T.)

We drove around a few times looking for parking and settled a block down at a parking place for $7. Had the door held open for us by a man. Walked in and were seated. From the time our order was placed to the time it hit the table was very short. 

YUMMY FOOD and you can look at the pictures in case you don't know exactly what you're ordering. And the Sweet rice and meat in the lotus leaf or banana leaf w/e that thing was, I don't like it usually but I ate it here =]

The only downside I felt there was would be that after we had our food in front of us the service was s-l-o-w. I only got my one glass of water (I'm big on drinking water) and they took long to clear our dishes even though more and more people were coming in. Maybe I'm spoiled? I will definitely remember this place and come back.. The name on the outside is neon rainbow hah. And I like that there's not only outdoor seating but semi-outdoor seating. You'll understand when you see it.
author: Brianna S.

description:
I would like to start this review by quoting the recent yelp announcement for Big Lantern: "Free Delivery! Free delivery anywhere in San Francisco with a minimum $10 purchase!"

By "Free Delivery" they mean that you will never receive your food and will not receive any kind of update or notification about it. In fact, you will have to then call them three times within the next TWO HOURS to find out that your food is lost. Yes, lost. Maybe it pulled a Patty Hearst and wanted to stay in the young delivery boy's car forever, we will never know. 

I've eaten here several times and never had a horrible experience. I've at least always managed to acquire food from them. Still the best thing I could tell my lady when she was calling was that it "sometimes didn't make me sick." 

So we called and placed an order (my lady-jew needed her chinese food on what she refers to as a "americanized waste of a day"). They had trouble understanding the address right off the bat and stopped ladyfriend to ask whether this was an apartment or house before she even had the chance to tell them. 

So we wait. And wait. And wait. We ordered at 7:37. At 8:52 we called. We were told it was "on its way." 

At 9:30 we called again. "It got lost." I'm sorry, lost? Did it wander off in the dark? Try putting some light up shoes on it next time? I hear LA GEAR has some sort of lighting mechanism on the soles. Much like small children, Chinese food will get lost in crowded cities/places apparently. Take the Chinese food to Disneyland and rest assured it will never be seen again.

The man on the phone said "Things happen." Really, Sir? Do "things happen?" Does food just walk away? This is after he hung up on us the second time we called to check on our food status. My ladyfriend asked to speak to the manager, which clearly never happened, instead they just went silent on the phone and then hung up 20 seconds later. She then called back, very angry. 

After much anger on our end he offered 20 percent off. Hmm. Sorry. Not good enough, especially when we've been trying to locate our food for the past 2 hours and you've been nothing but brisk, short and utterly rude. On top of that  we pointed out that 20 percent is essentially 10 percent due to taxation. So we took our business elsewhere, which to be honest, was fine.

Try somewhere else and save 2 hours of your life and quite possibly multiple trips to the bathroom.
author: Caitlin C.

description: Mediocre food and crappy service. I've given this place a few different chances and each time it has disappointed me. Nothing stands out and the flavors all taste the same. Salty and fishy and not in a good way.  I mean EVERYTHING tastes like that... Even the chicken. I've tried the chow fun- lacked flavor. The house spicy chicken chow fun- also lacked flavor as well as heat. The Mongolian beef was overly salted and overcooked. The chow mein also lacked any flavor. The noodles are weird. You get the idea. How can everything I've had lack flavor when it's clearly MSG-laden?? Oh they all say no, but my pounding headache and unquenchable thirst says otherwise. The only thing that was ok was the shrimp dumpling. It was convenient because they do deliver, but forget about getting your order in less than an hour. It may take longer. It always takes longer than they say... at all hours. The last time I ordered I called them to ask where my food was after an hour and 45 mins- after they told me it would be 45 minutes... Then they told me they won't deliver to my house anymore. I know what you're thinking- I must have been rude. Quite the contrary, my orders have always been over $30-40 and I've always tipped the driver way more than 20% for their troubles and was always courteous on the phone even though they barely understand and u have to repeat myself a bunch of times. Maybe they think my house is too far- either way, an explanation would be nice. But no matter, I won't be missing much and for the lack of flavor as well as good service I'll be dining Chinese elsewhere. This is San Francisco- there's so many other options that taste way better! Thanks for nothing Big Lantern!
author: Kaliah C.

description: Absolutely the WORST service known out there. They don't keep true to their delivery times. 45-90 minutes? Try over TWO HOURS. And why must I check in with my order 5 times instead of them keeping me updated? Absolutely unprofessional and do not know how to run a business right. I don't know how this restaurant is still standing.
author: Joe F.

description: I ordered the jalapeno chicken dish from here last night. What I actually got was the meatless version of the dish which is not nearly as good in my opinion. Had I ordered it and been expecting it I may have thought differently. I know this restaurant has a lot of vegetarian options but they need to get people's order correct, especially considering I ordered it online so they had a printout of the order right in front of them. I do not know if I will order from here again as I cannot trust them to get my order correct, even when it is written down.
author: Brian V.

description:
I just ordered dinner online from Big Lantern and realized I've never written a Yelp review about the restaurant. 

My husband and I order from Big Lantern every two or three weeks.  The food is good, consistent and reasonably priced.  They have an online ordering service that's easy and totally works.  We frequently request all white meat in chicken dishes and that's exactly what we get.  The Mongolian beef is a favorite and so is the basil chicken.  Tonight we went for mu shu pork, Mongolian beef, brown rice and pork potstickers.  The total was $25 and the food came right away.

It's not the very best Chinese food you'll have in your life, send your foodie friends there right this minute but it's our regular Chinese delivery and we've never been disappointed.  Once in a while they throw in free chow mien or fried rice (might be Monday nights but not sure) and that's sort of fun.  

If you're looking for reasonably priced good Chinese food, give them a try.
author: Cynthia A.

description:
I was pretty excited to order food since I do that so rarely. So I ordered online for Sesame Chicken, General Chicken, and white rice (vegetarian versions) . Total damage: 24 dollars.

When bell rung I ran down three floors to get to the door.
Then got food and ran up, pretty excited.

Sesame Chicken - Like soggy sugar mashmallows
General Chicken - Same consistency and flavor with the addition of hot sauce.
White Rice - Meah

I was stoned and still thought it sucked. That's pretty sad.
author: Richard E.

description: Having tried a few Asian restaurants in the city (Chinese, Burmese, Thai), I find I keep coming back here. The food is more familiar to me than other restaurants, similar to what I'd get in DC or Chicago. They have good lunch deals. I like their kung pao and hot and sour soup.
author: Lake Y.

description:
Omg. I have never seen my garbage disposal of a boyfriend spit out food until we ordered from here. He eats "gross food" all the time too. He loves smelt, tripe, tongue, preserved egg, fermented tofu, jelly fish, snouts, brain, etc. etc. etc. You name it and he loves it. 

So when we were too hung over this weekend to leave the house and needed food we settled on Chinese. Plus we thought, let's order extra so we have lunch leftovers! 

First we each ordered soups (the only truly edible dishes we ordered). I got egg flower, he got west lake beef soup. They were the exact same soup but one had beef added to it and one had mushrooms added to it. I had the first bite and when the BF asked how it was I said, "Very warm, bland, but ok." He took his bite and agreed. 

Next up we opened the fried rice. It was dark brown. It was completely drenched in soy sauce. I actually contemplated rinsing it out. I've read Susanna Foo's book, I know how non-Chinese cooks (*points to self*) ruin Chinese dishes. By adding too much soy sauce and oil. This dish is the perfect example for Susanna Foo's "how to not make fried rice" example. If you like drinking soy sauce then you'll love this dish. But while I do love to put soy sauce on almost every Chinese dish I order, I couldn't eat much of this. 

Then came the order of Chive Dumplings. This was the first dish that was spit out. I think my BF took it as a challenge to be able to prove to me he can eat anything. He barely swallowed it. I don't know how a chive dumpling can go so wrong. The chives tasted like overcooked collard greens that were rotten. The rice wrapping was even bad! It had the worst texture I've ever tasted or seen. 

Next we decided maybe we'll try our Beef and Broccoli. And it was decent. It was edible and not overcooked. But it was soooo over sauced. I was able to eat about 4 whole bites. 

And here comes the best part....
