They have 2 tables outside, which in the Mission sun belt is so perfect on an afternoon. They also have two booths in an enclosed porch with views of the street.
They also have a great cheap lunch special. 

Do yourself a favor and get the "Meatless" versions of General Tsao's chicken.Phenomenal.
The meatless seseme chicken is also awesome.
I'm not even vegetarian, but the meatless stuff has got this perfect, consistency that the chicken lacks.(but is still great)

My buddy Seth and I usually get one order with 2 portions of rice and share it.Its the perfect amount for a lunch.
When we order our own each we walk out in stomach pains, because its just too damn good to not eat it all.

There are 3 main waitstaff you'll get here.
1.The older, pissed off, occasionally says one word guy:
You have to go here enough times (it took us about 14) until he recognizes you, and you'll get a nod and he asks if you want your usual....which totally makes up for his quiet demeanor.

2.The tall,young, always smiling guy.
This guy is so nice. He took off early once, not even waiting for his tip so I chased him down the street.

3.The young gal that works on the weekend.
Totally sweet.

Ok, now I'm officially starved, and wishing Big lantern was an all-nighter.
author: Micah M.

description:
They screwed up my water.

How is that possible? Seeds were on the bottom of the glass, and I don't think they were from a lemon???

I was attacked by flies. My friend's won ton soup was sent back (the dumplings resembled a deathly grey pallor), i had the mango chicken, which wasn't horrible so I won't give it a one star, and they did take the soup off the order -  but if you want cheap chinese from here, i would get it as take out. As far as the dim sum selection, i didn't seem to spot a pork bun, isn't that considered basic staple dim sum?

Very dim-sum-pointed...
author: wayne s.

description: Best vegan Chinese food. I love the orange meatless chicken, the crispy coating is perfect and they put dried orange rind in the sauce. Huge portions too, I always have lunch the next day. I go here all the time and I'm not tired of it yet. The chow fun is also amazing, I order that when I want to mix it up.
author: Amanda L.

description:
I've been here twice and both times the dishes have been tasty.   I espeically enjoyed the Meatless Chicken Salad ( who knew you can also deep fry battered meatless Chicken strips!).   I love that they serve DIM SUM all day.   I crave Dim Sum any time of day so it sucks that most Chinese restaurants serve it until Lunch.  Third plus is that they are open until Midnight.   Great for us commuters who sometimes eat dinner around 9 to 10 pm.  

I didn't like their Bean Curd Vegetarian Dim Sum.    It was too salty.  But my friend did like the Vegetarian Rice Noodle Rolls.  His other favorite includes the General Tsao Meatless Chicken.   It had a nice sweet and sour and spicy flavor.   Much better than the 5 spice Meatless Chicken we tried on our first time.   

There are so many things to try on this menu that I know I'll be coming back for more.
author: Morgan L.

description:
Worst Chinese food I ever had!  If the only way to get rid of Big Lantern was to have it destroyed in an earthquake which also destroys the rest of the city, the earthquake would be worth it.

I happened to be in the area on a Sunday night craving dim sum.

No other dim sum place provides a serving spoon for each dish. That is why you gave me chopsticks.

The beef dumplings was the most edible dish of the night but did not come with the traditional worchestersire sauce or tofu skin. There were 4 pieces which is bad luck. There should only be 3 of anything in a dish.

Shrimp dumplings were filled with some nasty white colored grease and uncooked pieces of garlic. The dough tasted of uncooked flour.

Deep fried taro root with meat. This did not have the traditional pork and mushroom fillings.  This was cooked and reheated. As the oil temperature was not high enough, the filling was still cold to the touch. The outside was burnt to a dark brown. I sent this dish back.

Meat filled eggplant. Every bite was filled with grease. Totally unedible.

I ordered the egg custard but they luckily ran out.


You should only go here if you are a hippie douchebag with no tastebuds.
Meatless chicken is not chicken!!!
author: Evan W.

description:
1st delivery. Not bad. Not great either.

2nd delivery. They sent flour tortillas trying to pass them off as Mu Shu pancakes. When we called, they first insisted they sent Mu Shu pancakes, then started fumbling to make some lame excuse.

I'm afraid to ask what else they might have substituted.
author: David M.

description:
I can only speak for the delivery and takeout service, as I've never taken my lazy self all two blocks down the street to Big Lantern except to pick up my order. 

These guys operate on warp speed, and I love them for it. They're also very friendly every time they come to my door. This is really nice, because usually when you're ordering takeout in your pajama pants, you're not running at 100%, and it helps when people are gentle with you. 

Case in point, when I get over being sick, the first thing I want to eat again is their vegetarian egg rolls. I have no idea why, but they really cheer me up. 

I've been happy with other dishes from Big Lantern - the Broccoli Chicken, Cashew Chicken, Stir-Fried Veggies, Mu Shu Pork (which indeed uses soft tortillas, but who cares? tortillas are delicious), and their fried rice. 

It's not the most gourmet experience I've ever had, this is true. I wouldn't be pushing you to go on a first date here. But for delivery, take-out, or something to bring to a party, Big Lantern has become my favorite for Chinese food.
author: Jill C.

description:
Maybe 2 1/2 stars. Just because Chinese people work there doesn't mean it's going to be good Chinese food. I came here for the dim sum on a Sunday morning because bf and I didn't want to wait an hour at a real Chinese restaurant. I was willing to accept that this wasn't going to be the best dim sum I ever had (and I've had great dim sum in the bay area and in China). This place just didn't do it for me at all. We ordered all the standard dim sum: ha gao, siu mai, taro puff, steamed spareribs, etc.) Everything was just kind of bland and didn't have a trace of what dim sum is supposed to it. 

The service and ambiance was fine but they really need to change their table cloths. The top is clean since they have glass on it but the sides are quite disgusting. Normally I wouldn't care but since I know they are trying to create a nice environment and their dim sum sucked...they could at least be cleaner. 

NOTE: They add random bits of lettuce into their shrimp rice noodle roll. WHY? This isn't a sandwich. Also, I saw that they served a "Chinese tamale"? Hell no. I won't be back.
author: Julia T.

description:
Dear Big Lantern:

I enjoyed my plate of vegetarian sesame chicken, though I will not eat that again.  I should have been warned that the fake meat was really a fried wheatpuff.  Do vegetarians seem like they want fried doughnuts in a thick sweet sauce for dinner?

My fault, I know, but your headliner let me down hard.  Given your adequate service and promising look, I'm willing to give it another go.  I hope on my next visit that your veggie dimsum will improve my feelings.  Oh, and don't expect me back for dinner--your lunch specials are fine, but you need to have a check-in with yourself on those dinner prices.

See you again soon,
L
author: Marshall M.

description:
Ever since I moved out of the Tenderloin, I've been at a loss trying to get my hungover noodle craving fixed. When you live less than a block away from Osha, you can get pretty spoiled, in terms of hangover food. 

I've tried various Thai delivery places, but that's like, oh, I don't know...like listening to The Black Crowes' "Remedy" when what you really wanna hear is "Ventilator Blues." Kinda makes things worse.

Anyways.

This place is my new go-to hangover food place. They've got this "Numbing Spicy Mandarin Noodle" thing, and while I always have to apply some rooster sauce, it hits the fucking spot. Also, the steamed wontons in chili oil, and the crab puffs are awesome. The wonton soup (good for rehydration!) has more complex flavors than most wonton soups.

So. Finally. Now, if they would only deliver kombucha as well. My hangovers would be complete.
author: SheRat R.

description:
Ok, so I was turned on to this place a couple months ago when my formerly vegetarian boyfriend wanted meatless lemon chicken. So we ordered it to be delivered and it was tasty and delicious. 

We walked by the restaurant about a month ago and decided to eat in. He got the meatless chicken and I got a Chinese food standard, sesame chicken. Well, to make a long story short, I didn't like it and have had much much better. Plus the atmosphere was a bit weird and it was cold inside. 

Tonight I wanted to order Chinese food and my roommate suggested this place. I usually order delivery from Red Jade which is closer, but he wanted that meatless lemon chicken. So I ordered that plus a beef with string beans, pork fried rice, and veggie chow mein. YUCK. I've had so much better at Red Jade and frankly any other restaurant. It was really greasy, flavorless, and they screwed up and sent REAL lemon chicken. Stupid idiots. I'll never order here again.

They only get 2 stars because of that tasty meatless lemon chicken, which is actually tastier than the real chicken. But with the quality of the rest of the standard food, I'd rather not order there again. Plus I'm a meat eater so what the fuck would I want with meatless?
author: Foodie F.

description:
Anytime I want chinese vegetarian delivered to my house in lower haight from the mission area, I always seem to call this place. I really love it! This place is my house's favorite take-out place........whenever we're lazy to cook, this place is only a phone call away! The food is great! The best thing on the menu is the general meatless chicken and turnip cakes! yum yum! =)

Also they offer free delivery and they are pretty fast! Sweet service!
author: Rae R.

description:
I ended up swinging by here with two friends who assured me the food was "really good".  And, truth be told, the food was decent.  But the service was downright rude.  And when your food is only "decent", and not amazing - you don't get more than two stars for that kind of garbage from moi.

The waiter wasn't actually even rude to me, but he was rude to both of my friends (which was sort of ironic since they were the ones who really wanted to go).  But, I don't much care for having my dining companions treated shabbily.

If I want Chinese, I'll be going elsewhere in the future...
author: Christopher S.

description:
Good.
Cheap.
Fast. 


Their dim sum is pretty good, some of their dishes are actually top notch (hot & sour soup, meatless chicken dishes, hong kong style chow mein). Everything is a tad greasy, but to cure a hangover - this shit is tops. Plus their veggies are fresh and nothing tastes like MSG or chinese fast food. 

& If you order two entrees you get a free chow mein or fried rice!
author: Kelly Kate W.

description:
absolutely delicious! i really love this place, they have fantastic options for vegetarians which means i finally get to understand why everyone is always so excited about orange chicken!

yum yum! they are the best!
author: Jasmine F.

description: I really like this place. The food is good, neighborhood awesome, staff is cool. If I have the flu I come by here and pick up the sizzling rice soup, its the best if your feeling under the weather. Their Hong Kong noodles and cream cheese crab puff things are hella good too.
author: Brian R.

description:
I kinda sorta miss Mission Grounds, though it did start to suck big time towards the end. 

I'm a devout Yum Yum person, but I decided to give Big Lantern a try because they deliver dim sum and they stuck a menu on my gate. Well, they got the order wrong, they didn't know what I was saying when I said "Guerrero" and everything was cold by the time it arrived.

But hey, they were new at the time and the dim sum wasn't bad, so I ordered a few more time. Decent dim sum, a bit pricey for being so basic, but at least it comes to me, rather than trekking to Clement Street or Stockton Street.
author: Leslie Ann R.

description:
I've ordered take out about three times in the past 5 months or so, including last night .   the food is greasy.  It can be tasty too, particularly the schezuan chicken.  The bags they came in were greasy.  My fancy chopsticks I used are still greasy.   The Styrofoam container they came in is still greasy, after wiping it down a couple times.   My fridge now has to be wiped down too.  I think you get the picture.  

I think I'll remove the big lantern menu from the drawer now.
author: Adrian N.

description:
I absolutely love the General Tsao's Meatless Chicken here! 

Also try the combination pot of Meatless Ham and Meatless chicken! I prefer to get more of the chicken though. I have sent countless people to this restaurant. I love the fact they deliver anywhere in San Francisco and late too! 

It's super cheap! 

Plus you get free fried rice or chow mein with purchase of two or more entrees! I opt for the veggie fried rice and add faux chicken!!!! You won't be disappointed!!!!!!!!!!!!

Plus if you have meat eater friends there's a HUGE selection of items to choose from and I mean HUGE!!!

Check out their website!!!!!!!!
author: Sashy R.

description:
so i wrote a really bad review of the old big lantern( i got food poisoning ), before it merged with yum yum house a while back, we've been twice now, and it was pretty tasty, it might become our new mission Chinese restaurant.

The owner seems pretty unfriendly, but the food is good so i'll deal
author: Jared Z.

description:
We go here two or three times per month. There's always room, even for large parties. Our vegan friends will go with us, thanks to their fake meat options. Its close, they're nice, the food is good. I've never had delivery or their dim sum, so we're just talking about that good old Chinese food here. 

There is a high pitched dog whistle of a whine that comes from some machine or other in the kitchen that we don't like, but it doesn't seem to hurt the food much.
author: Gus J.

description:
Sweet Jesus let there be Chinese food!

Great service, good healthy chinese food... yes it is posible. They even have meatless dishes.

I go here pretty often, about a few times a month with some friends of mine, kind of a tradition. The waiters remember what you order very friendly treat you like family.

I recommend it!
author: Eric T.

description: Great food, delivery was a little slow but it was a busy night so all around a great dinner option when you don't want to cook!
author: Michael B.

description: 5 Stars for being open past 10 PM on a Sunday evening.  Great Late night Chinese delivery.    Gentleman taking order over the phone was very polite and executed better-than-expected customer service.  Food was very good.   I will order from these folks again.
author: Leeora B.

description:
I've been wanting to try Big Lantern for a while. Their menu has many vegetarian options, and most importantly, dim sum. Tonight, I got my wish. 

We started with a pot of bold oolong tea. For food, we focused on the many vegetarian dim sum options. Our favorite dishes were the tofu vegetarian roll and vegetarian bun. The rolls are steamed tofu skins stuffed with a vegetable mixture in a savory sauce. The fluffy steamed buns were also tasty.  The onion pancakes were  too dense and oily, but were still good with the peanut sauce. The rice noodle roll tasted good, but the texture was too soft. Both the chive and vegetable dumplings were disappointingly starchy/doughy.

The atmosphere of this restaurant is nice, doused with red light. The artwork is cool, most notably the large photo of a Chinese river boat scene. The service is fast and efficient, and the prices are low. Our meal was $28 with tip. With all of the other excellent restaurants in the area, I don't think I'll be coming back here. This dim sum just didn't cut the Chinese mustard.
author: Ron L.

description:
I really like this place a lot.  I get this place delivery, never been to it, but the food is excellent and the delivery is fast.  They also track your address so all you have to do is give them your number.  The one thing that is a little annoying is that you have to ask for rice or they dont give it to you. But hey at least they dont charge you for rice like other places.  On a side note you should hear this song called "Got Rice?" by this asian rapper, using the tupac "changes" song, it's pretty funny.

They also give you a kit of all these utensils, fortune cookies, soy sauce, etc when u order which is pretty cool.
author: christopher h.

description:
UPDATE: Had to remove 1 star for a sub-standard meal on my last visit. The kitchen is slacking off big time. The pea sprouts were over corn-starched or just plain mushy, and the stuffed rice-noodle dim sum was either old or over steamed (mushy, mushy, mushy). No excuse for a barely filled dining room, you know? Wha' happened?
-----------------------------------

I give this place 4 stars for taste. Ala carte dim sum in the Mission? Who knew? I was excited to find this place, as the food is more like the Chinese restaurants in the Sunset the locals go to. Not the 1 choice, 2 choice type of bland Chinese joints most folks think of. This place is not a greasy spoon.

I will forewarn you, as most reviews attest to --- don't order takeout/delivery. This place doesn't have the service level to do so. You need to sit down and eat the food as it comes from the kitchen. Big Lantern's only drawback is their lazy, sometimes rude, inexperienced waitstaff who seem to be friends of a friend of a.... They work much better on the floor, but are sorely lacking in delivery. And why would you get dim sum delivered anyway?

Hits - taro vegetarian puff, siu mai, turnip cake, stuffed mushrooms, rice noodle roll, shrimp dumpling, steamed spareribs, garlic pea sprouts (delish), minced chicken lettuce cup, salt & pepper squid, and most of the soups.

Misses - vegetable dumpling, curry puff, shrimp toast, chive dumpling

I suggest ordering a meal heavy on the dim sum, a nice pot of tea and a side of the garlic pea sprouts to up your veggie points.
author: Antoi C.

description:
I've gotten delivery from them a few times, and the dishes are really hit or miss. The sesame meatless chicken was amazingly good, although if you don't like Americanized chinese food with very sweet glaze, I wouldn't recommend it. The five spice meatless sesame chicken was also good, although I thought the spices overpowered all the other flavors.

I was not a fan of the Honey Pecan Prawn. It turned out to be deep fried and covered in mayonnaise. I've had the Basil Meatless Chicken and it wasn't bad, but the fake meat used had a very smokey meaty flavor to it which I didn't like (I don't eat meat, so why would I like the taste of it?).

Overall, I would say very good. I'll definitely be ordering from them again.
author: Mel L.

description: OK, with all the reviews about it being all veggie super-friendly, I was a skeptical carnivore. Pleasantly surprised! ALL their dishes - veg and non-veg - pretty freakin' tasty! We had the Ginger Fish, Mandarin Combo Clay Pot, and as a meat lover, I was impressed. The veggie dishes - Moo Shoo, Garlic Eggplant, and even the Cashew Meatless Chicken were very, very good. And DIm Sum all day! It's like an Asian Denny's!! Nothing fancy here, but they definitely know how to cook.
author: Manu G.

description: This is the best Chinese food I have ever eaten.  Ambience in the dining area isn't great, but isn't dirty or like a carryout place.  It's definately a nice place to sit down and have some Kung Pao Egg Rolls, and some Hot and Sour soup.  Very high quality food!  Cheap too!
author: Tom L.

description:
Thank god for big lantern. 
I am not especially religious (or at all religious actually) but I have uttered these words to myself on many occasions.

For example:
1- when I want dim sum and am just not up for the trek to china town or clement street
2- when I want dim sum and it's 11pm and I'm in my pj's
3- when I'm at the office and it's pouring rain and I forgot to bring lunch
4-when I'm sick and need someone to bring me soup
5- when my parents are in town and I need to take them somewhere nearby that won't be too pricey or make them feel awkward for being the only people over 30

and many others. 

Big Lantern has the kind of chinese food I grew up with on the east coast, which makes me blissfully nostalgic (enough to overlook the msg haze that follows) and it's true- their delivery is quite fast. 

My favorites include: kung pao tofu, general chicken (or meatless chicken), orange chicken, braised tofu with bok choy, garlic pea sprouts, sweet rice tamale (sticky rice), and stuffed mushrooms. They also have yummy brown rice, should you want to pretend you're eating something healthy.
author: Jasmin S.

description: Great vegetarian ma po tofu, bok choy with black mushrooms and steamed veggie and chicken buns. Service is fine, nothing special about the ambiance, but it's all about the food anyway. Good prices too.
author: Victoria K.

description: OH EM GEE! This place is amazing. Who knew? I've lived close by for awhile now, and never went....I am so glad I discovered it now...but sad that I'm moving away from it. I'll have to make special trips because I will crave the deliciousness! From reading the reviews I decided to get the General Meatless Chicken, sauteed green beans, veg potstickers, and side of brown rice. All of it was super good! This place is literally a vegetarians dream come true....because I have tried many meatless products and truth be told they generally suck. The General Meatless chicken from here is so amazingly tasty, I keep thinking about it...I am addicted... and I am honestly not stretching the truth here...it's that good. Get it, try it, you'll love it just as much as I do. Period.
author: Sonya D.

description: I don't know what's up with Big Lantern these days because I'm not feeling so good after I eat there anymore. Did ingredients change? I've been about 3 times this year and always my stomach goes crazy till the next day. I love the flavor, but damn, it's not worth the gastronomic price. Also, I've noticed that portions seem smaller, but I can't fault you guys for that. Times are tough and I understand, Big Lantern. Could you please lay off whatever you've changed in the food though, cuz I love your eggrolls, five spice chicken, and your chow mein is the best ever. Please?
author: gabby m.

description: Came back for the dim sum: The pork-free buns were dry, everything else was gelatinous, and all of it was bland. I won't go out of my way to eat here again, nor will I suggest it. But I wouldn't balk if someone else did.
author: Brian W.

description: Average Chinese food, as expected. Delivery was super fast: 10 minutes, which is actually a bit frightening.
author: Captain B.

description:
I wouldn't say inedible, but close to it. I was barely able to muscle it down despite being starving. Lowest quality Chinese food, greasy and gross.

Hot & Sour soup (small) - Way too sour to take more than a few sips. Gross.

Bok Choy with Ginger & Onion - A few watery unchopped heads of bok choy, with a few pieces of onion stirred in, i.e. not adding any flavor. Tasteless and chewy.

Sesame Beef - Crispy coated, sugary. Hard to detect the beef in it. 

I was so hungry that I ordered here for the first time without checking Yelp = big mistake. Will not do it again.

But hey, the delivery was fast! Got to appreciate that, even if they were bringing garbage to your door...right? Or maybe they just have a lot of free time since nobody is repeat ordering their food.
author: Nick C.

description:
This is my go-to delivery spot. I finally made it here after months of delivery to dine-in, and somehow it took my friend and me a shameful amount of time to locate the place. Despite this handicap, it really is located in a central spot in the Mission district; I just had the address wrong.

In any case, the food was even better dining in than it is for delivery. Especially the dim sum- we ordered the Stuffed Mushrooms and Baked BBQ Pork Buns. Highly enjoyable. Soft and succulent dough on the pork buns, and delicious sauce for the mushrooms. Great sesame beef; orange meatless chicken was a little too salty for my taste. I'll stick to the real deal next time. As always, excellent fried rice. I left here feeling full and ready for a nap. Now I remember why I usually order Chinese delivery in elastic-waist PJ pants.
author: Anna S.

description: So I walked into Pakwan for an XMas lunch (while my laundry was drying). They don't take credit, so I mosied over here. WOW - the lunch special for $5.25 was impressive! I opted for the basil chicken which came with soup and a side salad. The main dish was laden with fresh veggies like zucchini, peppers, and tons of fresh basil leaves. I ate every last bite. The dim sum looks good. My mom would have been here every day if we had discovered this while she was here! The Mission has solid Chinese after all. Yippee!
author: Andrew K.

description:
This is a delivery Godsend for me.

I was living off of May Lee sushi for months while I worked in the studio, and then one day, a flyer crawled along a gust of wind to my ankle and stayed there.  I picked it up and saw the words "delivery" and "dim sum".

A moment later, having cancelled my plans for the next several hours, I called and ordered nearly every non pork item from their dim sum menu with the promised assistance of my sisters boyfriend in eating it.

The shit was unbelievable.  It is every fucking time.  It is dim sum.  It is delivered to your door.  If this doesn't excite you, I never want to meet you.  I just don't think we would understand each other.

This isn't Yank SIng, but they don't deliver do they?
author: Hebrew K.

description: It mat not be advertised as such, but this place is a great choice for vegetarians. They have expanded their menu, adding 10+ new veggie dishes, all of which are delicious! It is greasy (like all Chinese food), so I would recommend ordering only one fried dish- and a vegetable so you don't leave feeling sick.
author: Ashley E.

description:
I got food poisoning after eating here, BUT.. I give it four stars. The food was very good and the service was exceptional. We even got food pairing recommendations.

My friend didn't get sick, so who knowns what happened. Maybe it was the food, maybe it was something else. Maybe i should have washed my hands prior to eating. Either way, I got sick 30 minutes after eating there, but will definitely return. The food and service is A+. There's not a lot of places that serve a good dim sum menu late at night.

Just to be on the safe side, you might want to get your vaccinations up to date before sitting down.
author: David S.

description: My husband and I were expecting something good because of the recent reviews we read here.  Boy, were we disappointed.  Crispy chicken was so salty my husband (who is a salt fiend) said it was too much for him.  The lemon chicken was soggy and swimming in sauce.  The "pork" dumplings were actually shrimp, which meant they were literally inedible for my husband who is allergic to shrimp.  (There were shrimp chips garnishing the crispy chicken as well, but we know to watch out for those.)   Never again.  Wild Pepper will continue to be our go-to for Chinese food.
author: Hypercycloid ..

description:
***UPDATE*** - 2/13/08

4.5 stars now

I placed a large order yesterday for an office meeting and Ming was kind enough to help me choose the dishes.  Since I don't eat meat, he graciously went over the menu with me and recommended the popular entrees.  I also ordered the general meatless chicken, another pick by Ming, and absolutely LOVED it!  I'm guiltily admitting, yes, all the leftovers on that one went directly to my stomach, no one else had a chance!  


2/3/08-
Ok, 3.5 really.  I took a 1/2 star off b/c the host wasn't the nicest.  If he were on his own, I would say the service is not so great, but the lady waitress, while not super friendly, was attentive and a lot kinder than him.

Aside from the staff, everything else about Big Lantern gets a HUGE thumbs up from me.  The ambiance is great, food's really good, in a prime location and great lunch prices.  If you're vegetarian, there are lots of choices to pick from.  I had the sweet and sour meatless chicken with rice and it was delicious.  Total came out to only $6.46 w/tax and I left with a full belly!
author: Swetha G.

description:
I really wish I could give half stars...I would really give 2.5 stars but I opted for 3 instead of 2 since they fed us when we were hungry.  

I keep trying to like Chinese food.  I wish I liked it.  Yet every time I eat it, I remember why I don't like Chinese food:
1. WAY too much sodium, unnecessarily so.
2. Everything tastes the same: like Salt!
3.Oh holey jeebus, why so much grease??? why cant they just coat the pan with a light drizzling of oil and use the rest of the gallon to drive a bio-diesel car or power up a generator?

The dim sum was ok, but somehow even the steamed stuff was greasy and salty...it is a Chinese restaurant after all. 
OH WAIT!!! THE TEA WAS GREAT! We had the rice flower tea and that was lovely!
The people were nice and I feel bad for dissing their food but "its not you its me"...I should just remember not to try to eat Chinese.
author: Nilu r.

description: The order took 11/2 hours to be delivered.  When it arrived the food was cold and oily.  I called to check on the order and was given attitude by the man on the phone.  Stay away from this dump.
author: Richard C.

description:
Ordered home delivery, got here pretty fast and everything was hot. Food was pretty decent, the mixed veges were great, very fresh and crunchy. The sesame beef was quite good, apart from finding a strand of shredded metal in there :( 

Overall, it's pretty good food, I will go back even though I got the unwanted special ;)
author: Patrick W.

description:
Big Lantern is my favorite Chinese food place this side of Berkeley. Yes, I know there are probably a dozen "better" places in Chinatown, but a) I am never in Chinatown and b) even Yelp can't help me avoid the places I hate, because some people really *like* cabbage.

We have our own table by the window, and even after several months of not going in, Ming recognized me and opened a conversation. Sometimes he comes off as gruff, but he is a sweetheart. This restaurant has awesome General (*)'s Chicken. That's not all I order, but it's what it takes to make me truly happy. And whether you like General Tso's Chicken or General Meatless(') Chicken, you will be very, very happy.

And it's CHEAP!
author: Dan S.

description: I LOVE the General Meatless Chicken and have ordered it every time I bring Big Lantern over to my place...but I haven't really liked anything else on the menu yet, and I get something new every time I go.  The "crispy fried tofu with spicy pepper" did NOT travel well: it was SOGGY!  If I was in the restaurant, I would've sent it back...and I've never sent back food before (and still haven't, I guess).  Getting two entrees scored me a free side (don't forget to ask for this), so I had veggie chow mein, and spending more than $10 scored me free delivery, so my AMAZING meatless chicken, miserable tofu, and chow mein set me back less than $20!
author: Rusty P.

description: With fast, friendly service and huge selection of vegetarian and vegan options, Big Lantern has quickly become on of my favorites in the Bay. It's definitely my top choice for American Chinese cuisine.
author: Mike P.

description:
BOW BEFORE THE FAUX MEAT GOLIATH WITH ALL THE GUSTO OF A HAPLESS SLAVE.....even if the Jasmine Tea House (never been) is considered the reigning chief of psychological subterfuge, who really needs to find out if there is better? The sesame imi-chick FRIGHTENED ME TO THE BRINK OF CATATONIA. i started to break into convulsions in the kilowatt alley attempting to justify eating meat again, im still unconvinced that i ingested mere rivulets of soy and not your typical "blemish carnival" fowl asshole. i sleep tidy.....to return once again....

BROWN RICE TO SOP IT UP. THE LAST TEMPTATION OF CHRIST:ON ICE!
author: Christopher J.

description: Good spot for Dim Sum and Dinner.  Great selection of vegetarian and normal dim sum, I want to try them ALL.  I had the Peking Duck which was DELICIOUS! perfectly crispy skin, juicy tender meet, fresh onions and cabbage and perfect little pancakes with plenty of plum sauce on the side.  I went with two people who had never had peking duck before so our waiter demonstrated how to make the little sandwiches - very charming and entertaining - highlight of the meal for sure.  I will most definitely come back here.
author: Jo A.

description:
this is my favorite chinese place in the city.  for vegetarians, welcome to the holy grail!    

tip: order two entrees for pick-up and you get free fried rice or chow mein!  get the meatless orange chicken and don't miss the potstickers.
author: Melissa C.

description: It's never a good thing when you feel like a restaurant is nickel and diming you during the dining experience.  I hate to sound petty, but when the carpet is old and worn out and the decor consists of cheesy trinkets, survey says: free hot tea.  Not here.  Less forgivable was the Mandarin Eggplant, a Chef's Special that was supposed to come with chicken and prawns.  I wish the menu clarified that it's two little prawns for the entire plate and a few small bits of chicken.  The taste: mediocre, in no way redeeming their parsimony.  I also tried the hot and sour soup, which was off-tasting with pockets of really hot and lukewarm liquid.  Nice reheating job guys.  To finish things off, the waiter brought us the wrong check.  Of course, it was higher... The 16th/Valencia area could use a legit Chinese restaurant.  This is not it.
author: Leon R.

description:
Just to provide some info, I love Chinese food. I have ordered from this place many, many times and I still like it. That being said...

They are very inconsistent in their quality. Some times their Lo Mein, which my girl and I love, is very good, others, just average. It doesn't get as bad as some other places but it is a disappointment that you can never know which cook will be making the dishes that day. On their good days, they are up there with some of the best. The one thing they have in their favor is that they are actually recognized as one of the cleanest, safest restaurants in the Bay Area but the quality control just isn't up to standard.

Also, the wait time can be painful. Sometimes they will deliver within 40 minutes but most times, it takes them over an hour to deliver and I live in Downtown!
author: Brandon D.

description:
They deliver to me in the Dog Patch! NOT MANY DO!!

I'm gonna keep this short and sweet...

Foli Wrapped Chicken... Taro Veggie Puffs...Mini Crab Cakes.
-or... for you veggies-
Turnip Cake...Taro Veggie Puffs and Egg Custard.

Yup, Call it a night!
author: Kellie P.

description: My favorite chinese place in the city. My only complaint is that they are far away, but they make up for it by delivering downtown and/or anywhere in SF. I love their meatless selection. Get their meatless cashew chicken. Phenomenal!!! I will always be a fan if they keep this up! VIVA BIG LANTERN!!
author: Courtney M.

description:
After seeing a review in The Onion, a friend and I were highly motivated to try out some of the meatless options that had received rave reviews.

Ladies and Gents, I rave. 

We had the veggie potstickers, general meatless chicken, stir fried string beans and one side of brown rice. Including tip, it was $29.00/USD. Even with two people eating, we still had some savory delights to take home for a late night snack.

OMG it was supremely delicious. The potstickers were triple the size and had a finely diced mix of ingredients, not just the cabbage with a twig of carrot for color. They were hot and fresh and peppered nicely by the Mandarin of the chef who prepared them. You know, sometimes ingredients respond better to their native tongue. 

The "general meatless chicken" is a faux meat product with a light batter that is crunchy and coated with a thick sauce that is spicy with hints of ginger and garlic and comes with those deeelicious red hot dried peppers. It is served in a bed of broccoli.

The String Beans are to die for .. only the Szuechuan gods of culinary delight know how they are prepared. But you will be licking your fingers to nibs with pleasure. 

I will definitely be back to try more of the menu. After eating here, Gung Hoy Fat Choy just took on a whole new meaning!!!
author: Miel H.

description:
The Sunday evening service was exceptionally slow.   But despite that, 3 out of 4 dishes were very good (Hong Kong style chow mein, beef w/ pea sprouts, orange chix) & I walked away a happy man. 

Ultimately, a good addition to the 16th street niche.
author: Robby T.

description:
Well... I don't know what I got... and it certainly wasnt what I ordered.. but it waaaas one of the tastiest meals I've had recently!  Sort of like Yum Yum with some nutritional value! I will certianly go back to Big Lantern and try my luck again at some point.

UPDATE: I went back and tried something different and it was gloriously delicious! and not just cause I was expecting it to be mediocre. Official recommendation: sesame meatless chicken. The braised tofu with bok choy is also pretty tasty. Yay!

p.s. you should probably just get some dum sum if you want appetizers.. all three apps I've tried have seemed totally microwaved. On the other hand all the dim sum I've had has been deeeelicious.
author: katharine s.

description:
It being the Chinese New Year and all, I decided to sample a little more than my usual share of Chinese restaurant offerings.  First stop: Big Lantern.  Bonus points for having the huevos to be a Chinese place in the Mission.  No neighborhood needed you more, BL.   

About the food...First thing I noticed was the ample vegetarian selection.  I'm not veggie but my friends are and it's nice to have options for them.  We ordered the sizzling rice soup and it was really good, full of veggies and chicken and fish.  The baked pork buns were nice, too.  I liked the meat:bun ratio -- not too much of either so they're perfect little snacks for two before dinner.  The entree was Mongolian Beef and the best I can remember having.  Pea shoots not so tasty and a little soggy, but eclipsed by the fact that our fortune cookie fortunes were uncanny in their accuracy.  Oh and the house tea is Jasmine (my favorite). 

The service, like the pea shoots, left something to be desired, but on the whole, Big Lantern was a good experience (just be proactive about getting your order taken and you're set).  I'll definitely be back to Big Lantern with veggie friends in tow.  It's kind of pretty inside and dirt-ass cheap, too!
author: Kerrinski S.

description:
Finding good take out Chinese food in San Francisco has always been a challenge. After cutting my teeth on Boston and New York Chinatown food, something about the local Chinese seemed, well lacking. Maybe it was the fact that every chinese place here seems to sell the same Hunan cuisine that there's not much to distinguish it. Even the venerable Henry's Hunan has lost its luster.

So, when friends from Tampa said we should have Chinese tonight, I hit the reviews online and decided on Big Lantern.

The restaurant - clean and bright with an open kitchen. We were shown a table by someone that we assume is the owner. The menu was unexpected - focusing on special dishes with only a small selection of the typical Chinese standards. After talking to the owner about their best dishes, we went with a selection of dim sum, meat dishes and a noodle dish.

The dim sum ranged from excellent to good. The stuffed crab claws and hargow were excellent. The siu mai, siu long bao and the shrimp toast were very good, and the pan fried pork buns were good. Nothing bad, and the crab claws are the best any of us have had in ages.

I asked if they had pork belly for twice-cooked pork, but unfortunately they didn't have any - but he offered a similar dish with roasted char siu, which fit the bill. As of their next printing of the menu, real twice-cooked pork with pork belly will be on the menu. We also had Kung Pao Chicken, very well made, but I am not a fan of zucchini in this dish. The surprising dish was an excellent spicy "numbing" noodles - lo mein covered with a ground pork and shiitake ragout.

All of this, Pu Erh tea and two beers ran us $60. Plus, they deliver out to the ballpark, meaning that we have a good delivery option in SOMA/Mission Bay.

Highly recommended for dim sum or main courses.
author: Avery G.

description:
You would think that after ordering a couple of dim sum dishes it'd add up to a lot, but in reality 4 dishes = about $13. The sad thing is that they don't wheel around little carts and ask you what you want and stamp cards. 

But the dim sum was okay. The pan fried noodles was okay. 

They have a lovely wine list. 

But I'm not impressed or anything. 

But while we were there an old man did tell me I was "too pretty for my boyfriend." HAHAHA!
author: Aromy X.

description: This place isn't the best but with it's free over $10 delivery (even for lunch, to my dismay lots of places that usually deliver refuse to do so for lunch), cheap lunch items, and speedy delivery time.  It's definitely a win on my plate.
author: Skye W.

description:
Go here for fresh, crisp, delightfully tasty veggies in their dishes!!

Seriously, I'm not even vegetarian, but I admire a restaurant that doesn't drown their veggies in oil, or cooks them to the point of bland limpness. And the sauces are flavorful, and not too heavy or overpowering. I love their prawn lo mein and kung pao chicken. Generous portions, at relatively inexpensive prices.  

Wish I could comment on the dim sum, but I'm not a big dim sum eater (I know, I'm weird.)

Been here during off-peak times during the week and lunch times, and service was pretty good.  They deliver and best of all, they're open late: till 11pm Sun-Wed and Midnight Thurs-Sat.!!!
author: Michelle K.

description:
The drizzle outside my window reinforced my desire to watch bad TV and snuggle under a blanket all Sunday. However, this was in direct conflict with my beloved tradition of dim sum with the hubby every weekend. So, trying to pacify both desires at once we set out to find a place that would deliver dim sum. 

Although we were ecstatic that we had achieved our goal, poor Big Lantern really wasn't that tasty. I would say that it was below average, but we did figure that the delivery would be an excuse for the slight rubbery texture. The price was definitely higher than we were used to, but with the delivery again, we figured it was worth it. Basically, convenience balanced the lack luster cuisine.
 I suppose we might order from there again, if another rainy Sunday and inability to leave the house kicks in, but then again the want for good dim sum will probably be enough motivation to get me out of the house in the future.
author: Dixon T.

description:
Big Lantern is excellent lunch fare.

I can't speak for the meat dishes - I'm a vegetarian - but for cheap lunch specials that deliver far, it's not too hard to go wrong if you're in the mood for Chinese.

The meatless ham is a particularly good prize, though the tofu dishes are hit and miss - sometimes the texture and firmness is way off, and the tofu becomes nothing more than a mushy vehicle for flavouring - which, while okay, isn't exactly *great*.

Note that sometimes they're weird about delivery.  At times I can order a single dish with credit and be fine, and other times I've been told that the minimum is $10 or $15.  I have not yet figured out why this is in the slightest, but they've always been amenable ("Okay, well.. we'll let it go this time, but next time, now you know.")
author: Juliette S.

description: great place for vegetarians. Awesome meatless chicken dishes and other veggie plates (I recommend meatless kung poa or sesame).  They also have a wide variety of veggie appetizers and dim sum.  the lunch specials at the place are killer: around 7$ for soup, rice, an entree, and a little salad.  they also have beer and wine.
author: Emily F.

description: We ordered delivery and the food portions were SMALL even after we had asked for extra meat on both dishes and paid extra for it!!!!! and on top of that part of my food was cold! NEVER AGAIN!
author: Daria M.

description:
WAAAAAAAY too greasy, even for Chinese food.

The wonton soup was too salty, pork buns had cold pork, and after awhile everything just started to taste the same.

One star for delivery, though.
author: Nenette Y.

description:
Gung Hay Fat Choy! FINALLY, a decent cheap chinese takeout in the Mission. I've lived in the area for nearly ten years, and I struggled to find a Chinese that compares to the many (superior quality in taste and presentation) Thai places in SF. I survived on Tien Fu for many years until they bailed out and were taken over by inferior product. (I miss my asparagus black bean sauce with tofu). 

Big Lantern has classic greasy Chow FUN! (wide noodles introduced to me in NY's chinatown many moons ago). Big Lantern has Mandarin LAMB! Tender shaved strips bathed with delicate "brown sauce," spiked with birds-eye chilis and tender sauteed veggies to balance the lamb's richness. BL has General's Meatless Chicken!! that everyone  is yelping about because it's better in taste and texture than traditional General's chicken that I never order because it's so oily and starchy and over the top orangey. The dim sum is a little pricey (and certainly can't match Chinatowns You's and Lou's), but they are the only dim sum place for miles so who can blame them. If they bring the good chinese food they are allowed to charge a little more for dim sum. I like the curry puff; stuffed crab leg and one day I will try the turnip cake. 

I'm not a big Chinese food fan (too greasy, too aggressive), but after moving to Noe and following false leads to Eric's and Alice's, I was looking for the place to fix. The only issue I've encountered was somewhat shoddy service and slight inconsistencies in the quality/flavour of the food when I've dined-in. 

My take-out experience has been fine, so in the meantime, when I get the cheap CFT jones, I'll order in Big Lantern. You will never have to order from Yum-Yum house EVER AGAIN. Free delivery!! Brown Rice!! Lunch Specials!! Huge Menu (posted online, too)!!
author: E L.

description:
I went with a friend on a Saturday night and was surprised not to find a mob.

I guess nowadays this isn't expensive, but it's not cheap either. (We all have to watch our pennies as we dig ourselves out of Bush's hole.)

The Crab Cheese Puffs were about as indifferently made as could be without actually being bad. I wouldn't be surprised if someone told me they had been reheated.

I found both my entree and that of my dinner companion unremarkable. He found his unpleasant and would not finish it.

He said this was his second bad experience there and would not return. I guess I might give it another try, but I'll have to find someone else to go with.
author: BigJohnS F.

description:
YES!!!! Thank you Big Lantern! I have been looking for you my whole life. And finally, I have found the love of my late-night-chinese-food-delivery life! 

Delicious, clean food. From mango chicken, to peking duck, it's yum, yum, triple yum. Fried rice from heaven. Yeah, it's greasy, but if it weren't I'd send it back. It's fried rice, y'all. The mixed Won Ton is fantastic!! It has wonderful mushrooms, fresh shrimp, beef, and a rich dark broth and veggies! This is not a place the skimps on the good stuff.

It's also not a super traditional place either. I was, however, raised on traditional chinese food, and I can't stand a lot of that dressed up chinese food, and I still totally love and appreciate what they do here. It's traditional enough to completely hit the spot, but done in a way the somehow feels healthier than traditional chinese food.

I'm in LOVE!!!

P.S. Corn starch containers. ;-)
author: Mindy L.

description: These guys are so bad that I really don't know how they are still in business. As many other reviewers have said, they don't deliver on time  and the food is low quality and cold when it finally arrives. I've never had oilier, nastier Chinese food.
author: Joseph S.

description:
updating to say- I tried the sweet and sour meatless
 chicken the other day- and it is incredible.
BUT it looks very similar to real chicken.
lucky for me- someone else in the office ordered the real chicken version-
and I had her taste test mine to check it 
(because the vegetarian looked too much like the real thing)
she had to taste hers after mine to make sure they were different.
oh and the cocktails are really really good.
this is one of my ultimate favorite restaurants.
author: Maxine M.

description:
The service is not top-notch.  We had dim sum here this morning and the server forgot one of our items, and seemed to be purposely avoiding looking over at our table at all times, so it was challenging order more food or get the check.  And it was tough to get hot tea which is a requisite part of the dim sum experience.
Why 4 stars then? The food was delicious, the prices were reasonable, and mostly I love being able to walk instead of jumping on 3 buses to get tasty dim sum.
author: beth m.

description: If you're starving, expect this place to take longer than hr and half to get your food.
author: Steve Y.

description: Um, after finding a big dead bug in our noodle soup, lost our appetites for dinner and for ordering from them ever again.  Man, how disappointing.
author: Esther R.

description:
Unfortunately, I can only give this place two stars.  This is because of delivery problems, which I'll explain below.

First, I've enjoyed the food.  I haven't really ordered off the menu -- I just ask for what I want, and see if they have it.  I have been pleased with the food.  And, when I've eaten in, the service has been very good.

However, when I ordered delivery strange things happend.  First time, the delivery person didn't come all the way to my house.  Instead, he called from his cell phone and said he had delivery for me.  I went down to my front door and didn't see any delivery.  I went outside, and he was 1/2 way down the hill from my house!!  Second time was a bit better.  Third time a different delivery guy actually came to the door, but then complained about having to deliver.  I gave a pretty good tip, and he COMPLAINED ABOUT THE AMOUNT!  I only live like 4 blocks from the place, by the way.  After that I stopped ordering.
author: Bruce S.

description:
Date of visit - April 22, 2007 for Dim Sum

1/2 Star for Atmosphere - small little shop that fits about 30-40 ppl. It wasn't very crowded so it was nice to have most of the place to ourselves. The environment is nothing to marvel over, but it certainly has character.

1/2 Star for Food - Certain dishes tastes like frozen dim sum, while others are decent, but nothing I had blew me anyway. Also the portions of dim sum are super tiny. You should expect to order about 5-6 orders just for yourself in order to stay from being hungry.

1/2 Star for Service - Our server was efficient and polite, brought us water and tea within moments of being seated. The food took awhile to come out, even with only two other tables in the place.

1/2 Star for Convenience - apparently there was confusion as to when it opened. We were told, either online or by the person who answered the phone, that it was open at 10am, but it actually opened at 11am. We showed up at 10:15 and had to wait. Not a big deal thought. 

1 Star for Overall Experience - Good company made for a good meal, also our meal was cheap, like $10 per person and we ordered a lot. Nothing spetacular on this menu, and I'm unsure if i'd drive all the way there just to go back.
author: Kev C.

description:
Big Lantern is awesome. 

If we've done some drinking in the Mission earlier, this is a fine place to soak up poisons with the varieties of fake chicken to be found here. 

Their General and Sesame chicken dishes are a godsend when you don't want a burrito and just want the sanity of a mellow, low-lit establishment that does not need a security guard manning the front door.

I remember when they opened a few years back and I'm delighted that that are still in business.

They also have a vintage vacuum in the bathroom.
author: Ross G.

description:
Three stars for Free Delivery, not-five stars for quality of food.

I live on East Bay side of Bay Area, and that means an awesome Oakland Chinatown with dim sum aplenty. Maybe this is why i am dimsum snobby (plus my parents roadtripped two hours driving each weekend in LA to get to Chinatown for dim sum).

This review regards strictly lunch delivery of dim sum only. 

1. Price -- I paid out ~$10 for about seven pieces of dimsum. overprice much? a little.
2. Filler -- I hate places that pervert delicious dimsum by introducing cabbage, lettuce, and carrots as filler where it does not belong. why? Why is there cabbage in my shrimp rice roll? More shrimp! Why does the taro puff contain mostly cabbage and mushrooms? More taro! My chive dumpling is mostly fat skin. boo.
3. Free delivery, very awesome.
4. Come-withs -- Came with hot mustard, soy sauce, sweet and sour sauce, rice roll sauce, chill sauce, good variety. also included forks and chopsticks and napkins. and fortune cookies.
5. Pork Shiu Mai and Haw Gow(Shrimp dumplings) were pretty mediocre.

All in all, very regular to me, but lunchtime delivery to the office is pretty nice. i don't think i'd order again--at least not until i get a noontime craving for dim sum again.
author: Jade L.

description:
Let me start off by saying this: I'm sure at some future point I'm going to come home tired and lazy from work and order from Big Lantern.  The food is edible, its never made me sick, it comes when I call for it.

That said, the last couple of times I've ordered delivery from this place have been pretty disappointing.  The guy who takes the food orders is rude, they've messed up the orders a couple times (nothing major, stuff like forgetting the sauce for the pot stickers) and most irritatingly even though I always ask them to call instead of ring the doorbell and even though they always say 'sure, no problem' they always ring the doorbell and disturb my poor roommates who then have to stop what they're doing and answer the door so I can get my greasy Chinese food.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
The Big Lantern is my dim sum spot for Sunday afternoon football at the Kilowatt.  Their dim sum is pretty tasty and I don't know of any other place in the Inner Mission that has dim sum.  Its a little on the salty side and a little bit more expensive than your average dim sum, but its a good find if you're having a dim sum craving and don't feel like making a long trip.  The dim sum combo (pork bun, sui mai and har gow) does the trick for lunch.  I'd go 4 starts for that.

I just tried my first delivery from here and it was pretty average.  Had mango chicken and broccoli prawns.  The meats seemed good-- no worries about it being a mystery animal, excessively greasy, or containing large amounts of rat droppings, etc... but neither dish had a lot of flavor.  

I'm going to stick to dim sum at the Big Lantern and keep trying on delivery places.  I would say Andy's currently holds my top spot.
author: Zach J.

description:
This is a solid 3-star place which means I'd come back, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.  The wait staff was attentive but not overly so.  We had a selection of dim sum items: Shrimp dumping (har gao), pork dumpling (siu mai), potstickers, pork buns (char siu bao), green onions, roast pork pastry (char siu soo), taro vegetarian pastry.  Shrimp dumpling & pork dumpling were good.  I'd skip the green onion pancake (not enough salt).  Taro pastry was way TOO greasy, I'd skip it.

We also had the cold sesame noodles appetizer which was absolutely humongous.  You could have this as a full entree for two if you're not that hungry, one if you're starving.  I will say that I thought this could also use a little more salt.  For a vegetable we had sauteed pea sprouts.  It was quite good, and not too greasy, but yet again I think it needed a little more salt.  

Maybe this place just worries about hypertension?  Everything is definitely undersalted a tad.  We had fun here though, no one gave us trouble for taking up the table for quite a while, and I could hear everyone at our table, no screaming or straining to hear.
author: Joann C.

description:
Taro Puff!
Steamed Pork Bun!
Sesame Ball!
Peach Bun!
Big Lantern is our house's default restaurant when we are too tired to cook or deal with crowds. It's not fancy, swanky, busy, vacant... it's just right. The best thing about this place is that it's just a Chinese restaurant. Nothing more, nothing less, it simply IS.
author: Jess J.

description: I am writing this negative review based on the new delivery policy.  Having a $15 minimum for delivery seems crazy for Chinese food.  I'm one person & don't need to order huge quantities.  Skip Red Lantern, call Wild Pepper instead.  Wild Pepper only requires $10 for delivery & are a whole lot nicer to deal with.
author: Jenny R.

description: Chinese delivery with a decent selection of vegan food. My recommendation here is the Shaolin Temple Combo Pot. Delivery time is typically toward the slow end of things: 45 minutes or so. There is nothing special about this place, but the food is pretty good.
author: Douglas P.

description: Do not eat here!! I got food here last night, was finishing the leftovers today and found a freakin' COCKROACH in my sweet and sour tofu!!  I will be contacting the health department tomorrow to report this!!  I don't ever write yelp reviews, but I signed up for an account just to write this review.  This is totally unacceptable for a business.  DISGUSTING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Laura H.

description:
this is review is for the delivery service ONLY(the on-location experience/food is great)

i used to order at least once a week for delivery. sometimes it would take 45 minutes but normally takes an hour. they're 8 blocks from my house. when the food arrives, it's mushy and luke-warm. my last order took 1 hour and 20 minutes before i called looking for my food. "oh it's just outside. they're coming." um, no. i don't want your food anymore. i asked to cancel my order and get my charge refunded. (i finally had it. i was tired of always letting the late delivery slide.) 
instead of an apology, i get MAJOR attitude from the male manager.  do they realize i am a regular customer who tips well? i get great treatment in the restaurant, so receiving this kind of attitude was shocking.
speaking of the fact that i eat at the restaurant as well, i have seen first-hand that they bank up about 10+ delivery orders before they send the driver out. they set them all on the table closest to the kitchen when they're ready to go, so there's no way i'm just guessing they do this. this is the ONLY reason the delivery can take so long. in the restaurant, it takes less than 10 minutes to get your meal.
so even though i LOVE their meatless chicken dishes, i've decided to call it quits. i refuse to order from them again.
author: Jennie L.

description:
This place is just insanely good. Best chinese in the city. 

The delivery can be a bit slow, but the delivery dudes are super friendly and will even come find your desk at work if they know where you sit (I order too much from there, hell). 

I've tried a bunch of their dishes, but here's some of the best:

Big Lantern Spicy Fried Rice: This rice is the shit. Loaded with shrimp, pork, beef, and chicken, it is greasy as hell, but your body is loving every minute of it (until later on, but who cares about that right now). I've contemplated laying the rice out on a paper towel when I bring it home (I often order and bring it back to the east bay as NO chinese hits the spot like Big Lantern) to suck up some of the grease, but the grease level will never stop me from ordering this amazing dish.

General/Five Spice Sesame Meatless Chicken: What? Oh my god. Perfection. Tastes just like chicken for those of you who don't eat a lot of tofu (and those who do). Fantastic flavor and crispy broccoli with it.

All of the Dim Sum is fantastic, especially the pork and/or chicken Siu Mai. I also recommend the bacon shrimp rolls.

The salt and pepper chicken wings are to die for and will leave you wanting a nap IMMEDIATELY after. The flavor is right (all the way down to the squirs of lemon and the diced garlic that garnishes the dish) and the batter is golden-fried to perfection. These are chicken wings that you will want to get every time. 

If you work in the city and you need food delivered, this place is your best bet if you've got something to busy you for about 45 minutes to an hour for the delivery wait.
author: Chris M.

description: I've been looking for some good chinese food, and Big Lantern happens to be across the street from where I live. The portion size was great, the food was tasty and it made a great lunch the next day. Best part: boyfriend got one main dish and I got another and then either white rice, fried rice or chow mein was free! Gotta love that.
author: Inga B.

description: Hell yeah a Chinese place that has awesome food, nice decor, service, and great prices!!! And its in the mission, who woulda guessed. Both apps and entrees are great for sharing too if you want to make your dollar go even further. I highly recommend the crab cheese puffs (omg) and vegetable dumplings for appetizers. My friend and I got both of those apps, chow fun, sweet & sour chicken, and a side of white rice, with water instead of drinks and the bill was under $30!! Amazing, if you ask me... Go! :)
author: Julie P.

description:
When it comes to chinese delivery, Big Lantern is pretty much the balls. We havent had anything bad come from there, and most of the dishes are really, really good, even delivered. Prices are very reasonable, too!

Combination wonton soup and curry chicken are particularly awesome.



After further review, the food served in the actual restaurant is also good, perhaps even better! And they have a pretty huge selection of anything you'd want, including dim sum and tea.
author: Dan M.

description:
I stopped eating Chinese food after I discovered how consistently better Thai restaurants tend to be. My brother used to work as a waiter in a Chinese restaurant in Northampton, MA and told me about how they "recruit" their chefs. Basically, they would take the day's pick of immigrants  who somehow got to New York City and sent them to a crash course Chinese American cooking "school". From there, they were sent out around the east coast to cook up familiar greasy spoon standards for round eyes with one day off every month or so, presumably working off some kind of indentured servitude. At any rate, the point is they were not cooks in China, just trying to make an honest buck in the US, and they apparently preferred to make items not on the menu for their own meals. But I digress. 

So Big Lantern, really good. Great Dim Sum, great soups (try the mixed wonton with wonton, shrimps and other real pieces of seafood). Seafood Claypot also really good. There are a couple of beef dishes that are deep fried beyond belief but really tasty. They serve brown rice as an option which I particularly appreciate. Haven't tried the faux chicken. Onion pancakes always a favorite. Nice, healthy food, also open late night. Same owner as Jasmine tea house on Mission. You can line up around the block for an hour after looking 30 minutes for parking to get some really run-of-the-mill food at House of Nan King with your Aunt and Uncle from Montana or get hip and go to Big Lantern. Another plus, the super cranky waiter seems to have realized that I come in often enough that I'm going to remember what an asshole he was to me last time and now greets me like and old pal.
author: Darren K.

description:
This was an ok place. took my fam from out of town here and started to get nervous when after we ordered it seemed like all the chefs and waitresses sat down to eat themselves......it's like "hey, where's my food!?" 

The dim sum was good, i still like when they have the carts and u dont have to wait, what can i say, im impatient when it comes to eating...

& of course typical chinese service....crap. Their tea was all right, but didn't have the fresh tea leaves like i like. I definitely wouldn't have found this place if it wasn't for yelp...only because it was in the middle of a bunch of Mexican Restaurants. 

Don't know if I'd go back. I did like how there was no wait to be seated, that can be a good thing, yet a bad thing tho. 

O, & the food was pretty cheap.
author: Kimberly P.

description:
10:30 Friday night.... I'm hungry for Chinese food. I searched on yelp but most places closed at 10, had low scores or were out the way, that is until I came across the BIG LANTERN!

I picked my BF up from the Bart station and headed over and to my surprise they were next to one of my fave bars Double Dutch.  The ambiance seemed typical of a Chinese food rest., nothing too flashy and overdone. There were people inside who looked liked regulars and it was pretty laid back and relaxing.  Our server wasn't too "people friendly" at all, but I let that slide. I ordered the Calamari appetizer and the Kung Pao Chicken and OMG was it the BEST EVER!

Let me tell you, the Calamari was fried in seasoned tempura batter which made it so damn good that I kept burning my mouth, I didn't want to wait for it to cool down. =0) My BF who claimed he wasn't hungry managed to burn his mouth as well. Then our Kung Pao Chicken came and we scarfed that down as well, I even ate a few of the peppers.  I was more than a little satisfied with the the food at Big Lantern and so was my "not hungry" BF"! He kept saying how glad he was that I found this place.

I would def go back to BL over and over and over again. This is my new fave Chinese restaurant in SF. And I only gave it 4 out 5 stars because of our servers attitude.
author: Eclectic C.

description:
It's convenient that they have free delivery to my place, which is great for days like today when I took a sick day from work and don't feel like cooking. 

The food is pretty standard for a Chinese restaurant. It tastes good enough to eat when you want this kind of food. 

Sadly though, the guy who takes the orders on the phone is EXTREMELY RUDE and has absolutely NO customer service skills. He rushes you on the phone and barks at you to order fast. He has done this to me a couple of times. Today he hung up on me before I could even ask how much the order came to, if they had my address. and how long would it take. When I called back to ask these questions, he was very rude about answering. This guy needs some serious attitude adjustment. I don't care where you're from or what you're used to, you don't talk to customers on the phone that way.
author: Greg W.

description: Yummy veggie food and walking distance to Congregation Sha'ar Zahav! Lovely cool vegetarian fabulousness!
author: Abi W.

description:
if you are vegetarian and hungry, this is where you should go.
meatless sesame chicken is to die for. broccoli and veg is always so fresh and the service is friendly, on point and super helpful! 
whether you are dining in casual, taking it to go, or sitting outside (i often bring my puppy and dine) it really is a fabulous, inexpensive and filling choice! in the heart of the mission....
author: Emily P.

description:
This is my hungover, too lazy to cook, comfort food.  I recommend the Sesame Meatless Chicken.  They are super nice and super fast.  After becoming a regular delivery customer they have started delivering in warp speed.  They say 45 minutes on the phone and 20 minutes later they are knocking at my door.

It's just good!  And they have a plethora of vegetarian options.  I have never loved this city more than the day I realized I could have fake, yummy "meat" delivered at a reasonable price!  Whoever invented delivery is a genius!
author: Allison G.

description:
We live in the Dogpatch area of Potrero Hill, and this has become our go to place for Chinese take-out.  Take-out portions are huge and very tasty.  We particularly like their various "vegetarian meats", but we've also enjoyed many of their other entrees.  Delivery times seemed really long, about an hour, but if you're willing to pick it up yourself, it's often ready to go in 15 or 20 minutes.  The time we had it delivered, the delivery man was very nice, and even ran after me when he discovered some of my bills had stuck together and I had given accidentally given him a truly gigantic tip!

We've also gone there once for dim sum.  They were still vacuuming and getting ready when opening time came around, but they were very nice and let us have a seat and order some tea while they finished up.  The dim sum was also very tasty ... we got mostly the usual dim sum staples (steamed pork buns, shrimp dumplings, sao-mai, etc) and it was perfectly tasty stuff. It was pretty quiet, which made it easy to have a conversation and also very easy for people to come in and get a seat, though it does lack the hustle-and-bustle cart pushing excitement of other dim sum places.

All in all, we really like Big Lantern --- it's a great addition to the area!
author: Michael L.

description:
Dim sum combo!  And mochi!

That was my original review.  Much more to be said!

Anyway, the dim sum combo is really good.  If you get 2 of those, you'll pretty much be full.  Otherwise, other good choices would be the cold noodles (one of the only places in the city that does them) and the Mongolian Beef.

Clean restaurant, fast delivery!
author: David S.

description:
I come here at least 7 times a month.  I first discovered how good their "meatless" general chicken was when I tried a bite of my friends takeout and I had to ask twice if she was SURE it wasn't real chicken, because the texture was just so close.

All but twice I have got the General "meatless" chicken (comes with broccoli) and brown rice.  Every single time I have been impressed with their prompt service and attitude.

I have had them deliver once (which took 45 minutes).  I was being very lazy, as I could have walked 10 minutes down the road and wait 5 minutes to just pick some up.

FYI - it is SUPER cheap because I always try to share my $9.97 plate with my roommate which is more than enough for both of us and makes it a nice $5 per person.
author: Jason F.

description:
Had a holiday brunch for 12 this past Sunday and needed Dim Sum delivered. Didn't want to leave the apt to drive to Clement, especially after a late Saturday night.  

Big Lantern saved the day.  Called at 1:10 pm and food arrived within 45 minutes. Dim sum was decent -- no complaints from the guests. They have a relatively large selection for meat and vegetarian eaters so have to give them props.

Bonus:  If you don't even want to speak to anyone, you can place your order online in advance.

It's not the best dim sum but it's A-OK.
author: Dee Dee N.

description:
Whoop that trick... 
Meatless Tso over brown rice w/ spring rolls, all for under $15 or so. 
Pleasure doing biz...Big ups to Big Lantern... Also u might want to check out the nice Lil walk through the heart of the mission district to get there...
author: og c.

description: When the late night craving for Dim Sum strikes, The Big Lantern is there. Modest prices for lots of higher than expected quality food- definitely a win.
author: Will F.

description: This is my go-to neighborhood Chinese place. I'm a meat-lover and normally not big on tofu, but the "meatless chicken" here is one of my favorite foods in the Mission. You know how some Chinese places serve inconsistent fried chicken, where some of the pieces are nice white meat while others are fatty ligament? Well, with the meatless chicken, every piece is delicious and cooked to perfection. When I'm not having the sesame meatless chicken (which comes with nicely steamed broccoli), I'm having the Mongolian chicken and/or the dim sum, both of which are also great. The service is friendly, fast, and reliable. Whether I'm eating there or just popping in to pick up take-out, the waiters make me feel at home. Make it a regular spot and you won't regret it.
author: Marco L.

description:
I've only had Big Lantern delivered, but it's always been fast and they have never screwed up my order.

The food seems to be hit or miss, but they have never failed me with their shrimp fried rice, veggie lo-mein, general meatless chicken and crab puffs.
author: Kate O.

description:
This place has an incredible number of great vegetarian dishes!  I highly recommend the sesome meatless chicken, as well as the very tasty garlic pea shoots.  The Dim Sum is also very good- all day long- which is a fun treat.  

I've gottent take out here many times- with two dinner entrees you can get a free order or noodles or fried rice.
author: Becky P.

description:
The food is good! 

But OMG could the service be any slower! It takes you TWO hours to finish a meal here! They ALWAYS forget something; ALWAYS get mad at you for asking for the things they have forgotten! ALWAYS running your food to the wrong table!!

One time, after waiting for 2 hours, we got oxtails instead of squid! The table next to us gave us a nasty look because it was their food and they knew it was going to take another 2 hours to get oxtails reordered! We were a party of five with a movie at the Roxie to catch, so we just cancelled our order and ate popcorn! The couple next to us cancelled their order as well.. 

I gave them another try not too long ago and they forgot my steamed rice, and my friend's pot-stickers!  OK... this is how is went. They ran ONE dish, then after 25 minutes (literally) they ran the other. (the rice? Completely forgotten. The noodles? Why after we finished!)

I'm giving them 3 stars because I only intend to use them for delivery! If I were to rate them on sitting in, I'd give them ONE!!
author: Maddy S.

description:
Ordered delivery from here on a Saturday night. The online ordering process was super fast and easy and the delivery guy showed up 20 minutes after we placed our order. That was a relief considering all the complaints on here about their delivery service.

Oh, their website says there is a minimum $18 delivery charge. So keep that in mind when ordering online.

The food portions were huge. We got an entre - sesame chicken and two appetizers - steamed wontons and potstickers. There was more than enough food for two people and we even had left overs for lunch for next day. One of the eaters was a dude.. in case people are wondering about portion perceptions. 

The food itself wasn't that great. The chicken was really greasy as were the appetizers. This would probably be better as a hangover lunch than a sober dinner.  

However since the prices are good and the delivery was easy, I think it's still a good option for when you are just too lazy to cook and/or leave the house and don't have much cash in the bank.
author: A K.

description: I broke up with Jasmine Tea House for Big Lantern because my needs were not being meet by the former. I'm hoping that my relationship with Big Lantern is a long and functional one filled with prompt delivery and lots of sesame meatless chicken.
author: C P.

description:
Ok, I've lived in this town when this area was dirty, run down with homeless, etc.  Oh, wait, it's the same but with outdoor cafe's that have tables that give you a great view of this subject.  Then there is the restaurant "Big Lantern" don't expect to see a Chinese lantern outside the restaurant.  That's what I was looking for.  Now the details: I'd recommend seating in the second section, if you sit in the enclosed patio you take the chance of viewing too many gross people.  So my teen & I sit down, waiter comes over and is attentive but with a dirty apron(please get a clue) change and wash that apron.  He sits us at a nice booth, and of course there is the ubiquitous scent of desinfectant. And some excess dust on the banquetts.  What is it with ethnic restaurants and their favorite aroma, Hexel or Bleach.  The rest of the decor is pretty nice, nice paintings on the wall, peachy/pink tones, etc. Oh, and the bathroom if very clean!

Now the food, pot stickers, ok, nothing fantastic.  Combo wonton soup, is excellent with nice scrimp, chicken, beef, mushrooms, veggies. We liked that.  I also ordered the classic Mongolian Beef, they do a great job with that too, lots of chili's and thin slices of beef and a deep braised vingerettie sauce. Success!  

As we eat, I hear faint female voices and notice that it is coming from the semi-open kitchen.  And sure enough there are women cooking in the kitchen as well as men.  My eyes wander and then I realize that the decor has a feminine touch and so does the food.  Good Chinese food, service, decor and well, the rest can be improved.
author: Susan S.

description: Big Lantern, by far, has the best Chinese food I have ever had.  It pains me not to give them 5 stars, since their food is so amazing, but because they serve meat, the best I can give them is 4 stars.  This is reminiscent of the Chinese food we always had when I was a kid.  They have so many amazing faux meat dishes.  I know many omnivores who were amazed that they were eating soy chicken.  No trip to Big Lantern is complete without the following: Turnip Cakes with Meatless Veggie Chicken, Veggie Fried Rice (hold the egg), Curry Noodles and Sesame Meatless Chicken.  The service is always fast when you dine in.  They also deliver, which is awesome, and the food is usually delivered within 30-45 minutes.
author: Dana P.

description: We get takeout from Big Lantern ALL the time.  I would highly recommend this place ONLY for the 'meatless chicken' options, which are all delicious -- I especially recommend the 5 spice sesame and the kung pao.  Even meat-eaters will like them, promise.  The meat and seafood options are.... not good.  At all.  Also, do NOT get delivery; we live three blocks away but were feeling lazy on a stormy night so we ordered delivery -- our cold, greasy food arrived nearly two hours later.  5 stars for the meatless chicken options but 1 or 2 stars for everything else averages out to 3 stars.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Very big fan of Big Lanter. Have gotten delivery 5 or 6x and have eaten in the restaurant twice.  Both experiences are equally good. The food is exceptionally good and not expensive.

Whenever I order delivery, it comes fast and there has never been an issue getting the order correct. Eating in the restaurant is also a pleasant experience as the waiters are friendly and provide good recommendations.
