Would suggest getting the onion pancakes, AKA scallion pancakes in some restaurants.  They are the best I've ever had.  Mongolian beef is also worth mentioning as it is my favorite entree there.  Dim sum is good too, not best in the world but good.  Meatless chicken is also surprisingly meat like in flavor which is pretty damn cool.  

Highly recommend.
author: anthony c.

description:
As a newly minted vegatarian, my girlfriend (who has been veggie for a couple years) thought there'd be alot of stuff I'd like here. I was a bit skeptical...I don't eat alot of asian food because it tends to be a bit too greasy for me...but I ended up reallly loving it!

We got the sweet-and-sour meatless chicken, and oh my god, it was so good. It really felt like it was a real chicken meal...I've had meatless chicken before but it was nothing like this!

We also got the taro puffs, which didn't win me over, (the girlfriend had mine after I decided the taste wasn't for me), the veggie fried rice, and the big surprise of the evening, the Turnip cakes. She had never had them before, so we asked the waiter his opinon of them. He informed us they had actually won a reader's guide poll in some SF weekly newspaper for best asian resturaunt in the mission just BECAUSE of their turnip cakes. We went with the recommendation and didn't regret it. It comes with I think a peanut sauce (not sure, i didn't use it, put soy sauce on mine instead), but its something I'd definitely recommend.

Service was fast and courteous, we went when it wasn't very busy, probably around 9 or 10, so there wasn't much of a crowd. We got our check very soon, so much so that it almost felt rushed, though they had no problem with us just hanging around for a bit.

I will definitely come back here for the meatless chicken again soon!
author: codename V.

description:
This is my go-to place for good, reasonably Chinese takeout (as opposed to Chinese-American, like Eric's). The staff is also super nice. I think at one point I was eating here like once a week, just for convenience and consistency.

Be sure to try: Crispy Chicken (so good, trust me), Sword-flower Pork (different, and a nice lighter alternative), various noodle dishes, hot and sour soup.
Dim sum dishes are also good and available all day, so you can have some hot char su bao with dinner.
author: Kevin G.

description:
Okay whatever I like this place.
Yes, the service is a little slow. And yes, sometimes it is a little greasy, but hey, what else did you expect?
They have cheap lunch, but I would reccommend getting the vegetarian options or dim sum.
Perhaps I am just a sucker for resturants where you can order a whole bunch of stuff and share, like sushi for example, but the dim sum is pretty damn good considering that this is the Mission. 
Chive dumplings, fucking delicious. 
And they deliver.
author: Sarah M.

description:
I thought it was quite good for a Chinese guy that just came from LA where they have some of the best dim sum.

I got the dim sum combination one night and it filled me up.  The dim sum good, and filling.  The next day, i got orange chicken.  I usually don't like getting orange chicken because rather get something more traditional, but I was quite surprised.  It was sweet and spicy.  I never had orange chicken that was spicy so I thought it was delicious.  The hot & sour soup taste exactly how I expected.

This place is clean, delicious and near everything.
author: Johnny H.

description:
I'm not a fan of their dim sum-
but everything else is awesome... they deliver pretty quickly.

They have tons of veggie options- i'm a meat eater- and I never get meat from them.

The sesame fake chicken is the most glorious thing ever.

I usually rock the delivery here-but the few times I've gone in their portions are INSANELY big. like...huge.
so wear your eating dress when going to this establishment.
author: Biscuit C.

description:
Yay for Big Lantern's Dim Sum.

When I lived in the city, Big Lantern was the go to for great Dim Sum delivery. My favorite steamed pork buns ever. Shrimp dumplings are also fantastic. Now we pick it up when we're passing through at a meal time.
author: Harley B.

description: I love vegan dim sum. I have ordered take out several times in the past and they always arrived with the containers having melted and leaked, due to the food being too hot when plated. I endured it a few times and tonight, upon receiving it again, called to complain. The manager was welcoming of the feedback, offered to refund (and did refund) the dish that leaked and said he would talk to the kitchen staff about using the cardboard cartons in the future, for hot and saucy dishes. Amazing service!
author: Jay F.

description: I'm not a fan of Chinese food but I have to admit that I really like Big Lantern. I've been here three times now and I've enjoyed all the dim sum we tried and the soups are very tasty. The roasted duck is excellent as well. The service was pleasant and quick and I felt that the food is reasonably priced for the quality. If your in the mission and you don't want to spend $100 at one of the trendy places, try this place out for about half the price.
author: Sabrina L.

description: After years of searching for decent Chinese that delivered to Potrero Hill, a friend turned us on to Big Lantern. Now it's our only choice -- our favorites are the kung pao tofu and mu-shu vegetables. Although the little "pancakes" are often stuck together by the time they arrive, we just substitute small flour tortillas, which is what it seems they use anyway.
author: Christine P.

description:
My younger bro and I found this place while we were wandering around the Mission, exhausted and hungry at an unlucky hour:  on a Sunday, after 2 PM but before 5 PM, when a lot of restaurants are closed.

Our waiter was friendly and attentive without being intrusive.  The dim sum was excellent:  great pork shu mai, stuffed eggplant, crabcakes...tasty and fresh.  I will definitely be back, and with friends!
author: Ginger D.

description: I ate in at Big Lantern with a huge group recently (My friend - "Where's Big Lantern?" Me - "Oh, just look for the sign with the GIANT lantern on it.")  It was just as awesome as the takeout that we ordered in Noe Valley.  Out of the entire group, I was the only one who doesn't eat beef or pork, and I ordered the General "Chicken" (the meatless one).  Guess whose dish was the first to get finished?!  Nobody could even believe that they weren't eating animals!  I love it!
author: Sara C.

description: i love their garlic noodles and their huge selection of meat subsitutions, even though i do eat meat.
author: Rosalee C.

description: It's not the best Chinese food out there, but it might be the best delivery Chinese food out there. A ton of choices on the menu, quick delivery, and free Chow Mein with $25 purchase. You really do get a ton of food for the price and it's not crap. We've been routinely disappointed by other delivery places in the past, but we are locked in to BL.
author: Byrne B.

description:
I love that I can get excellent, flavorful Chinese without heading down to Chinatown. Their dim sum is excellent, they have a zillion fake meat dishes, and they are the NICEST people ever, seriously.

Like the previous reviewer, I cannot get things from Big Lantern out of my head, particularly their Hong Kong Style Pan-fried Noodle. Excellent. If you split a big dish like this, you can be full for only $8-ish. You can have a freakin' banquet for $20 each, if you want to go crazy.  Love it, love them.
author: Esme S.

description:
This place was not yummy.  

The Setting
Sunday, early evening, order for delivery.  Big Lantern made it off to a good start.  Delivery was lightening fast, and food smelled delicious.

The Order
Honey Pecan Prawns: Appalling.  Too much batter.  Too much grease.  Situation made worse by a maraschino cherry being inexplicably placed on top.  WHY?      

Shrimp Toast: Utterly disappointing.  This is one of my very favorite things that I only come across every few years.  It had lovely presentation, but was, again, drenched in grease.  And I know with shrimp toast that's to be somewhat expected.  But this was above and beyond what could be considered a reasonable amount.  I survived one bite.  

Basil Chicken: Unremarkable, but decent, flavor.  A bit too salty.  Meat was gristly and of poor quality.  

Lo Mein:  The noodles were rather tasty, however this also suffered from grease overload.  Overall, it was the most edible dish in the lot, but still not good enough to redeem the rest of the meal.

End Result
A wholly regrettable, $40, queasy tum-tum experience.
author: Audra R.

description: I recommend asking for extra plum sauce and pancakes if you get something mooshu like.
author: Michael S.

description: Good food, HORRIBLE SERVICE! I will never attempt to order from these people again; every time I call, they hang up on me. I actually had an argument last night with the man on the other end of the line because he thought I wasn't ordering Chow Mein right. Oh, okay. They also apparently don't understand that people can have different area codes than 415 and still live in San Francisco. I'm a college student and I have a cell phone. Go figure. Anyways, these people need to pull the stick out of their ass and learn how to act appropriately when on the phone; it's NOT okay to hang up on potential customers and chew them out about ordering Chow Mein wrong.
author: Tanis H.

description: Awesome vegetarian chicken - love it, love it, love it. They could lighten up on the sauce, but overall it was one of the best meatless meats I've ever had. Having eaten all kinds of fake meat in the past, this place definitely stands out!
author: Vivian W.

description: I remember this place being a little better, but last time I had been schluggin champagne all day so I probably wasn't the best critic. My food on the second visit was a tad on the salty side and the fake chicken tasted so real it was a little creepy. But all in all, pretty yummy. Menu is packed full, so full it's maybe a bit overwhelming? But I do like choices. The dough of the veggie dumpling was a little too dense for my liking, but the sweet rice 'n meatless chicken bun made up for it. Also, the onion pancakes are awesome - great peanut butter schlopp for dipping.
author: Brittany L.

description:
We went to Big Lantern last night and had a negative experience.

We've eaten there and had take out many times and been happy with it. I am afraid their quality is slipping.

Here's the rundown.
1) The msg in the food made my tongue swell
2) The Soju Cosmo tasted like Pine Sol and had an olive in it
3) The waiter got the order wrong because he wanted to use the same menu for the people walking through the door while we were ordering. This resulted in only one entree arriving at our table.

I figured this was a once off and tried to email the staff at BL and the email address no longer works. I don't know if there are new owners or manager or what. It wasn't good, we won't be back.

We won't be back.
author: Sean K.

description:
I was hanging out with my friends and we were looking for some vegan-friendly places to eat at night.  We came here because they heard it served vegan dim sum.

They stopped serving dimsum by the time we got there, so we ordered some veggie dishes: the 5-spice chicken, mango chicken, and basil chicken.

I think all the dishes were great.  I normally don't like fake meats but I love Chinese food.  The staff was very nice too because we got there 15 minutes before closing but they stayed open just to serve us.  I made sure to tip them really good.
author: Jolene L.

description: Decent cheap chinese. The honey walnut prawns were pretty good!
author: Ben E.

description: Pretty good. You can order online and the egg rolls and dumplings in chili sauce are like crack.
author: Luke M.

description:
dear big lantern,
thank you for being open on christmas!
...and thank you for the orange lamb!!!
...and the rice tea!
...and the friendly waitress with good recommendations
...and the clean tables with super cool plates
...and the lighting that makes everyone look good
but most of all thank you for letting me and my friends have an impromptu x-mas dinner for as long as we wanted without being pushed out the door while you provided great service and yummy food at good prices!
you have been half a block away from my house for years and i have never tried you until now. ITS A CHRISTMAS MIRACLE! hehehe ;]
love, 
bad-ass chick!
ps. one star down for my burping a lot the rest of the night. i know, i know, maybe it was my fault for stuffing myself with a ton of orange lamb but maybe it was the big plastic, light-up santa that pinched my ass on the way out the door. just sayin'...
author: Bad Ass Chic K.

description: I lived in north China and this place sells the most authentic Chinese food I have ever found in the U.S. If that's not enough for you, their vegetarian dishes are great, especially meatless general's chicken. Definitely worth it.
author: jack j.

description: Favorite chinese food in the city. Specifically, the Sesame Beef. Nobody else makes it like they do. Sometimes, its all I order, with a side of white rice. I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE it!!!!
author: Sergei A.

description:
After freezing my ass off and that of my wee little chihuahua at Cootz's fabulous photo shoot in Dolores Park, I was in need of sustenance and I really didn't care what it was.  
My bestest girlie Natalie N. lives near this place so I figured, since I was meeting her later, I should stick close by for convenience.
I'm also not flush with cash these days so I didn't want to spend much money.
Basically I was looking for that holy trinity of cheap, tasty and conveniently located.
I also needed a place that wasn't going to notice my dog in his bag.  Cuz I violate health codes like that.  Sue me.  I'm broke, moving and you will get NOTHING!!!
Ahem.  Back to my review.
I was tempted by the dim sum but I didn't want to be an asshole and order a bunch of little things (since I was the only person there) that might require a lot of prep work and take too long.  I have some vestiges of Catholic guilt that surface occasionally when I'm hungry and vulnerable.  So I perused the chef's specialties and settled almost immediately on the szechuan style curry lamb, a small hot and sour soup, brown rice for one and a pot of jasmine tea.
I know, I know.  LAMB?!  It was weird to encounter this in a Chinese restaurant but I AM a round-eye so that automatically makes me ignorant of whether this was strange or not.  It just sounded good.
The hot and sour soup was "Meh".
Jasmine tea was GREAT with real herbs and none of that tea bag bullshit.
The szechuan curry lamb was actually quite good.  Thinly sliced and tender lamb in a sauce that was part curry and part something else that was really a good blend.  Over the brown rice it was really filling.
With tip it all came to $20.  A little more than I wanted to spend but whatever.
Best of all they didn't notice my furry little hazmat violation in his bag next to me in the booth.
Loss of stars for slow service and for being a little pricier than what I think it's worth.  It's still decent enough Chinese for the area and I'd like to try the dim sum at some point.
Without my dog.
author: Jill D.

description: I decided to try it since it's so random that a dim sum place just popped up in the middle of 16th street and I was pleasantly surprised. The dim sum here is better than some places that I've been to in Chinatown. I had the prawn rice noodle roll, it was quite good - although possibly a bit undercooked. One weird thing though, they added lettuce, which isn't usually found in this dish but maybe they were trying to go for something different. It wasn't bad, but it was different.  I also had the pork siu mai which were quite good and the best part was the Egg Custard tarts I had last. They had this smell of maybe a little bit of coconut - kind of exotic, I liked it. The crust was thin and flaky and the center was really yummy. AHH! so good, I wish I got more than 3.
author: Mitzi Y.

description:
Ok, first off, I was a waitress for a long ass time. I generally tip 25% no matter what the service is. I have so, SO much empathy for those working in the food service industry.

That being said, oh my god, I had the worst experience ever with the service here. I left bubbling over with rage, which, considering that I work with middle schoolers all day, is a point hard for me to approach. 

Last Thursday evening I was on my way to Movies in Dolores Park with a friend, I'd never been in here before, but since it was between my house and the park, and chinese sounded wonderful, we thought we'd stop. It was about half full, but there were a TON of people in the back running around. We waited at the counter for ten minutes before someone took our order, who avoided eye contact and pretended not to hear us when we asked, about five minutes in, if we could order. Before (finally) placing it I asked how long a take out order would be, he told me 10-15 minutes, not long at all. So, great, we placed our orders (only three entrees and one appetizer, not a ton) and sat down at a table to wait. Twenty minutes later the waiter asked us to move to a different table so he could seat a party there, we moved and another twenty minutes passed, then we were (quite rudely) told to get up, he had another table to seat. At this point we went up to the counter and asked when our order would be ready. Annnnd, even though I tried to flag the host down several times, were totally ignored. Ten minutes later (we're up to 50 min. since ordering at this point) I get my food. When my friend asks if hers is ready the host looks confused, then runs back to the kitchen. GREAT. After another ten minutes my friend walks over and asks for her money back, and says that she'll leave the food. He refuses to refund her money and five minutes later brings her bag over. 

Grand total of time it took to get carry out: One hour and ten minutes.

FAIL!
author: Gabrielle A.

description: Not so cheap, lousy, food. The food bordered on disgusting - I got the ostrich with scallops, which was greasy, and not really prepared all that well. I would recommend ordering a lot of alcohol if you need to eat here. It is fortunate that this place is located right in the middle of some of the best restaurants in San Francisco - hopefully they will manage to put it out of business soon.
author: Dana L.

description: legi.t One of those places that doesnt do a ton of veggies and a little meat.  Fast delivery just make sure u have ur card on you if u pay credit cuz u wont be able to shake these guys. Walnut Prawns, Sweet and sour pork, sesame beef crab puffs and chow mein all top notch. Dim sum aint bad either
author: Joshua D.

description: Yet another Chinese food restaurant in the Mission that offers a few meatless dishes for veggies.  The sesame 'chicken' rivals that of Jasmine Tea House.  Portions are generous, with a nice presentation of dishes.  Dim sum is available as well; the taro puff was very good.  In addition to dinner, they offer lunch specials.
author: Marsha Z.

description: Excellent cheap-ish Chinese food. More expensive than the late, lamented Yum Yum house, but, on the other hand, bigger portions. And they've got dim sum, too. It's a very friendly place if you are vegetarian, too! Try any of the vegetarian chicken dishes.
author: Basketball J.

description: As a white kid from Wisconsin, the only Chinese I knew about was "zang" from Wayne's World and really bad take out food. So I was excited to try this place and see what real dim sum tastes like. I was super impressed and loved the authentic cuisine. All the dumplings, Shanghai soupy pork dumplings and pork buns were fantastic and fresh. The restaurant itself was clean and brand new with really nice decor. It was a great way to spend a Sunday afternoon lunchtime. And it didn't hurt that my date happened to be Chinese to help me learn ;) I'm excited that this place is new to my neighborhood.
author: Michael E.

description: people are nice and pretty good looking menu, but they use msg and everything ive had, has come out super sauced.  id stick to yuet lee, gogo cafe or emmy's any day.
author: Kimby T.

description: Very tasty and one of the few Chinese restaurants that delivers to South Beach.  Love the garlic scallops although I don't know why they're called garlic scallops because they don't taste garlicky to me.  Not a criticism, just an observation.  Today they messed up my order and accidentally gave me crab rangoon.  A lucky mistake for me because it's the best crab rangoon I've ever had.
author: Leigh F.

description: Maybe it is better to eat in, the delivery order arrived barely lukewarm, incorrect, and just, well, overall disappointing. I'm not sure how anyone finds this to be great Chinese food - bland, greasy, ugh. I hope it was just a bad day, because oi, it was so bad most of the meal was wasted.
author: Ben K.

description:
Easilly the best Chinese delivery I've had in San Francisco. Last night, Joe and I neither wanted to cook nor go out. But we didn't want shit delivery either. To quote Joe, "I've just been burned so many times before. I don't know if I trust those delivery bastards."
So true. 
But we settled on Big Lantern, because they seemed to have a classy website and we'd both had separate but positive dining experiences there. 
We ordered the baked pork buns, pot stickers, curry puffs, Mongolian beef, sesame chicken and Hong Kong noodles. 
It took the usual 45 minutes to an hour, but dear god, this is so much better than anything I've had delivered. The curry puffs were my favorite, but I'm a whore for curry. Everything was fresh and big and pretty goddamn good for being driven around the Mission. 
Tommy Toy's it ain't, but for relatively inexpensive delivery, it's our new standard.
PS to the hippies: The boxes are biodegradable, so I felt like I was being all green and responsible...
author: Beth S.

description: A good delivery place for a rainy Monday.  My favorite pho place was closed and I wasn't *about* to go out in the rain to fetch something.  So, I yelped delivery near me and found this place.  I had the crab cheese puffs, egg flower soup & garlic eggplant.  The crab cheese puffs were EH, not bad but not great.  The soup was yummy and the eggplant was really good.  The portion of eggplant was HUGE.  They were pretty quick on delivering as well, esp. considering it was a cold, yucky, rainy night.
author: Emily T.

description: Decent Chinese food for a great price and really sweet people running the place. Ordered for delivery at my friend's house in the dog patch when most places were already closed. Gotta love that!
author: Donna V.

description:
Wow. Could the reviews for this place be more all over the board?
Checked this out last night as we ended up at 16th and Valencia and didn't want Mexican.
We started with the combination dim sum. Very fresh ( I know because it took FOREVER to get to the table) and very good. The shrimp dumplings were the highlight. For dinner we sampled the Big Lantern Smoked Pork (full of green onions and leeks - very good, but a little salty) the Honey Pecan Prawns (I liked that the pecans had an earthier flavor than the walnuts that this dish is usually made with - oh and it was a little salty) and the Beef Stew (this was basically braised beef over sauteed spinach - the spinach was killer, the best thing we had. The beef however had good flavor but was extremely chewy. "What cut of meat is this? I don't think I want to know." Oh, yeah, and the salty thing.) Ended the meal with some sesame balls. Once again they cooked them when ordered, so they took awhile, but were hot and Delicious when they came.
The moral of the story is: Not the best Chinese food in SF by far, but if you are in the neighborhood, worth checking out. Oh, and ask them to hold the salt.
author: Jamie M.

description: Holy crackers I eat this place at least once a week.  Never have I had the pleasure to witness first hand such a fine establishment.  First off, it's budget, they deliver, the portions could feed a small family and they offer... wait for it... mock-meats!?  How my vegetarian taste buds dance in delight.
author: Andy B.

description:
We are always on the lookout for quality chinese food delivery in the Church/Mission/Duboce triangle areas, and were dissapointed by Big Lantern.  Since Hunan Garden is closed on Saturday, we gave these jokers a try.   The minimum standard for good chinese delivery is speed of delivery and convenience.

First, the delivery took about 40 minutes, as promised.  After getting spoiled by the fact that Hunan Garden always takes no more than 20 minutes despite always warning 40, this was a small disappointment.  Second, the food was terribly packaged!  Only the rice came in the traditional chinese food delivery container box, while the mu shu chicken, orange chicken, and sesame beef came in squarish styrofoam containers.  Thus, almost half the sauces and juices in those three dishes had already spilled out of the styrofoam-box-thingy by the time it came to us, soaking both the bag and making all the containers in the bag super-sloppy and wet.   These guys seriously need to invest in the fold-top doggy bags.

The mu shu chicken was the best item....they give you a ton, and although the mu shu pancakes were thin, delicate, and non-tortilla-like (which is a good thing), they proved strong and resilient against the common problem of mu shu-rupture...they easily withstood the pressures of plum sauce and over-stuffing the pancake.  Both the orange chicken and sesame beef were sitting on top of very thin and liquidy sauces.  The orange chicken was solid, with lean meaty portions of chicken. The problem was that each piece barely had any sauce on it or soaked into it, because the sauce had (sadly) already departed the flimsy container it came in.   The sesame beef had an odd sour taste with some undercooked broccollinis at all four corners.  Since most of the sesame beef sauce had already spilled out and was all over the place, it really put a damper on the festivities.     The whole point of delivery is to have a delicious, convenient pre-made meal delivered to your door, ready to eat.  The spectacular mess brought to us by Big Lantern failed on all those counts.
author: Dan L.

description: I'm surprised to read mediocre reviews of this restaurant. I honestly think it's the best Chinese food in the city. The food tastes fresh, the vegetables are still crisp and perfectly cooked, the Orange Chicken is just plain yummy-- the perfect balance of spicy and sweet, and the service comes with a smile. Thanks to Yelp, I just found out that they deliver. My life is now complete.
author: Shira Z.

description:
This place is awesome... especially if you're vegetarian or vegan. I just wish they'd get more business, because I want them to stay around!

I can't speak to the meat dishes, but the veggie dishes are excellent: Kung Pao Meatless Chicken, General Tsao's Meatless Chicken, Vegetarian Fried Rice (with or without egg), Veggie egg rolls, Veggie chow mein.

The food is hot and delicious, and the people who run the restaurant are super nice.

Normally we get it delivered and though they say it will take 45 minutes, it usually gets here amazingly fast... in like 10 minutes.
author: Keith B.

description: We ended up here when the wait for Tokyo Go Go was too long. I think I was thrown off as the dim sum is served straight from the kitchen and not on the carts I'm used to. It was still tasty and I'll definitely try again. My recommendation is the Wor Wonton soup. They top it off with slices of beef, chicken and shrimp. A meal by itself and I ordered a small portion.
author: Sig N.

description: Great price, mild atmosphere, slow service, open late. General Tsou's Chicken was good, chicken fried rice was a little smokey tasting (burned), luckily not enough to care or send back (almost added to the dish... almost...).
author: Jean P.

description: I recently ordered vegan delivery that was not vegan. i am generally easy going, but when i called to question them, they insisted the mushroom papaya soup was vegetarian. it definitely had chicken broth....6 meat eaters smelled it, tasted it, and confirmed it was definitely chicken broth based veggie soup. gross. they would not return my money or repair my order. terrible news. Luckily , i had a special tasting squad on hand and avoided sudden death. i would not order from here again, they did not listen to me or really investigate...the phone guy would not speak to the chef.....this is my first, and probably only, thumbs down review ....in this city, that kind of brush off is inexcusable.
author: christie m.

description: They've been closed the past couple weeks for 'remodeling.' Hope it's true and they reopen soon. Very consistant and delectable, if not the most authentic. Love the General chicken, though only the veggie version seems to be on the menu so ask for it. it comes with broccoli on the side which is a nice touch. One of the few places I've found cold sesame noodles which I LOVE. Awesome fried string beans,  pepper beef hot pot etc. Only bad dish was a fake chicken thing that was so bland we only had a couple bites.
author: Josh B.

description: We ordered delivery on a Sunday night.  They said it would take 45 minutes, but they showed up in 20.  The sesame 5 spice veggie chicken was amazing (and I usually don't like those poor, gluten-y  excuses for meat), the mango chicken was good and the lo mein was pretty good.  I'll definitely order from Big Lantern again if the mood for Chinese strikes me again.
author: Jen H.

description:
so i was a complete jerk and placed an order for many vegetarian dim sum items and fake sesame chicken at 10:30pm.  i know i shouldn't place orders that late as those nice people working there probably want to go home and sleep.  

despite my ordering faux pas, they still brought me super yummy and delicious food.  i love their turnip cake and that their taro puffs are vegetarian.  my meat eating  friend even agreed that the fake sesame chicken was pretty good. 

i've been there in person a few times too.  never disappointed.  i think my favorite time was when the large pasty man was trying to speak chinese to the waitress.  perhaps in an attempt to impress his also large and pasty family, but i found his inability to even say xiexie (thank you) correctly amusing and worth much whispering to my boy.    

but this place is awesome. go there and eat.
author: amanda d.

description:
The food actually tasted pretty decent up until I found a small piece of glass in it!!

I thought I accidentally started chewing a piece of rock from the clams or something, but nope.  I spat it out and it was glass. WTF!! Glass!! These guys trying to kill me or something?? 

In either case, that shit was dangerous, I'll give them two stars for tasting decent, but that's it.  Don't go here if you care about your life!! BTW, I don't know if I actually swallowed some of the pieces of glass, hopefully not!!
author: Prince B.

description: I would give this place a better rating if the service wasn't so awful. Food's great, but without fail, every single time we visit the restaurant or order-in the staff is very rude. They snap at you while you order if they can't hear you, never say thank you, and always leave you feeling bad about yourself. I don't recommend this place anymore.
author: Irene N.

description: LOVE THE MEATLESS GENERAL CHICKEN!!! i think this place is by far the best place for meatless chinese cuisine in san francisco! i make HUGE orders and eat the food for like 3 days. once when i went in to eat, my phone was dying and i happened to have my charger. they plugged it in behind the counter for me! super nice people with great food!!!
author: Katy N.

description: There are plenty of great vegetarian Chinese food places in the city (see Golden Era) that I prefer. But every vegetarian has a carnivore friend that refuses to go. Bring them here. It's the best of both worlds. Sesame meatless chicken is my recommendation
author: Scott L.

description: Great dimsum and great price. I highly recommend the turnip cakes and the spinach soup. And surprisingly, they have the nicest and cleanest bathroom compared to most Chinese restaurants.
author: joan l.

description: The first time I came to this place I thought it was cool. Great food and very cool location...Second time on the other hand, the waiter was kinda rude...so I let it slide thinking maybe he had a bad day or so...Third time, he got mad when I had asked for a lemon on the side to eat with my shomai. He asked what will I do with the lemon??? and he walked away really mad... People just don't understand we have different ways of eating and I eat my Shomai with LEMON juice and soy sauce!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Pamela ..

description: Amazing vegetarian options, the lemon "chicken" is amazing as is everything else I've tried (which is a lot, this girl has needs.) Super quick takeout and they're all really nice - meaning nobody rolls their eyes when I make air quotes while ordering "chicken" dishes.
author: Nakh A.

description: In a word:  disgusting.  After admitting to ourselves that we were NOT going to cook and instead order in, I decided to take a chance on Big Lantern, which I'd discovered through a menu hanging on the outside of my building's door.  We ordered a variety of the standard dishes:  Mu Shu Pork (the pancakes reminded me of the cold rubbery versions I would eat on backpacking trips, stuffed into a tupperware container and consumed along the trail hours after cooking them), Garlic Chicken and Eggplant (tasted like glue), and the garlic spinach (goopy green thread).  I think we ordered some other things but for the sake of my mental health, I have blocked them out.
author: Katie C.

description:
this review is only based on delivery orders.  and also only based on the 2 dishes we get every time.

1.  sesame meatless chicken (or general meatless chicken)
2.  garlic eggplant.

yeah, the food's a little greasy but everyone needs a little grease every once in a while.  exercises the heart.

they deliver, it's free, and their delivery time is quick.
author: cynthia q.

description: 1 hour and twenty minutes delivery for greasy chinese food and a rude staff. Never again.
author: Erin H.

description: Only had takeout. My friend and I seem to have a staple of oinion pancake, hot'n'sour soup and vegi chow mein. It is always really good and delivery doesnt take that long. When you ask for extra spicy that is how it comes
author: Carli M.

description: Pretty over priced for this grade of a chinese restaurant.  The prices would demand the quality of like Ton Kiang or something.  I tried quite a few things here on my first visit from dim sums to a couple of dishes.  The dim sum was ordinary and oily and the seafood dish I had tasted like a smell I noticed in a store that  I've been to.  I would pass on this place.
author: Jason A.

description:
Big Lantern, BIG surprise...in a good way.

I've had my share of icky Chinese food in creepy locations. When I walked into Big Lantern I did a slight internal "uh oh" just because the interior isn't necessarily the fanciest. But don't judge delicious Chinese food by its cover, apparently!

For real, the food was pretty exceptional. I got the basil chicken, which is super moist and packs a surprisingly punchy flavor. I also tried the garlic eggplant, which was SO GOOD and served in a heaping portion. My friend got the green beans, an idea that scared me at first (too many traumatic mushy-green-bean-in-Chinese-food experiences, I guess) but the beans came out tender and just crunchy enough. The spicy pork noodles were pretty good, but I wouldn't call them the star of the meal. Regardless, the menu is super extensive with about a zillion vegetarian choices, and all under 9 or 10 bucks. Service was good too--the waiter was a young guy who was totally attentive and sweet. 

I've never tried Big Lantern for delivery, but trust me I will definitely be calling them up next time I get a Chinese food craving. Can't wait to try something new on their menu. 

So...Wild Pepper? It's over between us. Big Lantern? Welcome to speed dial.
author: J P.

description: I would give this place 4 stars except for the fact that we went in there with a restaurant.com coupon and they said that they didn't accept it.  How is this possible? Good food with great flavors though.  Try the braised tofu with bok choy.
author: Darren I.

description:
I've really loved Big Lantern in the past, although the West Lake Beef Soup tonight was a little blech- it could have used more salt. When I ordered it during the day it had fresh spinach in it.

BL is great for groups or just dining alone. I think they charge a bit much for a bowl of white rice- anything over $1 seems excessive to me. 

The broccoli beef is fresh and delicious. I've had both the meatless chicken and the real chicken at the same dinner and both vegetarian and meat eaters agreed the veg chicken was better. !  

Had the sesame chicken tonight- smelled awfully vinegary.

The pea shoots were fresh and tender.

Service is all right to pretty good- sometimes you have to wait a while to get one of the two waiters' attention.

Open late -til 10, at least, which can be a lifesaver.

*Adding 1 star for the freshly fried sesame ball dessert. The best I ever had! Crispy on the outside, tender on the inside.
author: KD D.

description: I should've been tipped off by the complete lack of Chinese (or any other Asians, for that matter) people eating here. Cheap, open late-ish, and they deliver... but the food is quite bland. Tried the onion pancake, garlic spinach, seafood noodles, and a couple of other "dim sum" items. Disappointing.
author: Maximillian M.

description: fast delivery. great options if you are veg. mediocre food in general including undercooked siu mai and very dry, bland curry puff. the crab rangoon was actually hard to eat, the wrapping was so tough. but flavors are yummy for a late night craving.
author: melodie y.

description: Just so good. Ahhhhh. Vegetarian delightfulness thats cheap and freaking amazing. General Tso's meatless chicken, the dumplings, everything?! so good. It's cheap, relatively fast service, and awesomely large proportions. Just go. Oh and if you're a vegetarian, be ready to put another hole in your belt, because you'll eat it all!
author: Shaina P.

description: I get delivery from this place like once a week.  Though I'm white, I have high standards for Chinese food because I grew up in the Sunset.  And by high standards I mean that I only like the more ghetto places.  Their hot n sour soup is fucking awesome and they deliver promptly.
author: angela k.

description: I'm vegetarian, and this place has some of the most DELICIOUS vegetarian options that I have found in this city. I'm relatively new, though, so I might find one better in the near future.  But for now, this place is delicious!  I love their no-chicken moo shu and their no-chicken General Tsao's as well.  Plus they have great tea, good veg. appetizers, and the service is really friendly!  I always feel at home there.
author: Kyle T.

description: I've been ordering take out from here for the last 2 years. Why? I have no idea. The service sucks.  I had them send me a free fried rice, but was charged for it b/c lack of communication.  They are expensive and greasy as shit.  The dim sum is alright. But their are plenty more places in the city that are better.  This is the third time they ripped me off. There menu is goin in the trash for good. See ya!
author: K B.

description: I was really pleased with both the food and the service at Big Lantern. I went here with a group for a birthday dinner, and had the sweet and sour soup, vegetarian taro steamed bun, shrimp dumplings, garlic eggplant, and the five spices meatless chicken. Everything was really tasty, especially the five spices fake chicken. I love the rare Chinese restaurant that isn't too oily and has a variety and depth of flavors, as Big Lantern manages to do with its food. Plus, everything was prepared and presented with efficient service, and the atmosphere and semi-open kitchen were nice touches. Great options for vegetarians, and highly recommended overall.
author: Jill H.

description: Big lantern rocks, you just need to know what to compare it to. Big Lantern is not an authentic Chinese Dim Sum place, it's a hole-in-the-wall Chinese delivery place. That has amazing vegetarian food and quite passable dim sum. Try the chive dumplings- they're amazing.
author: Nicole J.

description: Not what I ordered and NOT VEGETARIAN!! Rainy night, I drop in to pick up some mixed vegetables, walk home with it, open it up and it's full of pork! I have to walk back in the rain, convince them I didn't order pork and wait for them to do it right. I'm hungry, sopping wet and certain I will never go there again.
author: David C.

description: I ordered Mu Shu Pork at Big Lantern tonight and it smelled like FORMALDEHYDE. I did some research and found that there have been cases of formaldehyde tainted food imported from China. It's a toxin linked to stomach erosions and cancer, so I won't be eating here any more.
author: Lisa P.

description: Great Meat and Meatless dishes for all to enjoy.  Pleasant atmosphere and great staff.   Wins hands down for best Chinese meal in the Mission.
author: zachary m.

description:
i. love. big. lantern. im a vegetarian and they have delicious meatless chicken dishes (i recommend the meatless generals chicken!). 

the first time i had it, my friends had it delivered and i loved it! a few weeks later we went down to the actual restaurant in mission... great place. i've never had to wait for a table, the service is great- they don't make mistakes- and although the staff isn't super friendly (talkative) i think they're just quiet and their awesome service totally makes up for it. 
the restaurant itself is very nice... nice ambience and a cool fountain in front with fish in it (cool!). the tables are clean and big and they accommodate groups really well. 

this restaurant is perfect for people who are vegetarians or not vegetarians- there's something for everyone! i would tell anyone to go here!
author: Amelia R.

description: Delicious turnip cakes, and a wide variety of vegetarian options make Big Lantern my good to place whenever I get the cravings for Chinese food. This is the best Chinese food in the Mission.
author: nathan c.

description:
this is place is awesome. super fresh and yummy. my biggest beef about chinese restaurants is that it's oily and the tendency to over garlic and over-cook everything. and these guys definitely don't do that, the veggies are cooked perfect with a snap to them.

and they even serve dim sum all day and it's actually good and fresh! definitely one of my fav chinese restaurants. and it's hard to impress me on chinese food, since i ate chinese food practically everyday growing up that i can barely eat any more chinese food!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I had a terrible experience here: I am a vegetarian and ordered a meatless dish for pick up.  When I got home, I realized they made it with real chicken.  I've eaten here before and know exactly what the fake meat looks like: little cubes.  This was real, stringy chicken!

When I called them and asked to have it replaced, they refused and just made excuses.  Basically, I was left with a dish that I could not eat and had paid for: terrible service!
author: Erin O.

description: We foolishly chose to drive here. My apologies to the frightened pedestrians who thought I wasn't going to take that U turn. The food was ok. The ingredients were pretty fresh, but the flavor wasn't great. I saw no dim sum on the menu, but we were being rushed to order, so maybe it was there. Some people at another table had a spicy tofu dish that looked yummy, I should have asked for a bite...oh yea, pretty decor.
author: Rachel B.

description: Best Chinese food I have found in the city yet. I am staying in the mission for a few weeks and after reading the reviews on here had to see how their delivery is since I have only ordered carry out or eat in prior. My food arrived by foot within 30 minutes of the order..no spillage and the entree was packed just like it had left the restaurant. Great food, great price
author: bryan o.

description: I'm chinese and I think this place is top-notch! (So do my parents.)  Totally fresh and tasty. Same owners as Yum Yum House, but the decor is much nicer...  A full menu of non-dim sum dishes too.  My dad said the turnip cakes (dim sum) were the best he'd had in his life!  whoah, if they can make turnips taste kick-ass, I think they can do anything.  And they stay open til midnight Thurs-Sat..maybe even later?  yum!
author: Melanie C.

description: The best take-out American-Chinese I have had in a long time.  I ordered the General Tso's Meatless Chicken for delivery and was thoroughly impressed.  It was very crispy and definitely reminded me of chicken, or at least, what my last memory of take-out chicken was.  Not too greasy either!  My order came very fast and was well packaged.  My only complaint is that the dishes do not come with rice unless you purchase two or more entrees (but then you get free fried rice!)  But, I definitely will be ordering again very soon.
author: Eric H.

description: I've only had delivery from Big Lantern, so this review reflects that.  This review also reflects my only-veggie-dishness.  One star for fast delivery (arrived long before they said they would!), another star for lots of veggie options, another for having brown rice, and one more being really nice on the phone and in person :)
author: Lisa A.

description: This is the only dim sum place w/o MSG that I can find, and it's GOOD. The food is fresh. We got in as a party of 6, no wait, on Fri night at 8:30. The prices are super reasonable too. I eat meat and ate the meatless dishes, just because they were fresh and taste good. Try Chive dumpling with meatless chicken. They are know for the Turnip cake. The hot noodle soup was HOT. The fresh mango dessert was not made with fresh mangos, but you can't have everything. The late hours are a plus.
author: Cate G.

description: If you can get past the half-assed decor (a couple of paper lanterns and a possibly-not-ironic portrait of Chairman Mao) and the disinterested service, some excellently prepared (albeit very basic) dim sum awaits you. Dim sum is ordered from menus, not carts at Big Lantern, so if you want the full chaotic yumcha experience, you'll have to go to Chinatown (or better yet, Koi Palace in Daly City). But if your Sunday hangover isn't trying to hear about another omelette at the Pork Store, pull up a chair and har gow your way back to lucidity.
author: Eric G.

description: I'm a dim sum addict and have pretty string opinions about it. i tried this place because of the generally positive yelp reviews and because it's near my hood. ihave to say, i was VERY impressed. it isn't koi palace, but almost everything was close to as good for less money and NO wait. only shortcoming was shanghai baby buns --- not nearly "soupy" enough, and wrappers too thick. Still, this place is a find.
author: Erica W.

description: I was heartbroken when I found out that Yum Yum had closed, but happy to find out that Big Lantern had been taken over by the Yum Yum crew.  Excellent General Tso's Meatless Chicken, excellent fried rice, very good chow mein, and I'm thinking of making about five orders of "crab" and cheese puffs my whole dinner some night.  The only thing I could possibly complain about was that the dim sum was just so-so.
author: Jude F.

description:
Take it from a Chinese guy with an ACTUAL Chinese name (Yes, I'm talkin' about you, 'erik e')

I ordered the mushu chicken and HK style pan fried noodle (chicken). Delivery was prompt. 

Dishes were OK although for the money, the portions were large and satisfying.
author: yang t.

description:
The Mission's nooks and crannies are crammed full of ethnic eateries and delicious cheap eats but strangely, they have a rare number of Chinese eateries and often they are not cheap. Still, what's a girl to do when she has an immediate and necessary Chinese food craving to attend to??
Enter Big Lantern. Reasonably priced, especially for Mission Chinese food, and reasonably tasty.
I've gotten take out from here a few times, and have yet to have eaten here, but so far the round of dishes have been okay--not sub-par, but not amazing, just good enough to pass the craving test. My favorite so far is the Singapore Rice Noodles, a dish that I've easily seen go wrong or simply not exist on other restaurant menus because of its slight difficulty in perfecting fried rice noodles and combing it with all sorts of goodies like chili peppers, curry powder, onions, bell peppers, chicken, chau sau, shrimp and bean sprouts, yum!!!
Well, Big Lantern almost hits the mark but leaves out key ingredients (very little meat, absolutely no chau sau), and the veggies look a little sad... a bit overcooked perhaps. Still, quite tasty and as close to the real thing as I've seen in this district. They do delivery and pick-up and have a plethora of authentic as well as American-style items to try, so another plus for variety.
My Singapore Noodles are $7.95 without tax and, since I never eat there, I never have to bother with tip, so it comes to about $9 for rice noodles. The serving deals out about 2 large portions or 3 small portions, so easy two-days worth of yummy dinners.
For AMAZING Chinese... I wouldn't recommend Big Lantern but for your guilty pleasure cravings, definitely call them up.
author: Jessica L.

description: I love this place. I eat here at least once a week and order delivery as well. Excellent Chinese food with lots of vegan/vegetarian options. The service is great and the ambience is perfect (Spacious, not too dark, not too light, not too loud, not too quiet), Long Live the Lantern.
author: Matt S.

description: I usually shy away from Chinese because its usually of questionable quality and swimming in grease.  Not so at Big Lantern!  While walking by and spying patrons dishes, I noticed that the veggies are brightly colored, indicating freshness, so I thought I'd give it a shot.  On my most recent trip, I spied Mango Chicken on the menu(!) and of course, it was delicious!
author: Kyla B.

description: Food was slow, especially considering we were nearly the only people in the place.  People were very friendly, it just took forever.  They had a good selection of vegetarian food, including "General meatless chicken", which was good.
author: Nelson A.

description: i was really surprised with this place because I like low-key hole in the wall chinese restaurants and was a little nervous that this place might be trendy because of how sassy it looked inside. we picked this place randomly because i just got pierced over at Body Manipulations a block away and needed food (especially my friend who wanted to eat before getting her lip pierced). The menu is extensive and the prices are decent. They had a good vegetarian selection. We all ate family style (kung pao tofu, veggie chow fun, garlic spinach and my other meat eating friend ordered a side of steamed beef balls (meatballs) from the dim sum menu) and had enough leftovers to go. I'd come back here (that is, if I'm not too lazy to haul my ass to the mission!)
author: kristin e.

description: This place has great "meatless chicken."  If you're a vegetarian who likes fake meat, I really recommend the Kung Pao Meatless Chicken.  I get takeout from this place like weekly.  It's cheap, good food.
author: Braden T.

description: My wife and kids and I LOVE it here! We're a veg family, and this place has always been more than accommodating to our veggie needs. The meatless general chicken is awesome! We ask for MSG free too, and they happily oblige. The jasmine tea is great too! The servers are a little unfriendly and sometimes forget about ya'. I just LOVE the food and can't brag enough about it. OHhhh free delivery too. :)
author: Al N.

description: Good Chinese food in the Mission is an oxymoron that proves to be true.  You can eat family style and get plenty full for less than $15 each including tip. We tried meet dishes, seafood dishes, and veggie dishes..all tasty and MSG free. Also, don't be afraid to make a trip to the restroom here.  It is immaculately clean and smells of potpourri.
author: mandy f.

description:
Most of the reviews of this restaurant are by vegetarians, so I thought it would be good to balance this with a review by a devout omnivore.

I've actually never stepped foot in the place - I've only ordered delivery, so this review is limited to that.  I have probably ordered delivery at least 50 times from this place, and always by calling directly - I've never used a third party service (I think third party services take too long).  I, too, am a former Jasmine Tea House fan that converted to Big Lantern.

They've never been egregiously late.  They've always had proper change for me.  The order has always been correct.  I've only ever gotten one dim sum dish that was poorly prepared.  Sometimes the sauces leak a little into the delivery bag, but this is not an uncommon occurrence when you order delivery.

When you find your favorite dishes at this place, they're delicious and consistent.  I cried when they took the shanghai-style rice cake off the menu, but the numbing spicy noodles, flaming chili fish, szechwan chicken, mu shu pork, and spicy string beans happily filled the gap.  No, this place isn't completely mind-blowing, but it's filled a need wonderfully for me for over a year now.  

I don't care if the authenticity police call it Americanized.  Lots of noble cuisines in this world have been created by people moving to a new land and adapting their cuisine to the ingredients and styles of their new home.  To bag on that is to be a hater, straight up.

The only reason it's not getting five stars is because, well, Great Eastern is the best...  Henry's Hunan is in second...
author: Kenois M.

description: This is a great addition to the neighborhood - who doesn't like dim sum for dinner? Really good, fast Chinese food. I love the vegetarian options - you don't get to see those on many Chinese menus. The veggies are fresh and the black bean sauce is excellent. Staff is friendly - they even accomodated a request (in my broken Chinese) that wasn't on the menu.
author: Evelyn G.

description: Oh so cheap...oh so tasty...oh so close to the 'watt!! "Dim Dum" served all day/night!!!
author: Colleen B.

description: I've never dined in, but have gotten my food delivered countless times.  Only once did they mess up.  Usually they are pretty fast, sometimes almost too fast.  Good prices and free noodles or fried rice with two entrees.  Sometimes at night they throw in one more even.  The orange chicken is made with quality meat in thin sauce with orange zest and hot peppers.  Their chow mein and crab cheese puffs are great too.  I haven't tried many dishes knowing those will always be good.  Definitely recommended for delivery.
author: jess l.

description:
big lantern is some of the best chinese food we have had in SF. 
is it because my hubbie orders in cantonese... maybe?

they do tend to go heavy on the salt at times, but at least they use asian veg instead of western (ex: spinach, broccoli, and eggplant). 

lunch specials are of exceptional value too.

it is best when you dine in. delivery seems to over steamed and only deserves 3 stars.
author: SF U.

description: A bunch of us got a whole lot of stuff delivered by Big Lantern and it was all sooooo awesome. With all the entrees and veggies we ordered, nothing was left after dinner except for the recyclable containers the food came in.
author: Storm W.

description: Very tasty (Helllllllllllo Sesame Beef, will you marry me???) and I appreciate the dim sum option, but it was more expensive than my Chinese food boyfriend Ken's Kitchen and delivery took FOREVER.
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
pretty cool place, never crowded, delivers, and certain dishes are really great. outdoor seating in front, really friendly service.

the food can be oily...  ask for "light on the oil" and see what happens.

great fake meat general tso's and taro dim sum
author: Erika Y.

description: I had 15 minutes before I had to report to work and was craving some rice and meatless chicken, so I stopped in here for the first time and was highly impressed. Little apprehensive from the outside, but the interior was decent and inviting. I was seated up front, served my food within 7 minutes (piping hot and looking good) and received my check with three minutes to spare. The sesame meatless chicken with broccoli was yum yum yum and the brown rice was moist and fresh, not stale and overcooked like some places. I have great leftovers for tomorrow as well! If you are looking for something fairly fast, efficient and delicious then I vote Big Lantern.
author: Stephanie J.

description: The best Chinese. My personal favorites are the Basil Chicken, Taro Puffs, Sesame Balls and the Crispy Tofu, but I've never had something at Big Lantern that didn't like. The atmosphere is great for friends, groups or a date, quiet and casual.
author: John M.

description: So it's Sunday night and my roommate and I are starving... We're kinda craving Chinese food so we mull around on the internet for a bit and find the Big Lantern!!  And let me tell you, I'm so glad we did... The food was great (we went pretty generic and ordered fried rice, orange chicken, and chicken chow mein), it only took about 45 minutes to arrive (hot!!), and the prices were pretty reasonable... I can't wait to order from them again and try out the rest of the menu because I'm sure it's full of  more mouth-watery goodness! !
author: Tiffani M.

description: I thought that my drink was too sour and my food was too bland.  I got a great seat in the front window, but otherwise, I don't think I would go back here.
author: Joanna S.

description: I' m a really big fan.  While most are touting the delivery, I am all about the walk in experience.  The prices are about average, the food is really good and coming home hungry doesn't even cross my mind.  Additionally you can come here and actually have a nice quiet dinner and if you haven't consumed enough Tsingtao and sake yet, step outside and be on the door step of some mission bars.  I had a birthday dinner here and I loved being able to have a great dinner for about 11 people.  Despite the fact that other people were eating in the restaurant the waiters did acknowledge that we had a large crowd and were never too busy to accomodate us.
author: Steven R.

description: It's fast and cheap.  I love that I can get Dim Sum delivered.  Get the appetizer combo, and the dim sum combo and it will give you tons of food for under $15!  More than enough for two peeps.
author: Sheila B.

description: Overall a good Chinese delivery place.  They actually deliver Dim Sum.  That is why we use them.
author: Eric S.

description:
got a soft spot in my heart for fake meat cause i still like meat even though i quit eating it 3 years ago. its just that i don't want that soft spot in my heart  to stop working from all the fat and cholesterol in the real meat.(too many heart problems in the family)

as for the kung pao and the generals meatless chicken dishes.
perfect. the steamed buns and the fried taro are quite nice as well. its not a dim sum place per se, but they make for good appetizers.

also a good selection of tea too so you don't feel forced to order booze and don't feel like a kid getting a coke.
author: Chris G.

description: This is by far the best Chinese delivery joint in the Mission/Noe/Castro area! Believe me we have tried them all!
author: Frank R.

description: I like the food here, and I am giving them an extra star for delivering.
author: Julie B.

description: This place has the best fake meat I've EVER HAD. I'm never going to Herbivore/Golden Era/Golden Buddha ever again. Everything else is crap compared to this place. Service was fantastic.
author: Eva J.

description: I was sad when Yum Yum went out of business. However, this place is even better. They deliver efficiently 45mins but sometimes a bit sooner. We always get chopsticks, forks, and sauces. So far Ive been ordering the Basil Chicken extra spicy and pork pot stickers.Delicious! The meals always appear bright and vibrant.
author: Leeshawn N.

description: Best chinese food in the mission area. Try the dim sum dishes. Don't miss the szechuan spicy chicken. very fast delivery if you are in the area.
author: Emily Y.

description: Passable, but nothing to write home about.  If I didn't live 200 feet away, I would probably not go here.  I highly suggest the Szechuan chicken... best thing on the menu I have had.
author: Scott L.

description:
big lantern gets five stars for the food.  most of what i've tried here is greasy, tasty, good.  they would get zero for service.  men, they can screw up orders.  i have eaten here several times and wether, eating in, take out or delivery there is always a mistake.
im vegan and usually go to vegan restaurants to eat so i dont have to worry about the stuff that i worry about at this place.
when eating there i go out of my way to explain that im vegan and cant eat any meat or broth make with meat, or .... you catch my drift, right?
 once i was eating a supposedly vegan soup and found a small piece of meat, call the waitress and sent it back.  then my next dish was supposed to be the meatless chicken something, it was real chicken,  when i finally got to eat, i did enjoyed.
take out.  im a fanatic about not making waste, so when i feel like eating food from here, i take the old beaten tupperwares, some plastic bags, and the dogs and off we go to some chinese.  usually they are pretty good about taking the containers and give me the food.  once though this guy told me that they were too bussy and that would confuse the kitchen people.  went next door to pakwan, no problems with the containers, and had awesome indian food instead.
i dont call for delivery anymore.  they always send the wrong order.  my usual problem with the wrong order is that they usually send a meat dish and i just wont eat any meat.  couple of times i went down there to have it changed, others the dogs got a nice chinese snack.  but last time i figure i would just order stuff that they wont confuse.  i did order garlic eggplant and deep fried crispy tofu. the eggplant came ok, the complimentary eggless vegetable fried rice came with eggs, but crispy tofu was not sent, instead they sent some bock choi with bean curd.  i was able to eat the bok choi, but was not what i ordered.  
to conclude, at least for vegans, good place to eat if you are willing to sit down and eat there, so you know what you re getting and can send it back if the order is wrong.  if you walk there for take out, make sure you check your order before you leave so you wont be surprised at home.  never order delivery unless you'd like to be surprised.
they open late at night though, hence my several past experiences at this place, and im sure there will be more.
author: juan carlos m.

description: (I think that's what it's called.)  I was happily surprised by the dim sum.  Although admittedly skeptical when it comes to Chinese food (call me a fascist), the dim sum was tasty.  Food came pretty quickly, and was reasonably priced.  I recommend the bbq pork buns.  Yum.
author: Marykay F.

description:
we have been searching for a good chinese delivery place for a long time. this is it! hands down! i was so psyched to try this place, only to find out it's a total winner. i would say it's classified as chinese vs. dim sum. even though i totally love all their dim sum, it's not exactly the larget menu in the city. they do however, have a ton of great chinese dishes.

there are a million cheap chinese places and the meat is usually weird and the veggies questionable. this place has none of that. the prawns are fresh and the land meats are all great. i don't play vegan, so no problems for me on that front.

i love chinese food and am very critical - this place pleased me on all fronts.
author: matt n.

description: Excellent Chinese food and dim sum in the Mission, of all places!  Great dumplings and chow fun!
author: Mike T.

description: Really for vegetarian dim sum! FINALLY- a place that has vegetarian turnip cake (the only vegetarian turnip cake in the city) and to top it off its actually fantastic!! Truly a great spot for vegetarian folks wanting dim sum because its served ALL day! :) Go here and you won't be disappointed. I have gone here on weekends and granted there aren't that many people BUT please don't let that stop you. The food, service and the endless vegetarian dim sum options make this totally worth ever penny!!  Food is served quick, not super greasy and as authentic as it gets. I've had the turnip cake, meatless shu-mai, veggie dumplings, tofu roll and the meatless bun, onion pancake and all are really delicious! I can't wait to go back!
author: sue c.

description: Maybe it's just me, but they are really mean on the phone.  And they hung up on me.  I don't know.  It's just extraordinarily average.  There are like a billion better chinese places, this one just has really good real estate.   Go to Spices in the Richmond.
author: Rebecca F.

description: I was sorely disappointed.  SORELY.  We spent $40. for a completely tasteless meal.  I've eaten in the restaurant, and loved it - the dim sum is amazing - but we had it delivered for the first time, and it was terrible.  Half the broth had slopped out of the wonton soup; I had to pour it out of the bag into the bowl.  We ordered "numbing spicy mandarin noodle" - NO spice!  We expected fiery, "numbing," spicy wonderful food; it was so-so.  Maybe because I didn't sound like I could handle the fire on the phone?  Very disappointing; we were so excited about this dish!  The beef satay was nothing more than beef with vegetables and a brown sauce; no spice, no "peanut" taste that I'd expect with the mention of "satay sauce.  Again, meh.  And, my absolute favourite Chinese dish - lemon chicken - had no taste of lemon. It was just sugared chicken, and after we each had a bite or two we had to just throw it out.  It was disgusting.  Now, I order lemon chicken all the time, and know what to expect across a range of Chinese regional cooking - this was sugar and flour, and mushy chicken.  This was a complete waste of our money, and I can't imagine I'll eat there again. Steer clear - with so many truly wonderful inexpensive Chinese restaurants, why eat here?
author: R.B. W.

description: I love the fact that they serve decent dim sum all day. Not the best but it's location is key. The regular entrees - especially the half moon bay seafood special - were really good. The prices are also quite reasonable.
author: Cassandra T.

description: The first time I went there I got dim sum to go- it was horrid. Then other people convinced me to give it another chance and they were right.  In the 15 or so times since I've had good experiences. The lunch specials are a super bargain, and I'm not even sure when the cut-off is for "lunch" because I feel I've had it after 4PM. They have lots of veggie options and I get the sesame meatless chicken every darn time.
author: Camper E.

description: I eat Big Lantern like twice a week. If you are a vegetarian you have to try the sesame seed "chicken"! It is amazing. Normally when I order it takes anywhere from 20-40 mins to get to the house but last night it took 10 mins!!!! I would wait an hour for Big Lantern. I rarely find places that deliver and have fake meat. Big Lantern makes me happy as a clam!
author: Jessica G.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants... Fantastic food, great people.
Highly recommended.
author: Tala B.

description: Sadly for me, the food did not match the reputation or expectation. Twice. My take? This is some of the most boring, homogenous Chinese junk food I've ever had the displeasure to pay for. For example, it didn't seem possible to distinguish chicken siu mai from pork, and many other dishes seem to be drenched in either soy sauce or sugar - where every ingredient seemingly tastes the same and has roughly the same texture. How the heck do they acheive that? On the plus side it's cheap. If you're near "South Beach" there's better choices in my opinion.
author: Nick W.

description: I love greasy Chinese food.  It's not even all that authentic, it's just good.  I have a soft space in my heart for Big Lantern.  Any form of fake chicken from here is perfection.
author: Rhea S.

description: Haven't done the dim sum, but the full dishes are bland, and well, bland. Just kind of forgettable. Edible, and that's about it. Can't recommend it. Only wish there were some really good alternatives in the neighborhood to choose from.
author: David K.

description: Ok chinese place. good dishes overall, a littl too average-ish.
author: xavier v.

description: I used to be a devote patron of Wild Pepper and found this place to be far superior. The vegetarian options are fresher and their rating with the department of health is a safe comfort. Plus they have faux sesame chicken...
author: brandon b.

description: really old ammonia tasting shrimp in their shrimp fried rice.  really really freaking gross.  seriously.
author: Jung L.

description: fresh and tasty! i live in potrero hill, and this is the best chinese delivery around, IMO.
author: Eli F.

description: this may be the second time i've left the place saying "never again." i guess i had to remind myself. the tea flavored lamb was deep fried as a surprise, the clay pot veggies and meat had to have been cooked with half a cup of oil, and our baked pork buns tasted reheated. afterwards you get the sensation you just had a large glass of pepsi.
author: Aneuwave V.

description: I have given Big Lantern great reviews for years, but the other day I ordered one of their meatless chicken dishes and barfed my brains out shortly after eating.  I used to love them, but now can't go again.  Any restaurant that makes me sick goes immediately to the bottom of the list.
author: Customer X.

description: You know, I wanted to go with three stars for a couple reasons, but I just cant...... Something in the kitchen makes a mind numbing high pitched squeal for about 15 minutes, every 20 minutes.  It's hard to think about anything else while this is happening.  The hot and sour soup is kinda strange too.  It tastes decent but smells kinda like damp barn animal fur.  Their fake meat dishes, however, are quite good.  The soy ham is almost identical to the real deal.  even has the crease marks and rubbery texture.  So I guess if you like faux meat and are unable to hear high frequencies, then you'd probably enjoy this place.
author: Benzo K.

description: Went to this place during my lunch hour today. The service: prompt and friendly. The food: spectacular! I only wish this place was near my house and I would order from them all the time!
author: Fiuwriter C.

description:
Great neighborhood Chinese restaurant. On a cold rainy night, their combination won ton soup is awesome.  Dim sum is generally good -- some great pieces; some okay. 

Quality of products used is very high and service is fast and sure.
author: Patricia H.

description: I have to admit that I've never had a dine-in experience at Big Lantern, but as far as the food is concerned, I am a total fan.  Their meatless chicken dishes are awesome (Sesame Meatless Chix & General Meatless Chix).  Living in SF, there are 6389217803568792431 different Chinese restaurants to choose from, but most of them are really sub-par.  BL is one of the only places that I love and continue to order from.
author: Kris T.

description: This place has such unique ambiance.  It's a quiet spot, unassuming, not trying to fit in with its increasingly self-aware surroundings.  The service is good and it's never been crowded when I've gone.  I love the shrimp dumplings and the turnip cakes.  When I think of the Big Lantern I get all warm and tingly inside.
author: Lizzie T.

description: Okay. There are two roads you can go down in a recession: the "let's get away with as much rotten food, and old servings as possible" or the "we should treat all our customers as valued clients and keep them happy to come back". And unfortunately, after telling everyone about this place my last delivery was awful. The meatless general chicken was surrounded by yellow broccoli that was totally rotten. It wasn't unripe, it smelled like gym socks. Sorry guys. Never going back. Telling my friends that.
author: yuri s.

description:
Last night I finally had enough of Big Lantern.

After patronizing them for 2 years for free delivery, the spotty quality and brittle management overcame them in their valiant attempt to break the crappy Mission Chinese food curse.

Okay, so I'm asking them to add bean curd sheet to a mixed vegetable and its like I'm asking for gold plated chopsticks in Quechua.  Talk to the manager and I appear to work it out with him until we get to the part about delivery.  My order comes to about $10, and Big Lantern has always done free delivery to our home about 2 blocks away.  Manager guy says that the tab must be $15 for delivery.  Website still says free delivery.  I tell him that I'm a long term customer, patronizing them for the 2,3 years that they've been open.  He gets into an argument with me about how long they've been open--he says 1.5  yr, the website says spring 2005.

As often as not, the quality of the food is off, so they've just failed to make the cut.

I hang up in disgust and make my own food.

Big Lantern has lost a customer.
author: M S.

description: I kneel before you, oh glorious Big Lantern! I have wasted many an afternoon gorging myself to the point where I cannot get off the couch on this delicious food. Im working my way through the entire menu and have only been mildly disappointed once. I consider this an issue of acquired taste rather than the fault of the kitchen (bamboo mushroom are just frickin weird) Everything here is scrumdiddilyumptous. Delivery is eerily fast. These guys definitly know the meaning of spicy, so ask for extra chilli at your own risk! This food is seriously so good I'll probably end up looking like a big lantern myself. Thank you so much for redeeming my outlook on the Chinese delivery food in this city. :)
author: ARose T.

description: Hella good hella good hella good. Better off ordering to go though, some reason the food tastes better outta those white cartons. Good prices, too.
author: Ruby T.

description: My wife and I live in the same neighborhood as Big Lantern and have been here 5 years. We saw the place change hands from one of our favorite coffee shops to Chinese. It's taken us years to stop in and try the food and we are glad we did! A friend told me the food is good if a bit pricey but too hot for him. I love hot food so on a lark we dropped in. The place is very clean and has an enjoyable atmosphere. The staff very friendly and prompt. The food was great!! Not too hot for me but good enough. The prices are very reasonable and it seems that there is hardly much of a wait to sit. This is now on my list of go to places and also on the list for awesome take out!!
author: johann f.

description: This is a good healthy Chinese food place overall. The atmosphere is very relaxing, the food is yummy, and the portions are nicely large. Any restaurant where I can get two meals out of my dinner is a good one. My favorites are the Hong Kong style pan fried noodles, the meatless chicken (non-fried), and the meatless combination plate. Substitutions are definitely ok, and sometimes it may even become a new menu dish! The staff are courteous, they work very well to keep things going,  and service is very prompt. When dining in late, they do not rush you and one can thus savor the meal. I am a repeat customer and will go back again. I also enjoy ordering delivery...Although I don't live far away, the staff always say that it my food will arrive in 45 minutes...and then it seems to arrive in 15. :D
author: Ursula E.

description: I love this place!  Super delicious meatless dishes, dim sum, and fast delivery!
author: Irene M.

description: whatevs. yes a lot of veg options and meatless stuffs. the dim sum is way sub-par, esp the veggie dumpling. lo mein was overly sauced with weird soy-based slightly sweet sauce. sweet & sour chicken was a color not found in nature and consisted mainly of fried nuggets lacking in meat. on the plus, food came out super fast. would eat there again if the apocalypse came and it was only remaining food in SF.
author: Mary V.

description: This place is responsible for about 40% of my body weight. And that is from the potstickers alone. while we are on the topic. The potstickers are the best thing on the menu. I have dreams about the outside part, I think its hand made.
author: Chris L.

description: This place has some of the best fake meat dishes I have ever had.  In particular, the Sesame Meatless Chicken is one of my favorite dishes ever!   The sauce is perfect and the meatless chicken makes me almost question if they screwed up my order and gave me the real thing.  I went Vegan for animal compassion reasons, not because I hated the taste of meat/chicken so I want that fake meat to taste pretty close to the unfortunately murdered and tortured real thing.  They do a very convincing job of it and I have to remind myself that the amazing Sesame Meatless Chicken was not an animal with a Central Nervous System who was locked in a cage, beaten, tortured and then finally killed to feed my face.  Now doesn't that just make you want to switch to delicious meatless versions such as those that Big Lantern offers?  YES ON PROP 2!  The decor/ambiance is great and the service good. Go order the Sesame Meatless Chicken!  Do something positive for the World for once and enjoy it at the same time.  Go Vegan!
author: Roy J.

description: The sodium-soaked tofu made for a tasty chicken substitute, but the to-go containers leaked the sauces from our entrees into the plastic delivery bag, so our rice was chewy and dry beneath our lukewarm food.
author: Caroline O.

description: Vegetarian Chinese-American food and free delivery?!?  It was fantastic, all ten times I ordered form here during the month I was visiting the Mission.  The delivery was usually within the delivery estimate and if it was off it was only by about five or ten minutes.  The (meatles) kung pao, sweet and sour, lemon, and General were delicious!
author: Nicole T.

description: big lantern...you are too good. ordering delivery on a monday night and it arriving LESS than thirty minutes later when you said 45 minutes...that's awesome. the hong kong style pan fried noodle was practically still simmering when it came to my door. the food has never made me feel like crap after eating it like i have felt at other chinese places because they were too greasy. nope...not you, big lantern. how do you keep your dim sum fresh and soft...unlike the other places where dim sum is only good until 10 am. i don't know how you do it, but keep doing whatever it is that you do.
