author: Maureen B.

description: gotta take away a star. where'd all the meat in the mongolian chicken go?
author: Nini G.

description: I think this was the first time I had ever had dim sum.  It was good but the food was mysterious and reminded me of jelly fish and other radio active deep sea creatures.  Sometimes the crab legs would poke out just a bit wrapped around fried stuff.   And there were sweet buns that were bright white on the exterior  like a babies sunless bum.  And things called "puffs" and "tin foiled wrapped chicken".  The chicken should have been called pepper chicken because it was soooo peppery.  All these little dishes to share was nice and added to the conversation had it ever slowed.  The titanic song seemed to play in the background for a long time at a very slow calming entrancing way...It was warm inside and pretty peaceful.  To me it is funny because the outside looks like it might be modern inside and all hip like.  But inside it was all straight laced and traditional with gold fish and pink cloth napkins.   It was good but not great but oh so cheap!!! It was some 30 odd dollars for 4 hungry people to get stuffed to the brim!
author: Lauren S.

description: good chinese delivery in the mission.  prompt & delish!
author: Y B.

description: Good quick chinese and dim sum in the mission. Nothing special but solid and at a good price.
author: Jason S.

description: Their vegetarian selection is great; especially the kung pao "chicken." The onion cakes are mouth-watering as well, as are the sizzling rice and hot-and-sour soups. My favorite Chinese restaurant in San Francisco.
author: Wes S.

description: when i'm in the mood to curl up on the couch with the netflix and some dim sum or some salt and pepper pork- this is one of the first places i call.  it was the first menu on my door after i moved to the city- so it holds a special place in my heart.  it is really good bad chinese food-- and i mean that as a compliment.  nothing really special, but decent food and quick delivery.
author: Samantha W.

description: last night, i let my panda-express-lovin' friend choose where to eat dinner. we walked down 16th st and he decided he wanted to eat here. oh no! i'd never eaten at big lantern, but chinese restaurants aren't high on my list of places to eat. i tried to nudge him towards tokyo-go-go, but he was too hungry for sushi and the last time i convinced him to eat somewhere, he hated it. bracing myself for the worst, i was pretty surprised and excited to see they had veggie meat dishes! and they're good! my craving for general (veggie) chicken has finally been sated. next time, dim sum! you don't always find a good place for those who like panda express and people who don't. now i feel a little bad for hating on all chinese places.
author: Adrienne Y.

description: i'm a die hard jasmine tea house fan because of their fake chicken meat dishes. however, i moved out of the mission and to my sadness, jasmine tea house doesn't deliver to my new hood. so, when i heard from a friend that big lantern served up a delicious general tsao's fake chicken dish AND they deliver to my neighbourhood, i was excited as f#ck! so i placed an order for deliver the other day. the general tsao's meatless chicken was ok. it was crispier upon delivery than jasmine tea house, but it definately lacked in the overall taste department. also, the mongolian beef was pretty fatty, but i guess that's pretty common. i will not order from big lantern again. i plan on saving myself for when i can eat jasmine again ...
author: James J.

description: I'm a veggie and wanted to try thier 'meatless chicken' options and got it in the Mu Shu.  It was inedible.  I ordered both the tofu vegetable puff and the veggie pot sticker.  One was great (the potsticker?) the other was a flat greasy mess.  I'm not even sure i got the right thing.  I also got an order of lo mein - the noodles are fine after you scrape off the sauce...
author: Ali H.

description: I was a big fan of the 'Yum Yum House' on Valencia before they closed, and I heard that the folks at Big Lantern are somehow connected to Yum Yum House peeps.  The food is great, almost as good as Yum Yum House, only not served on Heath dishes.    One of my all time favorite Chinese restaurants.
author: cindy p.

description: is it weird that I eat stuff from here 2-3 times a week now?
author: Lauren V.

description: Finally, edible chinese delivery. I will not mention the names of the third rate establishments banned from bringing greasy grossness to my door, but will laud this 2nd rate establishment for the impossible: They delivered three chinese food dishes that tasted TOTALLY DIFFERENT from each other. I know you know what I mean here. The mango chicken was tender, tons of garlic, and chock full of fresh mango. The vegetable fried rice was, you know, rice, soy, veggies, but good! I asked for the mixed vegetables "szechuan" style which thoroughly upset the phone guy, but we got the spiciest, most gingery, best version of this usually boring dish I've ever had. A real mix of things, not just carrots, onions and cabbage. Pot sticker filling was ok, but I don't go for those doughy wrappers. The curry puffs were yummy. All this in 25 minutes on a Saturday night, yes! (Try to get the guy on the phone who actually says, " ... and then? ... and then?")
author: J. R.

description: Consistently good Chinese food and free fast delivery.  I'm big fan of the potstickers, chow mein, and sesame beef.
author: Margaret S.

description: really great affordable and tasty food! big fan of the fake meat..i eat meat but prefer the fake over the real. really tasty dim sum too!  not a fan of too many chinese restaurants in the city, but big lantern is my go to place.
author: Marlena G.

description: For chinese delivery food this place is great. they have tons of vegetarian options and they've never messed up my order! THe food is delicious and i love thier 5-spice chicken and moshu chicken the most.  Delivery time usually takes up to 45 minutes.
author: Lola W.

description: the dim sum here is pretty good, and they have a special: 3 shrimp dumplings, 3 pork shumai, and 3 pork buns for just 7$!!  plus, it's in the heart of the missions so you dont have to drive to the 'burbs (sunset/richmond) to get good dim sum finally!
author: vlad k.

description: best veggie dim sum. turnip cake. taro puff. enuff said.
author: Linda T.

description: great dimsum, cool neon sign, clean place overall=4 stars. a nice little reprieve from the plethora of mexican places all over 16th and valencia/mission area, as well as the mid-to-high range priced restaurants in that block. big lantern's usually open until 11 during the week, probably later on the weekends, and have a great wor wonton soup that's quite tasty. also a treat to watch the cook do his thing in the open kitchen while you wait for your takeout to be prepared. i don't know, something about restaurants not being afraid to show how the dishes are made makes me feel a bit more secure, know what I'm sayin?
author: ray e.

description: dim sum in the mission?" say "hell yeah" plenty of veggie versions...a plus!
author: Paola W.

description: I rarely review places, but after having tried Big Lantern, I definitely felt the need to say something. I ordered mostly dim sum  tonight and, although I didn't expect much since it was delivery, I didn't think it would be that bad. As soon as I tried the pork shui mai, I knew something was wrong -- it had a weird taste and was waaaaaaay too salty. The other dishes didn't taste any better either. Once my stomach started hurting, I couldn't eat anymore and decided to throw everything away. Plus, their dim sum isn't cheap either, but i guess there has to be some sort of premium for having dim sum delivered to your doorsteps (even if it's terrible). Not sure where the positive reviews below are coming from, but I'm assuming if their dim sum is this bad, then their other dishes can't be any better.
author: Peter C.

description: I love the chive dumpling with meatless chicken, sweet rice with meatless chicken bun, turnip cake and general meatless chicken. Unfortunately I get an MSG itchy, salty feeling after eating here. So I've switched to the Jasmine Tea House for veggie dim sum.
author: Sarah J.

description: I love this place for delivery and eat-in.  Food is reasonably priced and fresh.  This is the best Chinese food in the Mission.
author: Jessica M.

description: This is one of my favorite haunts in the Mission. It's close to home and I love their flaming schezuan chile fish.  You can't beat their lunch specials. Love the Hunan fish and Green Onion Pancakes.
author: Dennis D.

description: I can't say enough about Big Lantern.  I showed up around 11pm on a Thursday (they close at midnight) and was welcomed in. The service was quite good (very expedient) and the menu options were interesting and varied.  Prices were extremely inexpensive for San Francisco (I got a specialty soup, lamb entree, seafood entree, and tea with enough food for 3 and the bill was only $26).  The food was delicious, hot and fresh.  I certainly would recomend this to anyone looking for a good resonably priced chinese restaurant in San Francisco.
author: Matthew M.

description: I love Big Lantern. They have great veggie options including tasty fake meat, dessert, and they deliver! I was worried that I wouldn't find a substitute for Mayflower in Berkeley (delivery and Veggie friendly) but I have to say, Big Lantern is fantastic!
author: David H.

description: The vegetarian options are great, including dim sum. My only complaint is my coworker and I were grossly overcharged for our lunch which we ordered over the phone. Instead of getting two lunch special prices, we were charged dinner prices. The woman at the register was unwilling to recognize their error and discount the bill at all. The result was more food than we could eat and less money in our wallets. Now we get our vegetarian lunch specials at Yum-Yum House on Valencia and 17th which is also delicious and has never overcharged us.
author: Ashley T.

description: This place is AWESOME!  The food is very fresh and delicious... Delivery is easy (though at times reminds me of the seinfeld episode...) and takes about 30 minutes. Very friendly staff.  HIGHLY recommend... hard to find good chinese these days, and this place is really good.
author: Lindsay B.

description: This place just opened about a month ago and serves excellent dim sum all day long (dim sum chef is of Koi Palace fame) and delicious Chinese cuisine in general.  I went with a large group so we got a great dinner menu planned by the gracious and friendly owner.    We started with chive dumplings, Shanghai soupy pork dumplings, stuffed mushroom, mushu pork, peking duck, and duck soup with winter melon.  I was in foodie heaven.  The big platters came next - shrimp with snow peas and lily flower; seafood medley of scallop, shrimp, squid, clams, and fish with mushrooms and snow peas; garlic spinach; tofu with bamboo skin; west lake fish (flounder filet); onion and pepper lamb.  For dessert, we each got a coconut milk egg custard tart.  It was truly sublime and easy on the wallet.  We had 8 people and it was $25-30 per person for all that food which included about 10 beers.  If that's too pricey, go for lunch or just dim sum.  The rice dishes for lunch are from $4.95 - 7, and the dim sum dishes start at $2.50.  Go.  Your taste buds will thank you.
author: Lisa F.

description: omfg! this place rocks......so much so that a strange sensation took over my brain as i typed forcing the phrase "omfg! this place rocks......" from my fingers even though i dont speak like that in real life. the spinach buns, veggie spring rolls, and sesame "chicken" are delectable delights. i am in love.
author: shawna s.

description: So if I could pick Zero stars I would have because these guys deserve none! I will NEVER order from this place again. The story is I ordered food from them on Saturday night. The food was fine, really nothing special. What has completely turned me off from them is that they charged someone elses order to my card that night (along with my own). I called them immediately when I realized that I had two charges from their restaurant in one night and was told by the gentleman who answered the phone that he would have to speak with his manager. The next day after not hearing back from anyone I called again and was again and told they would look at their receipts and credit car transactions. Finally three days after the initial call I was called back and told that they couldn't credit my credit card and asked if I had friends that lived on Church Street who may have used my credit card. I told them that absolutely wasn't the case and they offered to give me a store credit. So even when they realized that they had charged my card for two different orders and one was clearly not mine they still wouldn't refund me my money. At that point, I realized that the only way I was going to get my money back from them was to dispute the charge so have now taken it up with my credit card company. Needless to say I will NEVER order food from Big Lantern again and I would advise anyone paying with a credit card to never order from them either.
author: Mara Z.

description: some things are good to pretty good (meatless generals chicken, vegetable mu shu, sweet turnip steamed buns) other things are pretty awful (veggie potstickers, mango pudding -ick!). really hit or miss...and who wants half of their meal to be inedible, especially when ordering delivery?
author: tonya d.

description: i'm sorry, but this ain't no yum yum house. where's my delcious pot stickers? the sauce is not so good and they fell apart. veggies are not as fresh, food not as good. first time i went here i thought, mm! this is really good! then i got food poisoning. ugh. vowed never to go back, but since yum yum house was incorporated into this place, i figured i'd try again. and this ain't no yum yum house. not going back. :( i miss yum yum.
author: Burleigh Girl G.

description: we've been taste-testing chow fun around town (chow fun fun!), and so we tried this place, which now sits next to a bunch of other restaurants we frequent, in what was a generic Mission coffeehouse. so anyway, the chow fun, although not novel in any way, was so fresh and good! since then, we've been trying out their various teas, and today we tried the dim sum dishes; the vegie stuff is actually spectacular! try the fried taro thing and the tofu roll. also, today we were greeted by the proprietor of jasmine tea house, who informed us that his wife and sister run big lantern, and he was around to help out. which goes a long way to explain how they were able to open a restaurant so assuredly. actually i think i prefer big lantern. while jasmine is exceptional, it tends to have a "house style," whereas i feel like the emphasis at big lantern is on the dish at hand, and not an overarching taste. in other words, this is straightforward, excellent, chinese.
author: jeremy l.
